106 #if defined(HAVE_TIMES) || defined(_WIN32)
107 static VALUE rb_cProcessTms;

109 
110 #ifndef WIFEXITED
111 #define WIFEXITED(w) (((w) & 0xff) == 0)
112 #endif
113 #ifndef WIFSIGNALED
114 #define WIFSIGNALED(w) (((w) & 0x7f) > 0 && (((w) & 0x7f) < 0x7f))
115 #endif
116 #ifndef WIFSTOPPED
117 #define WIFSTOPPED(w) (((w) & 0xff) == 0x7f)
118 #endif
119 #ifndef WEXITSTATUS
120 #define WEXITSTATUS(w) (((w) >> 8) & 0xff)
121 #endif
122 #ifndef WTERMSIG
123 #define WTERMSIG(w) ((w) & 0x7f)
124 #endif
125 #ifndef WSTOPSIG
126 #define WSTOPSIG WEXITSTATUS
127 #endif
128 
129 #if defined(__FreeBSD__) || defined(__NetBSD__) || defined(__OpenBSD__) || defined(__bsdi__)
130 #define HAVE_44BSD_SETUID 1
131 #define HAVE_44BSD_SETGID 1
132 #endif

135 #undef HAVE_SETRUID
136 #undef HAVE_SETRGID
137 #endif

142 #endif

144 #define setregid ruby_setregid

146 #endif

153 #define OBSOLETE_SETREGID 1
154 #endif

157 #define preserving_errno(stmts) \
158  do {int saved_errno = errno; stmts; errno = saved_errno;} while (0)

160 static void check_uid_switch(void);
161 static void check_gid_switch(void);

163 #if 1
164 #define p_uid_from_name p_uid_from_name
165 #define p_gid_from_name p_gid_from_name

167 
168 #if defined(HAVE_PWD_H)
169 # if defined(HAVE_GETPWNAM_R) && defined(_SC_GETPW_R_SIZE_MAX)
170 # define USE_GETPWNAM_R 1
171 # define GETPW_R_SIZE_INIT sysconf(_SC_GETPW_R_SIZE_MAX)
172 # define GETPW_R_SIZE_DEFAULT 0x1000
173 # define GETPW_R_SIZE_LIMIT 0x10000
174 # endif
175 # ifdef USE_GETPWNAM_R
176 # define PREPARE_GETPWNAM \
177  VALUE getpw_buf = 0
178 # define FINISH_GETPWNAM \
179  ALLOCV_END(getpw_buf)
180 # define OBJ2UID1(id) obj2uid((id), &getpw_buf)
181 # define OBJ2UID(id) obj2uid0(id)
182 static rb_uid_t obj2uid(VALUE id, VALUE *getpw_buf);
183 static inline rb_uid_t
184 obj2uid0(VALUE id)
185 {
186  rb_uid_t uid;
187  PREPARE_GETPWNAM;
188  uid = OBJ2UID1(id);
189  FINISH_GETPWNAM;
190  return uid;
191 }
192 # else
193 # define PREPARE_GETPWNAM /* do nothing */
194 # define FINISH_GETPWNAM /* do nothing */
195 # define OBJ2UID1(id) obj2uid((id))
196 # define OBJ2UID(id) obj2uid((id))
197 static rb_uid_t obj2uid(VALUE id);
198 # endif
199 #else
200 # define PREPARE_GETPWNAM /* do nothing */
201 # define FINISH_GETPWNAM /* do nothing */
202 # define OBJ2UID1(id) NUM2UIDT(id)
203 # define OBJ2UID(id) NUM2UIDT(id)
204 # ifdef p_uid_from_name
205 # undef p_uid_from_name
206 # define p_uid_from_name rb_f_notimplement
207 # endif
208 #endif
209 
210 #if defined(HAVE_GRP_H)
211 # if defined(HAVE_GETGRNAM_R) && defined(_SC_GETGR_R_SIZE_MAX)
212 # define USE_GETGRNAM_R
213 # define GETGR_R_SIZE_INIT sysconf(_SC_GETGR_R_SIZE_MAX)
214 # define GETGR_R_SIZE_DEFAULT 0x1000
215 # define GETGR_R_SIZE_LIMIT 0x10000
216 # endif
217 # ifdef USE_GETGRNAM_R
218 # define PREPARE_GETGRNAM \
219  VALUE getgr_buf = 0
220 # define FINISH_GETGRNAM \
221  ALLOCV_END(getgr_buf)
222 # define OBJ2GID1(id) obj2gid((id), &getgr_buf)
223 # define OBJ2GID(id) obj2gid0(id)
224 static rb_gid_t obj2gid(VALUE id, VALUE *getgr_buf);
225 static inline rb_gid_t
226 obj2gid0(VALUE id)
227 {
228  rb_gid_t gid;
229  PREPARE_GETGRNAM;
230  gid = OBJ2GID1(id);
231  FINISH_GETGRNAM;
232  return gid;
233 }
234 static rb_gid_t obj2gid(VALUE id, VALUE *getgr_buf);
235 # else
236 # define PREPARE_GETGRNAM /* do nothing */
237 # define FINISH_GETGRNAM /* do nothing */
238 # define OBJ2GID1(id) obj2gid((id))
239 # define OBJ2GID(id) obj2gid((id))
240 static rb_gid_t obj2gid(VALUE id);
241 # endif
242 #else
243 # define PREPARE_GETGRNAM /* do nothing */
244 # define FINISH_GETGRNAM /* do nothing */
245 # define OBJ2GID1(id) NUM2GIDT(id)
246 # define OBJ2GID(id) NUM2GIDT(id)
247 # ifdef p_gid_from_name
248 # undef p_gid_from_name
249 # define p_gid_from_name rb_f_notimplement
250 # endif
251 #endif

253 #if SIZEOF_CLOCK_T == SIZEOF_INT
254 typedef unsigned int unsigned_clock_t;
255 #elif SIZEOF_CLOCK_T == SIZEOF_LONG
256 typedef unsigned long unsigned_clock_t;
257 #elif defined(HAVE_LONG_LONG) && SIZEOF_CLOCK_T == SIZEOF_LONG_LONG
258 typedef unsigned LONG_LONG unsigned_clock_t;
259 #endif

261 static ID id_in, id_out, id_err, id_pid, id_uid, id_gid;
262 static ID id_close, id_child;
263 #ifdef HAVE_SETPGID
264 static ID id_pgroup;
265 #endif
266 #ifdef _WIN32
267 static ID id_new_pgroup;
268 #endif
269 static ID id_unsetenv_others, id_chdir, id_umask, id_close_others, id_ENV;
270 static ID id_nanosecond, id_microsecond, id_millisecond, id_second;
271 static ID id_float_microsecond, id_float_millisecond, id_float_second;
272 static ID id_GETTIMEOFDAY_BASED_CLOCK_REALTIME, id_TIME_BASED_CLOCK_REALTIME;
273 #ifdef HAVE_TIMES
274 static ID id_TIMES_BASED_CLOCK_MONOTONIC;
275 static ID id_TIMES_BASED_CLOCK_PROCESS_CPUTIME_ID;
276 #endif
277 #ifdef RUSAGE_SELF
278 static ID id_GETRUSAGE_BASED_CLOCK_PROCESS_CPUTIME_ID;
279 #endif
280 static ID id_CLOCK_BASED_CLOCK_PROCESS_CPUTIME_ID;
281 #ifdef __APPLE__
282 static ID id_MACH_ABSOLUTE_TIME_BASED_CLOCK_MONOTONIC;
283 #endif
284 static ID id_hertz;
285 extern ID ruby_static_id_status;
286 #define id_status ruby_static_id_status

288 /*#define DEBUG_REDIRECT*/
289 #if defined(DEBUG_REDIRECT)
290 
291 #include <stdarg.h>
292 
293 static void
294 ttyprintf(const char *fmt, ...)
295 {
296  va_list ap;
297  FILE *tty;
298  int save = errno;
299 #ifdef _WIN32
300  tty = fopen("con", "w");
301 #else
302  tty = fopen("/dev/tty", "w");
303 #endif
304  if (!tty)
305  return;
306 
307  va_start(ap, fmt);
308  vfprintf(tty, fmt, ap);
309  va_end(ap);
310  fclose(tty);
311  errno = save;
312 }
313 
314 static int
315 redirect_dup(int oldfd)
316 {
317  int ret;
318  ret = dup(oldfd);
319  ttyprintf("dup(%d) => %d\n", oldfd, ret);
320  return ret;
321 }
322 
323 static int
324 redirect_dup2(int oldfd, int newfd)
325 {
326  int ret;
327  ret = dup2(oldfd, newfd);
328  ttyprintf("dup2(%d, %d) => %d\n", oldfd, newfd, ret);
329  return ret;
330 }
331 
332 static int
333 redirect_close(int fd)
334 {
335  int ret;
336  ret = close(fd);
337  ttyprintf("close(%d) => %d\n", fd, ret);
338  return ret;
339 }
340 
341 static int
342 parent_redirect_open(const char *pathname, int flags, mode_t perm)
343 {
344  int ret;
345  ret = rb_cloexec_open(pathname, flags, perm);
346  ttyprintf("parent_open(\"%s\", 0x%x, 0%o) => %d\n", pathname, flags, perm, ret);
347  return ret;
348 }
349 
350 static int
351 parent_redirect_close(int fd)
352 {
353  int ret;
354  ret = close(fd);
355  ttyprintf("parent_close(%d) => %d\n", fd, ret);
356  return ret;
357 }
358 
359 #else
360 #define redirect_dup(oldfd) dup(oldfd)
361 #define redirect_dup2(oldfd, newfd) dup2((oldfd), (newfd))
362 #define redirect_close(fd) close(fd)
363 #define parent_redirect_open(pathname, flags, perm) rb_cloexec_open((pathname), (flags), (perm))
364 #define parent_redirect_close(fd) close(fd)
365 #endif
366 
367 /*
368  * call-seq:
369  * Process.pid -> fixnum
370  *
371  * Returns the process id of this process. Not available on all
372  * platforms.
373  *
374  * Process.pid #=> 27415
375  */
376 
377 static VALUE
378 get_pid(void)
379 {
380  rb_secure(2);
381  return PIDT2NUM(getpid());
382 }
383 
384 
385 /*
386  * call-seq:
387  * Process.ppid -> fixnum
388  *
389  * Returns the process id of the parent of this process. Returns
390  * untrustworthy value on Win32/64. Not available on all platforms.
391  *
392  * puts "I am #{Process.pid}"
393  * Process.fork { puts "Dad is #{Process.ppid}" }
394  *
395  * <em>produces:</em>
396  *
397  * I am 27417
398  * Dad is 27417
399  */
400 
401 static VALUE
402 get_ppid(void)
403 {
404  rb_secure(2);
405  return PIDT2NUM(getppid());
406 }
407 
408 
409 /*********************************************************************
410  *
411  * Document-class: Process::Status
412  *
413  * <code>Process::Status</code> encapsulates the information on the
414  * status of a running or terminated system process. The built-in
415  * variable <code>$?</code> is either +nil+ or a
416  * <code>Process::Status</code> object.
417  *
418  * fork { exit 99 } #=> 26557
419  * Process.wait #=> 26557
420  * $?.class #=> Process::Status
421  * $?.to_i #=> 25344
422  * $? >> 8 #=> 99
423  * $?.stopped? #=> false
424  * $?.exited? #=> true
425  * $?.exitstatus #=> 99
426  *
427  * Posix systems record information on processes using a 16-bit
428  * integer. The lower bits record the process status (stopped,
429  * exited, signaled) and the upper bits possibly contain additional
430  * information (for example the program's return code in the case of
431  * exited processes). Pre Ruby 1.8, these bits were exposed directly
432  * to the Ruby program. Ruby now encapsulates these in a
433  * <code>Process::Status</code> object. To maximize compatibility,
434  * however, these objects retain a bit-oriented interface. In the
435  * descriptions that follow, when we talk about the integer value of
436  * _stat_, we're referring to this 16 bit value.
437  */
438 
439 static VALUE rb_cProcessStatus;
440 
441 VALUE
442 rb_last_status_get(void)
443 {
444  return GET_THREAD()->last_status;
445 }
446 
447 void
448 rb_last_status_set(int status, rb_pid_t pid)
449 {
450  rb_thread_t *th = GET_THREAD();
451  th->last_status = rb_obj_alloc(rb_cProcessStatus);
452  rb_ivar_set(th->last_status, id_status, INT2FIX(status));
453  rb_ivar_set(th->last_status, id_pid, PIDT2NUM(pid));
454 }
455 
456 void
457 rb_last_status_clear(void)
458 {
459  GET_THREAD()->last_status = Qnil;
460 }
461 
462 /*
463  * call-seq:
464  * stat.to_i -> fixnum
465  * stat.to_int -> fixnum
466  *
467  * Returns the bits in _stat_ as a <code>Fixnum</code>. Poking
468  * around in these bits is platform dependent.
469  *
470  * fork { exit 0xab } #=> 26566
471  * Process.wait #=> 26566
472  * sprintf('%04x', $?.to_i) #=> "ab00"
473  */
474 
475 static VALUE
476 pst_to_i(VALUE st)
477 {
478  return rb_ivar_get(st, id_status);
479 }
480 
481 #define PST2INT(st) NUM2INT(pst_to_i(st))
482 
483 /*
484  * call-seq:
485  * stat.pid -> fixnum
486  *
487  * Returns the process ID that this status object represents.
488  *
489  * fork { exit } #=> 26569
490  * Process.wait #=> 26569
491  * $?.pid #=> 26569
492  */
493 
494 static VALUE
495 pst_pid(VALUE st)
496 {
497  return rb_attr_get(st, id_pid);
498 }
499 
500 static void
501 pst_message(VALUE str, rb_pid_t pid, int status)
502 {
503  rb_str_catf(str, "pid %ld", (long)pid);
504  if (WIFSTOPPED(status)) {
505  int stopsig = WSTOPSIG(status);
506  const char *signame = ruby_signal_name(stopsig);
507  if (signame) {
508  rb_str_catf(str, " stopped SIG%s (signal %d)", signame, stopsig);
509  }
510  else {
511  rb_str_catf(str, " stopped signal %d", stopsig);
512  }
513  }
514  if (WIFSIGNALED(status)) {
515  int termsig = WTERMSIG(status);
516  const char *signame = ruby_signal_name(termsig);
517  if (signame) {
518  rb_str_catf(str, " SIG%s (signal %d)", signame, termsig);
519  }
520  else {
521  rb_str_catf(str, " signal %d", termsig);
522  }
523  }
524  if (WIFEXITED(status)) {
525  rb_str_catf(str, " exit %d", WEXITSTATUS(status));
526  }
527 #ifdef WCOREDUMP
528  if (WCOREDUMP(status)) {
529  rb_str_cat2(str, " (core dumped)");
530  }
531 #endif
532 }
533 
534 
535 /*
536  * call-seq:
537  * stat.to_s -> string
538  *
539  * Show pid and exit status as a string.
540  *
541  * system("false")
542  * p $?.to_s #=> "pid 12766 exit 1"
543  *
544  */
545 
546 static VALUE
547 pst_to_s(VALUE st)
548 {
549  rb_pid_t pid;
550  int status;
551  VALUE str;
552 
553  pid = NUM2PIDT(pst_pid(st));
554  status = PST2INT(st);
555 
556  str = rb_str_buf_new(0);
557  pst_message(str, pid, status);
558  return str;
559 }
560 
561 
562 /*
563  * call-seq:
564  * stat.inspect -> string
565  *
566  * Override the inspection method.
567  *
568  * system("false")
569  * p $?.inspect #=> "#<Process::Status: pid 12861 exit 1>"
570  *
571  */
572 
573 static VALUE
574 pst_inspect(VALUE st)
575 {
576  rb_pid_t pid;
577  int status;
578  VALUE vpid, str;
579 
580  vpid = pst_pid(st);
581  if (NIL_P(vpid)) {
582  return rb_sprintf("#<%s: uninitialized>", rb_class2name(CLASS_OF(st)));
583  }
584  pid = NUM2PIDT(vpid);
585  status = PST2INT(st);
586 
587  str = rb_sprintf("#<%s: ", rb_class2name(CLASS_OF(st)));
588  pst_message(str, pid, status);
589  rb_str_cat2(str, ">");
590  return str;
591 }
592 
593 
594 /*
595  * call-seq:
596  * stat == other -> true or false
597  *
598  * Returns +true+ if the integer value of _stat_
599  * equals <em>other</em>.
600  */
601 
602 static VALUE
603 pst_equal(VALUE st1, VALUE st2)
604 {
605  if (st1 == st2) return Qtrue;
606  return rb_equal(pst_to_i(st1), st2);
607 }
608 
609 
610 /*
611  * call-seq:
612  * stat & num -> fixnum
613  *
614  * Logical AND of the bits in _stat_ with <em>num</em>.
615  *
616  * fork { exit 0x37 }
617  * Process.wait
618  * sprintf('%04x', $?.to_i) #=> "3700"
619  * sprintf('%04x', $? & 0x1e00) #=> "1600"
620  */
621 
622 static VALUE
623 pst_bitand(VALUE st1, VALUE st2)
624 {
625  int status = PST2INT(st1) & NUM2INT(st2);
626 
627  return INT2NUM(status);
628 }
629 
630 
631 /*
632  * call-seq:
633  * stat >> num -> fixnum
634  *
635  * Shift the bits in _stat_ right <em>num</em> places.
636  *
637  * fork { exit 99 } #=> 26563
638  * Process.wait #=> 26563
639  * $?.to_i #=> 25344
640  * $? >> 8 #=> 99
641  */
642 
643 static VALUE
644 pst_rshift(VALUE st1, VALUE st2)
645 {
646  int status = PST2INT(st1) >> NUM2INT(st2);
647 
648  return INT2NUM(status);
649 }
650 
651 
652 /*
653  * call-seq:
654  * stat.stopped? -> true or false
655  *
656  * Returns +true+ if this process is stopped. This is only
657  * returned if the corresponding <code>wait</code> call had the
658  * <code>WUNTRACED</code> flag set.
659  */
660 
661 static VALUE
662 pst_wifstopped(VALUE st)
663 {
664  int status = PST2INT(st);
665 
666  if (WIFSTOPPED(status))
667  return Qtrue;
668  else
669  return Qfalse;
670 }
671 
672 
673 /*
674  * call-seq:
675  * stat.stopsig -> fixnum or nil
676  *
677  * Returns the number of the signal that caused _stat_ to stop
678  * (or +nil+ if self is not stopped).
679  */
680 
681 static VALUE
682 pst_wstopsig(VALUE st)
683 {
684  int status = PST2INT(st);
685 
686  if (WIFSTOPPED(status))
687  return INT2NUM(WSTOPSIG(status));
688  return Qnil;
689 }
690 
691 
692 /*
693  * call-seq:
694  * stat.signaled? -> true or false
695  *
696  * Returns +true+ if _stat_ terminated because of
697  * an uncaught signal.
698  */
699 
700 static VALUE
701 pst_wifsignaled(VALUE st)
702 {
703  int status = PST2INT(st);
704 
705  if (WIFSIGNALED(status))
706  return Qtrue;
707  else
708  return Qfalse;
709 }
710 
711 
712 /*
713  * call-seq:
714  * stat.termsig -> fixnum or nil
715  *
716  * Returns the number of the signal that caused _stat_ to
717  * terminate (or +nil+ if self was not terminated by an
718  * uncaught signal).
719  */
720 
721 static VALUE
722 pst_wtermsig(VALUE st)
723 {
724  int status = PST2INT(st);
725 
726  if (WIFSIGNALED(status))
727  return INT2NUM(WTERMSIG(status));
728  return Qnil;
729 }
730 
731 
732 /*
733  * call-seq:
734  * stat.exited? -> true or false
735  *
736  * Returns +true+ if _stat_ exited normally (for
737  * example using an <code>exit()</code> call or finishing the
738  * program).
739  */
740 
741 static VALUE
742 pst_wifexited(VALUE st)
743 {
744  int status = PST2INT(st);
745 
746  if (WIFEXITED(status))
747  return Qtrue;
748  else
749  return Qfalse;
750 }
751 
752 
753 /*
754  * call-seq:
755  * stat.exitstatus -> fixnum or nil
756  *
757  * Returns the least significant eight bits of the return code of
758  * _stat_. Only available if <code>exited?</code> is
759  * +true+.
760  *
761  * fork { } #=> 26572
762  * Process.wait #=> 26572
763  * $?.exited? #=> true
764  * $?.exitstatus #=> 0
765  *
766  * fork { exit 99 } #=> 26573
767  * Process.wait #=> 26573
768  * $?.exited? #=> true
769  * $?.exitstatus #=> 99
770  */
771 
772 static VALUE
773 pst_wexitstatus(VALUE st)
774 {
775  int status = PST2INT(st);
776 
777  if (WIFEXITED(status))
778  return INT2NUM(WEXITSTATUS(status));
779  return Qnil;
780 }
781 
782 
783 /*
784  * call-seq:
785  * stat.success? -> true, false or nil
786  *
787  * Returns +true+ if _stat_ is successful, +false+ if not.
788  * Returns +nil+ if <code>exited?</code> is not +true+.
789  */
790 
791 static VALUE
792 pst_success_p(VALUE st)
793 {
794  int status = PST2INT(st);
795 
796  if (!WIFEXITED(status))
797  return Qnil;
798  return WEXITSTATUS(status) == EXIT_SUCCESS ? Qtrue : Qfalse;
799 }
800 
801 
802 /*
803  * call-seq:
804  * stat.coredump? -> true or false
805  *
806  * Returns +true+ if _stat_ generated a coredump
807  * when it terminated. Not available on all platforms.
808  */
809 
810 static VALUE
811 pst_wcoredump(VALUE st)
812 {
813 #ifdef WCOREDUMP
814  int status = PST2INT(st);
815 
816  if (WCOREDUMP(status))
817  return Qtrue;
818  else
819  return Qfalse;
820 #else
821  return Qfalse;
822 #endif
823 }
824 
825 struct waitpid_arg {
826  rb_pid_t pid;
827  int flags;
828  int *st;
829 };
830 
831 static void *
832 rb_waitpid_blocking(void *data)
833 {
834  rb_pid_t result;
835  struct waitpid_arg *arg = data;
836 
837 #if defined HAVE_WAITPID
838  result = waitpid(arg->pid, arg->st, arg->flags);
839 #elif defined HAVE_WAIT4
840  result = wait4(arg->pid, arg->st, arg->flags, NULL);
841 #else
842 # error waitpid or wait4 is required.
843 #endif
844 
845  return (void *)(VALUE)result;
846 }
847 
848 rb_pid_t
849 rb_waitpid(rb_pid_t pid, int *st, int flags)
850 {
851  rb_pid_t result;
852  struct waitpid_arg arg;
853 
854  retry:
855  arg.pid = pid;
856  arg.st = st;
857  arg.flags = flags;
858  result = (rb_pid_t)(VALUE)rb_thread_call_without_gvl(rb_waitpid_blocking, &arg,
859  RUBY_UBF_PROCESS, 0);
860  if (result < 0) {
861  if (errno == EINTR) {
862  RUBY_VM_CHECK_INTS(GET_THREAD());
863  goto retry;
864  }
865  return (rb_pid_t)-1;
866  }
867  if (result > 0) {
868  rb_last_status_set(*st, result);
869  }
870  return result;
871 }
872 
873 
874 /* [MG]:FIXME: I wasn't sure how this should be done, since ::wait()
875  has historically been documented as if it didn't take any arguments
876  despite the fact that it's just an alias for ::waitpid(). The way I
877  have it below is more truthful, but a little confusing.
878 
879  I also took the liberty of putting in the pid values, as they're
880  pretty useful, and it looked as if the original 'ri' output was
881  supposed to contain them after "[...]depending on the value of
882  aPid:".
883 
884  The 'ansi' and 'bs' formats of the ri output don't display the
885  definition list for some reason, but the plain text one does.
886  */
887 
888 /*
889  * call-seq:
890  * Process.wait() -> fixnum
891  * Process.wait(pid=-1, flags=0) -> fixnum
892  * Process.waitpid(pid=-1, flags=0) -> fixnum
893  *
894  * Waits for a child process to exit, returns its process id, and
895  * sets <code>$?</code> to a <code>Process::Status</code> object
896  * containing information on that process. Which child it waits on
897  * depends on the value of _pid_:
898  *
899  * > 0:: Waits for the child whose process ID equals _pid_.
900  *
901  * 0:: Waits for any child whose process group ID equals that of the
902  * calling process.
903  *
904  * -1:: Waits for any child process (the default if no _pid_ is
905  * given).
906  *
907  * < -1:: Waits for any child whose process group ID equals the absolute
908  * value of _pid_.
909  *
910  * The _flags_ argument may be a logical or of the flag values
911  * <code>Process::WNOHANG</code> (do not block if no child available)
912  * or <code>Process::WUNTRACED</code> (return stopped children that
913  * haven't been reported). Not all flags are available on all
914  * platforms, but a flag value of zero will work on all platforms.
915  *
916  * Calling this method raises a SystemCallError if there are no child
917  * processes. Not available on all platforms.
918  *
919  * include Process
920  * fork { exit 99 } #=> 27429
921  * wait #=> 27429
922  * $?.exitstatus #=> 99
923  *
924  * pid = fork { sleep 3 } #=> 27440
925  * Time.now #=> 2008-03-08 19:56:16 +0900
926  * waitpid(pid, Process::WNOHANG) #=> nil
927  * Time.now #=> 2008-03-08 19:56:16 +0900
928  * waitpid(pid, 0) #=> 27440
929  * Time.now #=> 2008-03-08 19:56:19 +0900
930  */
931 
932 static VALUE
933 proc_wait(int argc, VALUE *argv)
934 {
935  VALUE vpid, vflags;
936  rb_pid_t pid;
937  int flags, status;
938 
939  rb_secure(2);
940  flags = 0;
941  if (argc == 0) {
942  pid = -1;
943  }
944  else {
945  rb_scan_args(argc, argv, "02", &vpid, &vflags);
946  pid = NUM2PIDT(vpid);
947  if (argc == 2 && !NIL_P(vflags)) {
948  flags = NUM2UINT(vflags);
949  }
950  }
951  if ((pid = rb_waitpid(pid, &status, flags)) < 0)
952  rb_sys_fail(0);
953  if (pid == 0) {
954  rb_last_status_clear();
955  return Qnil;
956  }
957  return PIDT2NUM(pid);
958 }
959 
960 
961 /*
962  * call-seq:
963  * Process.wait2(pid=-1, flags=0) -> [pid, status]
964  * Process.waitpid2(pid=-1, flags=0) -> [pid, status]
965  *
966  * Waits for a child process to exit (see Process::waitpid for exact
967  * semantics) and returns an array containing the process id and the
968  * exit status (a <code>Process::Status</code> object) of that
969  * child. Raises a SystemCallError if there are no child processes.
970  *
971  * Process.fork { exit 99 } #=> 27437
972  * pid, status = Process.wait2
973  * pid #=> 27437
974  * status.exitstatus #=> 99
975  */
976 
977 static VALUE
978 proc_wait2(int argc, VALUE *argv)
979 {
980  VALUE pid = proc_wait(argc, argv);
981  if (NIL_P(pid)) return Qnil;
982  return rb_assoc_new(pid, rb_last_status_get());
983 }
984 
985 
986 /*
987  * call-seq:
988  * Process.waitall -> [ [pid1,status1], ...]
989  *
990  * Waits for all children, returning an array of
991  * _pid_/_status_ pairs (where _status_ is a
992  * <code>Process::Status</code> object).
993  *
994  * fork { sleep 0.2; exit 2 } #=> 27432
995  * fork { sleep 0.1; exit 1 } #=> 27433
996  * fork { exit 0 } #=> 27434
997  * p Process.waitall
998  *
999  * <em>produces</em>:
1000  *
1001  * [[30982, #<Process::Status: pid 30982 exit 0>],
1002  * [30979, #<Process::Status: pid 30979 exit 1>],
1003  * [30976, #<Process::Status: pid 30976 exit 2>]]
1004  */
1005 
1006 static VALUE
1007 proc_waitall(void)
1008 {
1009  VALUE result;
1010  rb_pid_t pid;
1011  int status;
1012 
1013  rb_secure(2);
1014  result = rb_ary_new();
1015  rb_last_status_clear();
1016 
1017  for (pid = -1;;) {
1018  pid = rb_waitpid(-1, &status, 0);
1019  if (pid == -1) {
1020  if (errno == ECHILD)
1021  break;
1022  rb_sys_fail(0);
1023  }
1024  rb_ary_push(result, rb_assoc_new(PIDT2NUM(pid), rb_last_status_get()));
1025  }
1026  return result;
1027 }
1028 
1029 static VALUE rb_cWaiter;
1030 
1031 static VALUE
1032 detach_process_pid(VALUE thread)
1033 {
1034  return rb_thread_local_aref(thread, id_pid);
1035 }
1036 
1037 static VALUE
1038 detach_process_watcher(void *arg)
1039 {
1040  rb_pid_t cpid, pid = (rb_pid_t)(VALUE)arg;
1041  int status;
1042 
1043  while ((cpid = rb_waitpid(pid, &status, 0)) == 0) {
1044  /* wait while alive */
1045  }
1046  return rb_last_status_get();
1047 }
1048 
1049 VALUE
1050 rb_detach_process(rb_pid_t pid)
1051 {
1052  VALUE watcher = rb_thread_create(detach_process_watcher, (void*)(VALUE)pid);
1053  rb_thread_local_aset(watcher, id_pid, PIDT2NUM(pid));
1054  RBASIC_SET_CLASS(watcher, rb_cWaiter);
1055  return watcher;
1056 }
1057 
1058 
1059 /*
1060  * call-seq:
1061  * Process.detach(pid) -> thread
1062  *
1063  * Some operating systems retain the status of terminated child
1064  * processes until the parent collects that status (normally using
1065  * some variant of <code>wait()</code>). If the parent never collects
1066  * this status, the child stays around as a <em>zombie</em> process.
1067  * <code>Process::detach</code> prevents this by setting up a
1068  * separate Ruby thread whose sole job is to reap the status of the
1069  * process _pid_ when it terminates. Use <code>detach</code>
1070  * only when you do not intent to explicitly wait for the child to
1071  * terminate.
1072  *
1073  * The waiting thread returns the exit status of the detached process
1074  * when it terminates, so you can use <code>Thread#join</code> to
1075  * know the result. If specified _pid_ is not a valid child process
1076  * ID, the thread returns +nil+ immediately.
1077  *
1078  * The waiting thread has <code>pid</code> method which returns the pid.
1079  *
1080  * In this first example, we don't reap the first child process, so
1081  * it appears as a zombie in the process status display.
1082  *
1083  * p1 = fork { sleep 0.1 }
1084  * p2 = fork { sleep 0.2 }
1085  * Process.waitpid(p2)
1086  * sleep 2
1087  * system("ps -ho pid,state -p #{p1}")
1088  *
1089  * <em>produces:</em>
1090  *
1091  * 27389 Z
1092  *
1093  * In the next example, <code>Process::detach</code> is used to reap
1094  * the child automatically.
1095  *
1096  * p1 = fork { sleep 0.1 }
1097  * p2 = fork { sleep 0.2 }
1098  * Process.detach(p1)
1099  * Process.waitpid(p2)
1100  * sleep 2
1101  * system("ps -ho pid,state -p #{p1}")
1102  *
1103  * <em>(produces no output)</em>
1104  */
1105 
1106 static VALUE
1107 proc_detach(VALUE obj, VALUE pid)
1108 {
1109  rb_secure(2);
1110  return rb_detach_process(NUM2PIDT(pid));
1111 }
1112 
1113 #ifdef SIGPIPE
1114 static RETSIGTYPE (*saved_sigpipe_handler)(int) = 0;
1115 #endif
1116 
1117 #ifdef SIGPIPE
1118 static RETSIGTYPE
1119 sig_do_nothing(int sig)
1120 {
1121 }
1122 #endif
1123 
1124 /* This function should be async-signal-safe. Actually it is. */
1125 static void
1126 before_exec_async_signal_safe(void)
1127 {
1128 #ifdef SIGPIPE
1129  /*
1130  * Some OS commands don't initialize signal handler properly. Thus we have
1131  * to reset signal handler before exec(). Otherwise, system() and similar
1132  * child process interaction might fail. (e.g. ruby -e "system 'yes | ls'")
1133  * [ruby-dev:12261]
1134  */
1135  saved_sigpipe_handler = signal(SIGPIPE, sig_do_nothing); /* async-signal-safe */
1136 #endif
1137 }
1138 
1139 static void
1140 before_exec_non_async_signal_safe(void)
1141 {
1142  /*
1143  * On Mac OS X 10.5.x (Leopard) or earlier, exec() may return ENOTSUP
1144  * if the process have multiple threads. Therefore we have to kill
1145  * internal threads temporary. [ruby-core:10583]
1146  * This is also true on Haiku. It returns Errno::EPERM against exec()
1147  * in multiple threads.
1148  */
1149  rb_thread_stop_timer_thread(0);
1150 }
1151 
1152 static void
1153 before_exec(void)
1154 {
1155  before_exec_non_async_signal_safe();
1156  before_exec_async_signal_safe();
1157 }
1158 
1159 /* This function should be async-signal-safe. Actually it is. */
1160 static void
1161 after_exec_async_signal_safe(void)
1162 {
1163 #ifdef SIGPIPE
1164  signal(SIGPIPE, saved_sigpipe_handler); /* async-signal-safe */
1165 #endif
1166 }
1167 
1168 static void
1169 after_exec_non_async_signal_safe(void)
1170 {
1171  rb_thread_reset_timer_thread();
1172  rb_thread_start_timer_thread();
1173 }
1174 
1175 static void
1176 after_exec(void)
1177 {
1178  after_exec_async_signal_safe();
1179  after_exec_non_async_signal_safe();
1180 }
1181 
1182 #define before_fork_ruby() before_exec()
1183 #define after_fork_ruby() (rb_threadptr_pending_interrupt_clear(GET_THREAD()), after_exec())
1184 
1185 #include "dln.h"
1186 
1187 static void
1188 security(const char *str)
1189 {
1190  if (rb_env_path_tainted()) {
1191  if (rb_safe_level() > 0) {
1192  rb_raise(rb_eSecurityError, "Insecure PATH - %s", str);
1193  }
1194  }
1195 }
1196 
1197 #if defined(HAVE_WORKING_FORK) && !defined(__native_client__)
1198 
1199 /* try_with_sh and exec_with_sh should be async-signal-safe. Actually it is.*/
1200 #define try_with_sh(prog, argv, envp) ((saved_errno == ENOEXEC) ? exec_with_sh((prog), (argv), (envp)) : (void)0)
1201 static void
1202 exec_with_sh(const char *prog, char **argv, char **envp)
1203 {
1204  *argv = (char *)prog;
1205  *--argv = (char *)"sh";
1206  if (envp)
1207  execve("/bin/sh", argv, envp); /* async-signal-safe */
1208  else
1209  execv("/bin/sh", argv); /* async-signal-safe */
1210 }
1211 
1212 #else
1213 #define try_with_sh(prog, argv, envp) (void)0
1214 #endif
1215 
1216 /* This function should be async-signal-safe. Actually it is. */
1217 static int
1218 proc_exec_cmd(const char *prog, VALUE argv_str, VALUE envp_str)
1219 {
1220 #ifdef __native_client__
1221  rb_notimplement();
1222  UNREACHABLE;
1223 #else
1224  char **argv;
1225  char **envp;
1226 # if defined(__EMX__) || defined(OS2)
1227  char **new_argv = NULL;
1228 # endif
1229 
1230  argv = ARGVSTR2ARGV(argv_str);
1231 
1232  if (!prog) {
1233  errno = ENOENT;
1234  return -1;
1235  }
1236 
1237 # if defined(__EMX__) || defined(OS2)
1238  {
1239 # define COMMAND "cmd.exe"
1240  char *extension;
1241 
1242  if ((extension = strrchr(prog, '.')) != NULL && STRCASECMP(extension, ".bat") == 0) {
1243  char *p;
1244  int n;
1245 
1246  for (n = 0; argv[n]; n++)
1247  /* no-op */;
1248  new_argv = ALLOC_N(char*, n + 2);
1249  for (; n > 0; n--)
1250  new_argv[n + 1] = argv[n];
1251  new_argv[1] = strcpy(ALLOC_N(char, strlen(argv[0]) + 1), argv[0]);
1252  for (p = new_argv[1]; *p != '\0'; p++)
1253  if (*p == '/')
1254  *p = '\\';
1255  new_argv[0] = COMMAND;
1256  argv = new_argv;
1257  prog = dln_find_exe_r(argv[0], 0, fbuf, sizeof(fbuf));
1258  if (!prog) {
1259  errno = ENOENT;
1260  return -1;
1261  }
1262  }
1263  }
1264 # endif /* __EMX__ */
1265  envp = envp_str ? (char **)RSTRING_PTR(envp_str) : NULL;
1266  if (envp_str)
1267  execve(prog, argv, envp); /* async-signal-safe */
1268  else
1269  execv(prog, argv); /* async-signal-safe */
1270  preserving_errno(try_with_sh(prog, argv, envp)); /* try_with_sh() is async-signal-safe. */
1271 # if defined(__EMX__) || defined(OS2)
1272  if (new_argv) {
1273  xfree(new_argv[0]);
1274  xfree(new_argv);
1275  }
1276 # endif
1277  return -1;
1278 #endif
1279 }
1280 
1281 /* This function should be async-signal-safe. Actually it is. */
1282 static int
1283 proc_exec_sh(const char *str, VALUE envp_str)
1284 {
1285 #ifdef __native_client__
1286  rb_notimplement();
1287  UNREACHABLE;
1288 #else
1289  const char *s;
1290 
1291  s = str;
1292  while (*s == ' ' || *s == '\t' || *s == '\n')
1293  s++;
1294 
1295  if (!*s) {
1296  errno = ENOENT;
1297  return -1;
1298  }
1299 
1300 #ifdef _WIN32
1301  rb_w32_uspawn(P_OVERLAY, (char *)str, 0);
1302  return -1;
1303 #else
1304 #if defined(__CYGWIN32__) || defined(__EMX__)
1305  {
1306  char fbuf[MAXPATHLEN];
1307  char *shell = dln_find_exe_r("sh", 0, fbuf, sizeof(fbuf));
1308  int status = -1;
1309  if (shell)
1310  execl(shell, "sh", "-c", str, (char *) NULL);
1311  else
1312  status = system(str);
1313  if (status != -1)
1314  exit(status);
1315  }
1316 #else
1317  if (envp_str)
1318  execle("/bin/sh", "sh", "-c", str, (char *)NULL, (char **)RSTRING_PTR(envp_str)); /* async-signal-safe */
1319  else
1320  execl("/bin/sh", "sh", "-c", str, (char *)NULL); /* async-signal-safe */
1321 #endif
1322  return -1;
1323 #endif /* _WIN32 */
1324 #endif
1325 }
1326 
1327 int
1328 rb_proc_exec(const char *str)
1329 {
1330  int ret;
1331  before_exec();
1332  ret = proc_exec_sh(str, Qfalse);
1333  preserving_errno(after_exec());
1334  return ret;
1335 }
1336 
1337 static void
1338 mark_exec_arg(void *ptr)
1339 {
1340  struct rb_execarg *eargp = ptr;
1341  if (eargp->use_shell)
1342  rb_gc_mark(eargp->invoke.sh.shell_script);
1343  else {
1344  rb_gc_mark(eargp->invoke.cmd.command_name);
1345  rb_gc_mark(eargp->invoke.cmd.command_abspath);
1346  rb_gc_mark(eargp->invoke.cmd.argv_str);
1347  rb_gc_mark(eargp->invoke.cmd.argv_buf);
1348  }
1349  rb_gc_mark(eargp->redirect_fds);
1350  rb_gc_mark(eargp->envp_str);
1351  rb_gc_mark(eargp->envp_buf);
1352  rb_gc_mark(eargp->dup2_tmpbuf);
1353  rb_gc_mark(eargp->rlimit_limits);
1354  rb_gc_mark(eargp->fd_dup2);
1355  rb_gc_mark(eargp->fd_close);
1356  rb_gc_mark(eargp->fd_open);
1357  rb_gc_mark(eargp->fd_dup2_child);
1358  rb_gc_mark(eargp->env_modification);
1359  rb_gc_mark(eargp->chdir_dir);
1360 }
1361 
1362 static size_t
1363 memsize_exec_arg(const void *ptr)
1364 {
1365  return sizeof(struct rb_execarg);
1366 }
1367 
1368 static const rb_data_type_t exec_arg_data_type = {
1369  "exec_arg",
1370  {mark_exec_arg, RUBY_TYPED_DEFAULT_FREE, memsize_exec_arg},
1371  0, 0, RUBY_TYPED_FREE_IMMEDIATELY
1372 };
1373 
1374 #ifdef _WIN32
1375 # define DEFAULT_PROCESS_ENCODING rb_utf8_encoding()
1376 #endif
1377 #ifdef DEFAULT_PROCESS_ENCODING
1378 # define EXPORT_STR(str) rb_str_export_to_enc((str), DEFAULT_PROCESS_ENCODING)
1379 # define EXPORT_DUP(str) export_dup(str)
1380 static VALUE
1381 export_dup(VALUE str)
1382 {
1383  VALUE newstr = EXPORT_STR(str);
1384  if (newstr == str) newstr = rb_str_dup(str);
1385  return newstr;
1386 }
1387 #else
1388 # define EXPORT_STR(str) (str)
1389 # define EXPORT_DUP(str) rb_str_dup(str)
1390 #endif
1391 
1392 #if !defined(HAVE_WORKING_FORK) && defined(HAVE_SPAWNV)
1393 # define USE_SPAWNV 1
1394 #else
1395 # define USE_SPAWNV 0
1396 #endif
1397 #ifndef P_NOWAIT
1398 # define P_NOWAIT _P_NOWAIT
1399 #endif
1400 
1401 #if USE_SPAWNV
1402 #if defined(_WIN32)
1403 #define proc_spawn_cmd_internal(argv, prog) rb_w32_uaspawn(P_NOWAIT, (prog), (argv))
1404 #else
1405 static rb_pid_t
1406 proc_spawn_cmd_internal(char **argv, char *prog)
1407 {
1408  char fbuf[MAXPATHLEN];
1409  rb_pid_t status;
1410 
1411  if (!prog)
1412  prog = argv[0];
1413  security(prog);
1414  prog = dln_find_exe_r(prog, 0, fbuf, sizeof(fbuf));
1415  if (!prog)
1416  return -1;
1417 
1418  before_exec();
1419  status = spawnv(P_NOWAIT, prog, (const char **)argv);
1420  if (status == -1 && errno == ENOEXEC) {
1421  *argv = (char *)prog;
1422  *--argv = (char *)"sh";
1423  status = spawnv(P_NOWAIT, "/bin/sh", (const char **)argv);
1424  after_exec();
1425  if (status == -1) errno = ENOEXEC;
1426  }
1427  return status;
1428 }
1429 #endif
1430 
1431 static rb_pid_t
1432 proc_spawn_cmd(char **argv, VALUE prog, struct rb_execarg *eargp)
1433 {
1434  rb_pid_t pid = -1;
1435 
1436  if (argv[0]) {
1437 #if defined(_WIN32)
1438  DWORD flags = 0;
1439  if (eargp->new_pgroup_given && eargp->new_pgroup_flag) {
1440  flags = CREATE_NEW_PROCESS_GROUP;
1441  }
1442  pid = rb_w32_uaspawn_flags(P_NOWAIT, prog ? RSTRING_PTR(prog) : 0, argv, flags);
1443 #else
1444  pid = proc_spawn_cmd_internal(argv, prog ? RSTRING_PTR(prog) : 0);
1445 #endif
1446  }
1447  return pid;
1448 }
1449 
1450 #if defined(_WIN32)
1451 #define proc_spawn_sh(str) rb_w32_uspawn(P_NOWAIT, (str), 0)
1452 #else
1453 static rb_pid_t
1454 proc_spawn_sh(char *str)
1455 {
1456  char fbuf[MAXPATHLEN];
1457  rb_pid_t status;
1458 
1459  char *shell = dln_find_exe_r("sh", 0, fbuf, sizeof(fbuf));
1460  before_exec();
1461  status = spawnl(P_NOWAIT, (shell ? shell : "/bin/sh"), "sh", "-c", str, (char*)NULL);
1462  after_exec();
1463  return status;
1464 }
1465 #endif
1466 #endif
1467 
1468 static VALUE
1469 hide_obj(VALUE obj)
1470 {
1471  RBASIC_CLEAR_CLASS(obj);
1472  return obj;
1473 }
1474 
1475 static VALUE
1476 check_exec_redirect_fd(VALUE v, int iskey)
1477 {
1478  VALUE tmp;
1479  int fd;
1480  if (FIXNUM_P(v)) {
1481  fd = FIX2INT(v);
1482  }
1483  else if (SYMBOL_P(v)) {
1484  ID id = rb_check_id(&v);
1485  if (id == id_in)
1486  fd = 0;
1487  else if (id == id_out)
1488  fd = 1;
1489  else if (id == id_err)
1490  fd = 2;
1491  else
1492  goto wrong;
1493  }
1494  else if (!NIL_P(tmp = rb_check_convert_type(v, T_FILE, "IO", "to_io"))) {
1495  rb_io_t *fptr;
1496  GetOpenFile(tmp, fptr);
1497  if (fptr->tied_io_for_writing)
1498  rb_raise(rb_eArgError, "duplex IO redirection");
1499  fd = fptr->fd;
1500  }
1501  else {
1502  wrong:
1503  rb_raise(rb_eArgError, "wrong exec redirect");
1504  }
1505  if (fd < 0) {
1506  rb_raise(rb_eArgError, "negative file descriptor");
1507  }
1508 #ifdef _WIN32
1509  else if (fd >= 3 && iskey) {
1510  rb_raise(rb_eArgError, "wrong file descriptor (%d)", fd);
1511  }
1512 #endif
1513  return INT2FIX(fd);
1514 }
1515 
1516 static VALUE
1517 check_exec_redirect1(VALUE ary, VALUE key, VALUE param)
1518 {
1519  if (ary == Qfalse) {
1520  ary = hide_obj(rb_ary_new());
1521  }
1522  if (!RB_TYPE_P(key, T_ARRAY)) {
1523  VALUE fd = check_exec_redirect_fd(key, !NIL_P(param));
1524  rb_ary_push(ary, hide_obj(rb_assoc_new(fd, param)));
1525  }
1526  else {
1527  int i, n=0;
1528  for (i = 0 ; i < RARRAY_LEN(key); i++) {
1529  VALUE v = RARRAY_AREF(key, i);
1530  VALUE fd = check_exec_redirect_fd(v, !NIL_P(param));
1531  rb_ary_push(ary, hide_obj(rb_assoc_new(fd, param)));
1532  n++;
1533  }
1534  }
1535  return ary;
1536 }
1537 
1538 static void
1539 check_exec_redirect(VALUE key, VALUE val, struct rb_execarg *eargp)
1540 {
1541  VALUE param;
1542  VALUE path, flags, perm;
1543  VALUE tmp;
1544  ID id;
1545 
1546  switch (TYPE(val)) {
1547  case T_SYMBOL:
1548  if (!(id = rb_check_id(&val))) goto wrong_symbol;
1549  if (id == id_close) {
1550  param = Qnil;
1551  eargp->fd_close = check_exec_redirect1(eargp->fd_close, key, param);
1552  }
1553  else if (id == id_in) {
1554  param = INT2FIX(0);
1555  eargp->fd_dup2 = check_exec_redirect1(eargp->fd_dup2, key, param);
1556  }
1557  else if (id == id_out) {
1558  param = INT2FIX(1);
1559  eargp->fd_dup2 = check_exec_redirect1(eargp->fd_dup2, key, param);
1560  }
1561  else if (id == id_err) {
1562  param = INT2FIX(2);
1563  eargp->fd_dup2 = check_exec_redirect1(eargp->fd_dup2, key, param);
1564  }
1565  else {
1566  wrong_symbol:
1567  rb_raise(rb_eArgError, "wrong exec redirect symbol: %"PRIsVALUE,
1568  val);
1569  }
1570  break;
1571 
1572  case T_FILE:
1573  io:
1574  val = check_exec_redirect_fd(val, 0);
1575  /* fall through */
1576  case T_FIXNUM:
1577  param = val;
1578  eargp->fd_dup2 = check_exec_redirect1(eargp->fd_dup2, key, param);
1579  break;
1580 
1581  case T_ARRAY:
1582  path = rb_ary_entry(val, 0);
1583  if (RARRAY_LEN(val) == 2 && SYMBOL_P(path) &&
1584  path == ID2SYM(id_child)) {
1585  param = check_exec_redirect_fd(rb_ary_entry(val, 1), 0);
1586  eargp->fd_dup2_child = check_exec_redirect1(eargp->fd_dup2_child, key, param);
1587  }
1588  else {
1589  FilePathValue(path);
1590  flags = rb_ary_entry(val, 1);
1591  if (NIL_P(flags))
1592  flags = INT2NUM(O_RDONLY);
1593  else if (RB_TYPE_P(flags, T_STRING))
1594  flags = INT2NUM(rb_io_modestr_oflags(StringValueCStr(flags)));
1595  else
1596  flags = rb_to_int(flags);
1597  perm = rb_ary_entry(val, 2);
1598  perm = NIL_P(perm) ? INT2FIX(0644) : rb_to_int(perm);
1599  param = hide_obj(rb_ary_new3(4, hide_obj(EXPORT_DUP(path)),
1600  flags, perm, Qnil));
1601  eargp->fd_open = check_exec_redirect1(eargp->fd_open, key, param);
1602  }
1603  break;
1604 
1605  case T_STRING:
1606  path = val;
1607  FilePathValue(path);
1608  if (RB_TYPE_P(key, T_FILE))
1609  key = check_exec_redirect_fd(key, 1);
1610  if (FIXNUM_P(key) && (FIX2INT(key) == 1 || FIX2INT(key) == 2))
1611  flags = INT2NUM(O_WRONLY|O_CREAT|O_TRUNC);
1612  else if (RB_TYPE_P(key, T_ARRAY)) {
1613  int i;
1614  for (i = 0; i < RARRAY_LEN(key); i++) {
1615  VALUE v = RARRAY_PTR(key)[i];
1616  VALUE fd = check_exec_redirect_fd(v, 1);
1617  if (FIX2INT(fd) != 1 && FIX2INT(fd) != 2) break;
1618  }
1619  if (i == RARRAY_LEN(key))
1620  flags = INT2NUM(O_WRONLY|O_CREAT|O_TRUNC);
1621  else
1622  flags = INT2NUM(O_RDONLY);
1623  }
1624  else
1625  flags = INT2NUM(O_RDONLY);
1626  perm = INT2FIX(0644);
1627  param = hide_obj(rb_ary_new3(4, hide_obj(EXPORT_DUP(path)),
1628  flags, perm, Qnil));
1629  eargp->fd_open = check_exec_redirect1(eargp->fd_open, key, param);
1630  break;
1631 
1632  default:
1633  tmp = val;
1634  val = rb_io_check_io(tmp);
1635  if (!NIL_P(val)) goto io;
1636  rb_raise(rb_eArgError, "wrong exec redirect action");
1637  }
1638 
1639 }
1640 
1641 #if defined(HAVE_SETRLIMIT) && defined(NUM2RLIM)
1642 static int rlimit_type_by_lname(const char *name);
1643 #endif
1644 
1645 int
1646 rb_execarg_addopt(VALUE execarg_obj, VALUE key, VALUE val)
1647 {
1648  struct rb_execarg *eargp = rb_execarg_get(execarg_obj);
1649 
1650  ID id;
1651 #if defined(HAVE_SETRLIMIT) && defined(NUM2RLIM)
1652  int rtype;
1653 #endif
1654 
1655  rb_secure(2);
1656 
1657  switch (TYPE(key)) {
1658  case T_SYMBOL:
1659  if (!(id = rb_check_id(&key))) return ST_STOP;
1660 #ifdef HAVE_SETPGID
1661  if (id == id_pgroup) {
1662  rb_pid_t pgroup;
1663  if (eargp->pgroup_given) {
1664  rb_raise(rb_eArgError, "pgroup option specified twice");
1665  }
1666  if (!RTEST(val))
1667  pgroup = -1; /* asis(-1) means "don't call setpgid()". */
1668  else if (val == Qtrue)
1669  pgroup = 0; /* new process group. */
1670  else {
1671  pgroup = NUM2PIDT(val);
1672  if (pgroup < 0) {
1673  rb_raise(rb_eArgError, "negative process group ID : %ld", (long)pgroup);
1674  }
1675  }
1676  eargp->pgroup_given = 1;
1677  eargp->pgroup_pgid = pgroup;
1678  }
1679  else
1680 #endif
1681 #ifdef _WIN32
1682  if (id == id_new_pgroup) {
1683  if (eargp->new_pgroup_given) {
1684  rb_raise(rb_eArgError, "new_pgroup option specified twice");
1685  }
1686  eargp->new_pgroup_given = 1;
1687  eargp->new_pgroup_flag = RTEST(val) ? 1 : 0;
1688  }
1689  else
1690 #endif
1691 #if defined(HAVE_SETRLIMIT) && defined(NUM2RLIM)
1692  if (strncmp("rlimit_", rb_id2name(id), 7) == 0 &&
1693  (rtype = rlimit_type_by_lname(rb_id2name(id)+7)) != -1) {
1694  VALUE ary = eargp->rlimit_limits;
1695  VALUE tmp, softlim, hardlim;
1696  if (eargp->rlimit_limits == Qfalse)
1697  ary = eargp->rlimit_limits = hide_obj(rb_ary_new());
1698  else
1699  ary = eargp->rlimit_limits;
1700  tmp = rb_check_array_type(val);
1701  if (!NIL_P(tmp)) {
1702  if (RARRAY_LEN(tmp) == 1)
1703  softlim = hardlim = rb_to_int(rb_ary_entry(tmp, 0));
1704  else if (RARRAY_LEN(tmp) == 2) {
1705  softlim = rb_to_int(rb_ary_entry(tmp, 0));
1706  hardlim = rb_to_int(rb_ary_entry(tmp, 1));
1707  }
1708  else {
1709  rb_raise(rb_eArgError, "wrong exec rlimit option");
1710  }
1711  }
1712  else {
1713  softlim = hardlim = rb_to_int(val);
1714  }
1715  tmp = hide_obj(rb_ary_new3(3, INT2NUM(rtype), softlim, hardlim));
1716  rb_ary_push(ary, tmp);
1717  }
1718  else
1719 #endif
1720  if (id == id_unsetenv_others) {
1721  if (eargp->unsetenv_others_given) {
1722  rb_raise(rb_eArgError, "unsetenv_others option specified twice");
1723  }
1724  eargp->unsetenv_others_given = 1;
1725  eargp->unsetenv_others_do = RTEST(val) ? 1 : 0;
1726  }
1727  else if (id == id_chdir) {
1728  if (eargp->chdir_given) {
1729  rb_raise(rb_eArgError, "chdir option specified twice");
1730  }
1731  FilePathValue(val);
1732  eargp->chdir_given = 1;
1733  eargp->chdir_dir = hide_obj(EXPORT_DUP(val));
1734  }
1735  else if (id == id_umask) {
1736  mode_t cmask = NUM2MODET(val);
1737  if (eargp->umask_given) {
1738  rb_raise(rb_eArgError, "umask option specified twice");
1739  }
1740  eargp->umask_given = 1;
1741  eargp->umask_mask = cmask;
1742  }
1743  else if (id == id_close_others) {
1744  if (eargp->close_others_given) {
1745  rb_raise(rb_eArgError, "close_others option specified twice");
1746  }
1747  eargp->close_others_given = 1;
1748  eargp->close_others_do = RTEST(val) ? 1 : 0;
1749  }
1750  else if (id == id_in) {
1751  key = INT2FIX(0);
1752  goto redirect;
1753  }
1754  else if (id == id_out) {
1755  key = INT2FIX(1);
1756  goto redirect;
1757  }
1758  else if (id == id_err) {
1759  key = INT2FIX(2);
1760  goto redirect;
1761  }
1762  else if (id == id_uid) {
1763 #ifdef HAVE_SETUID
1764  if (eargp->uid_given) {
1765  rb_raise(rb_eArgError, "uid option specified twice");
1766  }
1767  check_uid_switch();
1768  {
1769  eargp->uid = OBJ2UID(val);
1770  eargp->uid_given = 1;
1771  }
1772 #else
1773  rb_raise(rb_eNotImpError,
1774  "uid option is unimplemented on this machine");
1775 #endif
1776  }
1777  else if (id == id_gid) {
1778 #ifdef HAVE_SETGID
1779  if (eargp->gid_given) {
1780  rb_raise(rb_eArgError, "gid option specified twice");
1781  }
1782  check_gid_switch();
1783  {
1784  eargp->gid = OBJ2GID(val);
1785  eargp->gid_given = 1;
1786  }
1787 #else
1788  rb_raise(rb_eNotImpError,
1789  "gid option is unimplemented on this machine");
1790 #endif
1791  }
1792  else {
1793  return ST_STOP;
1794  }
1795  break;
1796 
1797  case T_FIXNUM:
1798  case T_FILE:
1799  case T_ARRAY:
1800 redirect:
1801  check_exec_redirect(key, val, eargp);
1802  break;
1803 
1804  default:
1805  return ST_STOP;
1806  }
1807 
1808  RB_GC_GUARD(execarg_obj);
1809  return ST_CONTINUE;
1810 }
1811 
1812 static int
1813 check_exec_options_i(st_data_t st_key, st_data_t st_val, st_data_t arg)
1814 {
1815  VALUE key = (VALUE)st_key;
1816  VALUE val = (VALUE)st_val;
1817  VALUE execarg_obj = (VALUE)arg;
1818  if (rb_execarg_addopt(execarg_obj, key, val) != ST_CONTINUE) {
1819  if (SYMBOL_P(key))
1820  rb_raise(rb_eArgError, "wrong exec option symbol: %"PRIsVALUE,
1821  key);
1822  rb_raise(rb_eArgError, "wrong exec option");
1823  }
1824  return ST_CONTINUE;
1825 }
1826 
1827 static int
1828 check_exec_options_i_extract(st_data_t st_key, st_data_t st_val, st_data_t arg)
1829 {
1830  VALUE key = (VALUE)st_key;
1831  VALUE val = (VALUE)st_val;
1832  VALUE *args = (VALUE *)arg;
1833  VALUE execarg_obj = args[0];
1834  if (rb_execarg_addopt(execarg_obj, key, val) != ST_CONTINUE) {
1835  VALUE nonopts = args[1];
1836  if (NIL_P(nonopts)) args[1] = nonopts = rb_hash_new();
1837  rb_hash_aset(nonopts, key, val);
1838  }
1839  return ST_CONTINUE;
1840 }
1841 
1842 static int
1843 check_exec_fds_1(struct rb_execarg *eargp, VALUE h, int maxhint, VALUE ary)
1844 {
1845  long i;
1846 
1847  if (ary != Qfalse) {
1848  for (i = 0; i < RARRAY_LEN(ary); i++) {
1849  VALUE elt = RARRAY_AREF(ary, i);
1850  int fd = FIX2INT(RARRAY_AREF(elt, 0));
1851  if (RTEST(rb_hash_lookup(h, INT2FIX(fd)))) {
1852  rb_raise(rb_eArgError, "fd %d specified twice", fd);
1853  }
1854  if (ary == eargp->fd_dup2)
1855  rb_hash_aset(h, INT2FIX(fd), Qtrue);
1856  else if (ary == eargp->fd_dup2_child)
1857  rb_hash_aset(h, INT2FIX(fd), RARRAY_AREF(elt, 1));
1858  else /* ary == eargp->fd_close */
1859  rb_hash_aset(h, INT2FIX(fd), INT2FIX(-1));
1860  if (maxhint < fd)
1861  maxhint = fd;
1862  if (ary == eargp->fd_dup2 || ary == eargp->fd_dup2_child) {
1863  fd = FIX2INT(RARRAY_AREF(elt, 1));
1864  if (maxhint < fd)
1865  maxhint = fd;
1866  }
1867  }
1868  }
1869  return maxhint;
1870 }
1871 
1872 static VALUE
1873 check_exec_fds(struct rb_execarg *eargp)
1874 {
1875  VALUE h = rb_hash_new();
1876  VALUE ary;
1877  int maxhint = -1;
1878  long i;
1879 
1880  maxhint = check_exec_fds_1(eargp, h, maxhint, eargp->fd_dup2);
1881  maxhint = check_exec_fds_1(eargp, h, maxhint, eargp->fd_close);
1882  maxhint = check_exec_fds_1(eargp, h, maxhint, eargp->fd_dup2_child);
1883 
1884  if (eargp->fd_dup2_child) {
1885  ary = eargp->fd_dup2_child;
1886  for (i = 0; i < RARRAY_LEN(ary); i++) {
1887  VALUE elt = RARRAY_AREF(ary, i);
1888  int newfd = FIX2INT(RARRAY_AREF(elt, 0));
1889  int oldfd = FIX2INT(RARRAY_AREF(elt, 1));
1890  int lastfd = oldfd;
1891  VALUE val = rb_hash_lookup(h, INT2FIX(lastfd));
1892  long depth = 0;
1893  while (FIXNUM_P(val) && 0 <= FIX2INT(val)) {
1894  lastfd = FIX2INT(val);
1895  val = rb_hash_lookup(h, val);
1896  if (RARRAY_LEN(ary) < depth)
1897  rb_raise(rb_eArgError, "cyclic child fd redirection from %d", oldfd);
1898  depth++;
1899  }
1900  if (val != Qtrue)
1901  rb_raise(rb_eArgError, "child fd %d is not redirected", oldfd);
1902  if (oldfd != lastfd) {
1903  VALUE val2;
1904  rb_ary_store(elt, 1, INT2FIX(lastfd));
1905  rb_hash_aset(h, INT2FIX(newfd), INT2FIX(lastfd));
1906  val = INT2FIX(oldfd);
1907  while (FIXNUM_P(val2 = rb_hash_lookup(h, val))) {
1908  rb_hash_aset(h, val, INT2FIX(lastfd));
1909  val = val2;
1910  }
1911  }
1912  }
1913  }
1914 
1915  eargp->close_others_maxhint = maxhint;
1916  return h;
1917 }
1918 
1919 static void
1920 rb_check_exec_options(VALUE opthash, VALUE execarg_obj)
1921 {
1922  if (RHASH_EMPTY_P(opthash))
1923  return;
1924  st_foreach(rb_hash_tbl_raw(opthash), check_exec_options_i, (st_data_t)execarg_obj);
1925 }
1926 
1927 VALUE
1928 rb_execarg_extract_options(VALUE execarg_obj, VALUE opthash)
1929 {
1930  VALUE args[2];
1931  if (RHASH_EMPTY_P(opthash))
1932  return Qnil;
1933  args[0] = execarg_obj;
1934  args[1] = Qnil;
1935  st_foreach(rb_hash_tbl_raw(opthash), check_exec_options_i_extract, (st_data_t)args);
1936  return args[1];
1937 }
1938 
1939 static int
1940 check_exec_env_i(st_data_t st_key, st_data_t st_val, st_data_t arg)
1941 {
1942  VALUE key = (VALUE)st_key;
1943  VALUE val = (VALUE)st_val;
1944  VALUE env = (VALUE)arg;
1945  char *k;
1946 
1947  k = StringValueCStr(key);
1948  if (strchr(k, '='))
1949  rb_raise(rb_eArgError, "environment name contains a equal : %s", k);
1950 
1951  if (!NIL_P(val))
1952  StringValueCStr(val);
1953 
1954  key = EXPORT_STR(key);
1955  if (!NIL_P(val)) val = EXPORT_STR(val);
1956 
1957  rb_ary_push(env, hide_obj(rb_assoc_new(key, val)));
1958 
1959  return ST_CONTINUE;
1960 }
1961 
1962 static VALUE
1963 rb_check_exec_env(VALUE hash)
1964 {
1965  VALUE env;
1966 
1967  env = hide_obj(rb_ary_new());
1968  st_foreach(rb_hash_tbl_raw(hash), check_exec_env_i, (st_data_t)env);
1969 
1970  return env;
1971 }
1972 
1973 static VALUE
1974 rb_check_argv(int argc, VALUE *argv)
1975 {
1976  VALUE tmp, prog;
1977  int i;
1978  const char *name = 0;
1979 
1980  rb_check_arity(argc, 1, UNLIMITED_ARGUMENTS);
1981 
1982  prog = 0;
1983  tmp = rb_check_array_type(argv[0]);
1984  if (!NIL_P(tmp)) {
1985  if (RARRAY_LEN(tmp) != 2) {
1986  rb_raise(rb_eArgError, "wrong first argument");
1987  }
1988  prog = RARRAY_AREF(tmp, 0);
1989  argv[0] = RARRAY_AREF(tmp, 1);
1990  SafeStringValue(prog);
1991  StringValueCStr(prog);
1992  prog = rb_str_new_frozen(prog);
1993  name = RSTRING_PTR(prog);
1994  }
1995  for (i = 0; i < argc; i++) {
1996  SafeStringValue(argv[i]);
1997  argv[i] = rb_str_new_frozen(argv[i]);
1998  StringValueCStr(argv[i]);
1999  }
2000  security(name ? name : RSTRING_PTR(argv[0]));
2001  return prog;
2002 }
2003 
2004 static VALUE
2005 rb_exec_getargs(int *argc_p, VALUE **argv_p, int accept_shell, VALUE *env_ret, VALUE *opthash_ret)
2006 {
2007  VALUE hash, prog;
2008 
2009  if (0 < *argc_p) {
2010  hash = rb_check_hash_type((*argv_p)[*argc_p-1]);
2011  if (!NIL_P(hash)) {
2012  *opthash_ret = hash;
2013  (*argc_p)--;
2014  }
2015  }
2016 
2017  if (0 < *argc_p) {
2018  hash = rb_check_hash_type((*argv_p)[0]);
2019  if (!NIL_P(hash)) {
2020  *env_ret = hash;
2021  (*argc_p)--;
2022  (*argv_p)++;
2023  }
2024  }
2025  prog = rb_check_argv(*argc_p, *argv_p);
2026  if (!prog) {
2027  prog = (*argv_p)[0];
2028  if (accept_shell && *argc_p == 1) {
2029  *argc_p = 0;
2030  *argv_p = 0;
2031  }
2032  }
2033  return prog;
2034 }
2035 
2036 #ifndef _WIN32
2037 struct string_part {
2038  const char *ptr;
2039  size_t len;
2040 };
2041 
2042 static int
2043 compare_posix_sh(const void *key, const void *el)
2044 {
2045  const struct string_part *word = key;
2046  int ret = strncmp(word->ptr, el, word->len);
2047  if (!ret && ((const char *)el)[word->len]) ret = -1;
2048  return ret;
2049 }
2050 #endif
2051 
2052 static void
2053 rb_exec_fillarg(VALUE prog, int argc, VALUE *argv, VALUE env, VALUE opthash, VALUE execarg_obj)
2054 {
2055  struct rb_execarg *eargp = rb_execarg_get(execarg_obj);
2056  char fbuf[MAXPATHLEN];
2057 
2058  MEMZERO(eargp, struct rb_execarg, 1);
2059 
2060  if (!NIL_P(opthash)) {
2061  rb_check_exec_options(opthash, execarg_obj);
2062  }
2063  if (!NIL_P(env)) {
2064  env = rb_check_exec_env(env);
2065  eargp->env_modification = env;
2066  }
2067 
2068  prog = EXPORT_STR(prog);
2069  eargp->use_shell = argc == 0;
2070  if (eargp->use_shell)
2071  eargp->invoke.sh.shell_script = prog;
2072  else
2073  eargp->invoke.cmd.command_name = prog;
2074 
2075 #ifndef _WIN32
2076  if (eargp->use_shell) {
2077  static const char posix_sh_cmds[][9] = {
2078  "!", /* reserved */
2079  ".", /* special built-in */
2080  ":", /* special built-in */
2081  "break", /* special built-in */
2082  "case", /* reserved */
2083  "continue", /* special built-in */
2084  "do", /* reserved */
2085  "done", /* reserved */
2086  "elif", /* reserved */
2087  "else", /* reserved */
2088  "esac", /* reserved */
2089  "eval", /* special built-in */
2090  "exec", /* special built-in */
2091  "exit", /* special built-in */
2092  "export", /* special built-in */
2093  "fi", /* reserved */
2094  "for", /* reserved */
2095  "if", /* reserved */
2096  "in", /* reserved */
2097  "readonly", /* special built-in */
2098  "return", /* special built-in */
2099  "set", /* special built-in */
2100  "shift", /* special built-in */
2101  "then", /* reserved */
2102  "times", /* special built-in */
2103  "trap", /* special built-in */
2104  "unset", /* special built-in */
2105  "until", /* reserved */
2106  "while", /* reserved */
2107  };
2108  const char *p;
2109  struct string_part first = {0, 0};
2110  int has_meta = 0;
2111  /*
2112  * meta characters:
2113  *
2114  * * Pathname Expansion
2115  * ? Pathname Expansion
2116  * {} Grouping Commands
2117  * [] Pathname Expansion
2118  * <> Redirection
2119  * () Grouping Commands
2120  * ~ Tilde Expansion
2121  * & AND Lists, Asynchronous Lists
2122  * | OR Lists, Pipelines
2123  * \ Escape Character
2124  * $ Parameter Expansion
2125  * ; Sequential Lists
2126  * ' Single-Quotes
2127  * ` Command Substitution
2128  * " Double-Quotes
2129  * \n Lists
2130  *
2131  * # Comment
2132  * = Assignment preceding command name
2133  * % (used in Parameter Expansion)
2134  */
2135  for (p = RSTRING_PTR(prog); *p; p++) {
2136  if (*p == ' ' || *p == '\t') {
2137  if (first.ptr && !first.len) first.len = p - first.ptr;
2138  }
2139  else {
2140  if (!first.ptr) first.ptr = p;
2141  }
2142  if (!has_meta && strchr("*?{}[]<>()~&|\\$;'`\"\n#", *p))
2143  has_meta = 1;
2144  if (!first.len) {
2145  if (*p == '=') {
2146  has_meta = 1;
2147  }
2148  else if (*p == '/') {
2149  first.len = 0x100; /* longer than any posix_sh_cmds */
2150  }
2151  }
2152  if (has_meta)
2153  break;
2154  }
2155  if (!has_meta && first.ptr) {
2156  if (!first.len) first.len = p - first.ptr;
2157  if (first.len > 0 && first.len <= sizeof(posix_sh_cmds[0]) &&
2158  bsearch(&first, posix_sh_cmds, numberof(posix_sh_cmds), sizeof(posix_sh_cmds[0]), compare_posix_sh))
2159  has_meta = 1;
2160  }
2161  if (!has_meta) {
2162  /* avoid shell since no shell meta character found. */
2163  eargp->use_shell = 0;
2164  }
2165  if (!eargp->use_shell) {
2166  VALUE argv_buf;
2167  argv_buf = hide_obj(rb_str_buf_new(0));
2168  p = RSTRING_PTR(prog);
2169  while (*p) {
2170  while (*p == ' ' || *p == '\t')
2171  p++;
2172  if (*p) {
2173  const char *w = p;
2174  while (*p && *p != ' ' && *p != '\t')
2175  p++;
2176  rb_str_buf_cat(argv_buf, w, p-w);
2177  rb_str_buf_cat(argv_buf, "", 1); /* append '\0' */
2178  }
2179  }
2180  eargp->invoke.cmd.argv_buf = argv_buf;
2181  eargp->invoke.cmd.command_name = hide_obj(rb_str_new_cstr(RSTRING_PTR(argv_buf)));
2182  }
2183  }
2184 #endif
2185 
2186  if (!eargp->use_shell) {
2187  const char *abspath;
2188  abspath = dln_find_exe_r(RSTRING_PTR(eargp->invoke.cmd.command_name), 0, fbuf, sizeof(fbuf));
2189  if (abspath)
2190  eargp->invoke.cmd.command_abspath = rb_str_new_cstr(abspath);
2191  else
2192  eargp->invoke.cmd.command_abspath = Qnil;
2193  }
2194 
2195  if (!eargp->use_shell && !eargp->invoke.cmd.argv_buf) {
2196  int i;
2197  VALUE argv_buf;
2198  argv_buf = rb_str_buf_new(0);
2199  hide_obj(argv_buf);
2200  for (i = 0; i < argc; i++) {
2201  VALUE arg = argv[i];
2202  const char *s = StringValueCStr(arg);
2203 #ifdef DEFAULT_PROCESS_ENCODING
2204  arg = EXPORT_STR(arg);
2205  s = RSTRING_PTR(arg);
2206 #endif
2207  rb_str_buf_cat(argv_buf, s, RSTRING_LEN(arg) + 1); /* include '\0' */
2208  }
2209  eargp->invoke.cmd.argv_buf = argv_buf;
2210  }
2211 
2212  if (!eargp->use_shell) {
2213  const char *p, *ep, *null=NULL;
2214  VALUE argv_str;
2215  argv_str = hide_obj(rb_str_buf_new(sizeof(char*) * (argc + 2)));
2216  rb_str_buf_cat(argv_str, (char *)&null, sizeof(null)); /* place holder for /bin/sh of try_with_sh. */
2217  p = RSTRING_PTR(eargp->invoke.cmd.argv_buf);
2218  ep = p + RSTRING_LEN(eargp->invoke.cmd.argv_buf);
2219  while (p < ep) {
2220  rb_str_buf_cat(argv_str, (char *)&p, sizeof(p));
2221  p += strlen(p) + 1;
2222  }
2223  rb_str_buf_cat(argv_str, (char *)&null, sizeof(null)); /* terminator for execve. */
2224  eargp->invoke.cmd.argv_str = argv_str;
2225  }
2226  RB_GC_GUARD(execarg_obj);
2227 }
2228 
2229 VALUE
2230 rb_execarg_new(int argc, const VALUE *argv, int accept_shell)
2231 {
2232  VALUE execarg_obj;
2233  struct rb_execarg *eargp;
2234  execarg_obj = TypedData_Make_Struct(rb_cData, struct rb_execarg, &exec_arg_data_type, eargp);
2235  hide_obj(execarg_obj);
2236  rb_execarg_init(argc, argv, accept_shell, execarg_obj);
2237  return execarg_obj;
2238 }
2239 
2240 struct rb_execarg *
2241 rb_execarg_get(VALUE execarg_obj)
2242 {
2243  struct rb_execarg *eargp;
2244  TypedData_Get_Struct(execarg_obj, struct rb_execarg, &exec_arg_data_type, eargp);
2245  return eargp;
2246 }
2247 
2248 VALUE
2249 rb_execarg_init(int argc, const VALUE *orig_argv, int accept_shell, VALUE execarg_obj)
2250 {
2251  struct rb_execarg *eargp = rb_execarg_get(execarg_obj);
2252  VALUE prog, ret;
2253  VALUE env = Qnil, opthash = Qnil;
2254  VALUE argv_buf;
2255  VALUE *argv = ALLOCV_N(VALUE, argv_buf, argc);
2256  MEMCPY(argv, orig_argv, VALUE, argc);
2257  prog = rb_exec_getargs(&argc, &argv, accept_shell, &env, &opthash);
2258  rb_exec_fillarg(prog, argc, argv, env, opthash, execarg_obj);
2259  ALLOCV_END(argv_buf);
2260  ret = eargp->use_shell ? eargp->invoke.sh.shell_script : eargp->invoke.cmd.command_name;
2261  RB_GC_GUARD(execarg_obj);
2262  return ret;
2263 }
2264 
2265 void
2266 rb_execarg_setenv(VALUE execarg_obj, VALUE env)
2267 {
2268  struct rb_execarg *eargp = rb_execarg_get(execarg_obj);
2269  env = !NIL_P(env) ? rb_check_exec_env(env) : Qfalse;
2270  eargp->env_modification = env;
2271 }
2272 
2273 static int
2274 fill_envp_buf_i(st_data_t st_key, st_data_t st_val, st_data_t arg)
2275 {
2276  VALUE key = (VALUE)st_key;
2277  VALUE val = (VALUE)st_val;
2278  VALUE envp_buf = (VALUE)arg;
2279 
2280  rb_str_buf_cat2(envp_buf, StringValueCStr(key));
2281  rb_str_buf_cat2(envp_buf, "=");
2282  rb_str_buf_cat2(envp_buf, StringValueCStr(val));
2283  rb_str_buf_cat(envp_buf, "", 1); /* append '\0' */
2284 
2285  return ST_CONTINUE;
2286 }
2287 
2288 
2289 static long run_exec_dup2_tmpbuf_size(long n);
2290 
2291 struct open_struct {
2292  VALUE fname;
2293  int oflags;
2294  mode_t perm;
2295  int ret;
2296  int err;
2297 };
2298 
2299 static void *
2300 open_func(void *ptr)
2301 {
2302  struct open_struct *data = ptr;
2303  const char *fname = RSTRING_PTR(data->fname);
2304  data->ret = parent_redirect_open(fname, data->oflags, data->perm);
2305  data->err = errno;
2306  return NULL;
2307 }
2308 
2309 static VALUE
2310 rb_execarg_parent_start1(VALUE execarg_obj)
2311 {
2312  struct rb_execarg *eargp = rb_execarg_get(execarg_obj);
2313  int unsetenv_others;
2314  VALUE envopts;
2315  VALUE ary;
2316 
2317  ary = eargp->fd_open;
2318  if (ary != Qfalse) {
2319  long i;
2320  for (i = 0; i < RARRAY_LEN(ary); i++) {
2321  VALUE elt = RARRAY_AREF(ary, i);
2322  int fd = FIX2INT(RARRAY_AREF(elt, 0));
2323  VALUE param = RARRAY_AREF(elt, 1);
2324  VALUE vpath = RARRAY_AREF(param, 0);
2325  int flags = NUM2INT(RARRAY_AREF(param, 1));
2326  int perm = NUM2INT(RARRAY_AREF(param, 2));
2327  VALUE fd2v = RARRAY_AREF(param, 3);
2328  int fd2;
2329  if (NIL_P(fd2v)) {
2330  struct open_struct open_data;
2331  FilePathValue(vpath);
2332  again:
2333  open_data.fname = vpath;
2334  open_data.oflags = flags;
2335  open_data.perm = perm;
2336  open_data.ret = -1;
2337  open_data.err = EINTR;
2338  rb_thread_call_without_gvl2(open_func, (void *)&open_data, RUBY_UBF_IO, 0);
2339  if (open_data.ret == -1) {
2340  if (open_data.err == EINTR) {
2341  rb_thread_check_ints();
2342  goto again;
2343  }
2344  rb_sys_fail("open");
2345  }
2346  fd2 = open_data.ret;
2347  rb_update_max_fd(fd2);
2348  RARRAY_ASET(param, 3, INT2FIX(fd2));
2349  rb_thread_check_ints();
2350  }
2351  else {
2352  fd2 = NUM2INT(fd2v);
2353  }
2354  rb_execarg_addopt(execarg_obj, INT2FIX(fd), INT2FIX(fd2));
2355  }
2356  }
2357 
2358  eargp->redirect_fds = check_exec_fds(eargp);
2359 
2360  ary = eargp->fd_dup2;
2361  if (ary != Qfalse) {
2362  size_t len = run_exec_dup2_tmpbuf_size(RARRAY_LEN(ary));
2363  VALUE tmpbuf = hide_obj(rb_str_new(0, len));
2364  rb_str_set_len(tmpbuf, len);
2365  eargp->dup2_tmpbuf = tmpbuf;
2366  }
2367 
2368  unsetenv_others = eargp->unsetenv_others_given && eargp->unsetenv_others_do;
2369  envopts = eargp->env_modification;
2370  if (unsetenv_others || envopts != Qfalse) {
2371  VALUE envtbl, envp_str, envp_buf;
2372  char *p, *ep;
2373  if (unsetenv_others) {
2374  envtbl = rb_hash_new();
2375  }
2376  else {
2377  envtbl = rb_const_get(rb_cObject, id_ENV);
2378  envtbl = rb_convert_type(envtbl, T_HASH, "Hash", "to_hash");
2379  }
2380  hide_obj(envtbl);
2381  if (envopts != Qfalse) {
2382  st_table *stenv = RHASH_TBL_RAW(envtbl);
2383  long i;
2384  for (i = 0; i < RARRAY_LEN(envopts); i++) {
2385  VALUE pair = RARRAY_AREF(envopts, i);
2386  VALUE key = RARRAY_AREF(pair, 0);
2387  VALUE val = RARRAY_AREF(pair, 1);
2388  if (NIL_P(val)) {
2389  st_data_t stkey = (st_data_t)key;
2390  st_delete(stenv, &stkey, NULL);
2391  }
2392  else {
2393  st_insert(stenv, (st_data_t)key, (st_data_t)val);
2394  RB_OBJ_WRITTEN(envtbl, Qundef, key);
2395  RB_OBJ_WRITTEN(envtbl, Qundef, val);
2396  }
2397  }
2398  }
2399  envp_buf = rb_str_buf_new(0);
2400  hide_obj(envp_buf);
2401  st_foreach(RHASH_TBL_RAW(envtbl), fill_envp_buf_i, (st_data_t)envp_buf);
2402  envp_str = rb_str_buf_new(sizeof(char*) * (RHASH_SIZE(envtbl) + 1));
2403  hide_obj(envp_str);
2404  p = RSTRING_PTR(envp_buf);
2405  ep = p + RSTRING_LEN(envp_buf);
2406  while (p < ep) {
2407  rb_str_buf_cat(envp_str, (char *)&p, sizeof(p));
2408  p += strlen(p) + 1;
2409  }
2410  p = NULL;
2411  rb_str_buf_cat(envp_str, (char *)&p, sizeof(p));
2412  eargp->envp_str = envp_str;
2413  eargp->envp_buf = envp_buf;
2414 
2415  /*
2416  char **tmp_envp = (char **)RSTRING_PTR(envp_str);
2417  while (*tmp_envp) {
2418  printf("%s\n", *tmp_envp);
2419  tmp_envp++;
2420  }
2421  */
2422  }
2423 
2424  RB_GC_GUARD(execarg_obj);
2425  return Qnil;
2426 }
2427 
2428 void
2429 rb_execarg_parent_start(VALUE execarg_obj)
2430 {
2431  int state;
2432  rb_protect(rb_execarg_parent_start1, execarg_obj, &state);
2433  if (state) {
2434  rb_execarg_parent_end(execarg_obj);
2435  rb_jump_tag(state);
2436  }
2437 }
2438 
2439 static VALUE
2440 execarg_parent_end(VALUE execarg_obj)
2441 {
2442  struct rb_execarg *eargp = rb_execarg_get(execarg_obj);
2443  int err = errno;
2444  VALUE ary;
2445 
2446  ary = eargp->fd_open;
2447  if (ary != Qfalse) {
2448  long i;
2449  for (i = 0; i < RARRAY_LEN(ary); i++) {
2450  VALUE elt = RARRAY_AREF(ary, i);
2451  VALUE param = RARRAY_AREF(elt, 1);
2452  VALUE fd2v;
2453  int fd2;
2454  fd2v = RARRAY_AREF(param, 3);
2455  if (!NIL_P(fd2v)) {
2456  fd2 = FIX2INT(fd2v);
2457  parent_redirect_close(fd2);
2458  RARRAY_ASET(param, 3, Qnil);
2459  }
2460  }
2461  }
2462 
2463  errno = err;
2464  return execarg_obj;
2465 }
2466 
2467 void
2468 rb_execarg_parent_end(VALUE execarg_obj)
2469 {
2470  execarg_parent_end(execarg_obj);
2471  RB_GC_GUARD(execarg_obj);
2472 }
2473 
2474 #if defined(__APPLE__) || defined(__HAIKU__)
2475 static int rb_exec_without_timer_thread(const struct rb_execarg *eargp, char *errmsg, size_t errmsg_buflen);
2476 #endif
2477 
2478 /*
2479  * call-seq:
2480  * exec([env,] command... [,options])
2481  *
2482  * Replaces the current process by running the given external _command_, which
2483  * can take one of the following forms:
2484  *
2485  * [<code>exec(commandline)</code>]
2486  * command line string which is passed to the standard shell
2487  * [<code>exec(cmdname, arg1, ...)</code>]
2488  * command name and one or more arguments (no shell)
2489  * [<code>exec([cmdname, argv0], arg1, ...)</code>]
2490  * command name, argv[0] and zero or more arguments (no shell)
2491  *
2492  * In the first form, the string is taken as a command line that is subject to
2493  * shell expansion before being executed.
2494  *
2495  * The standard shell always means <code>"/bin/sh"</code> on Unix-like systems,
2496  * same as <code>ENV["RUBYSHELL"]</code>
2497  * (or <code>ENV["COMSPEC"]</code> on Windows NT series), and similar.
2498  *
2499  * If the string from the first form (<code>exec("command")</code>) follows
2500  * these simple rules:
2501  *
2502  * * no meta characters
2503  * * no shell reserved word and no special built-in
2504  * * Ruby invokes the command directly without shell
2505  *
2506  * You can force shell invocation by adding ";" to the string (because ";" is
2507  * a meta character).
2508  *
2509  * Note that this behavior is observable by pid obtained
2510  * (return value of spawn() and IO#pid for IO.popen) is the pid of the invoked
2511  * command, not shell.
2512  *
2513  * In the second form (<code>exec("command1", "arg1", ...)</code>), the first
2514  * is taken as a command name and the rest are passed as parameters to command
2515  * with no shell expansion.
2516  *
2517  * In the third form (<code>exec(["command", "argv0"], "arg1", ...)</code>),
2518  * starting a two-element array at the beginning of the command, the first
2519  * element is the command to be executed, and the second argument is used as
2520  * the <code>argv[0]</code> value, which may show up in process listings.
2521  *
2522  * In order to execute the command, one of the <code>exec(2)</code> system
2523  * calls are used, so the running command may inherit some of the environment
2524  * of the original program (including open file descriptors).
2525  *
2526  * This behavior is modified by the given +env+ and +options+ parameters. See
2527  * ::spawn for details.
2528  *
2529  * If the command fails to execute (typically <code>Errno::ENOENT</code> when
2530  * it was not found) a SystemCallError exception is raised.
2531  *
2532  * This method modifies process attributes according to given +options+ before
2533  * <code>exec(2)</code> system call. See ::spawn for more details about the
2534  * given +options+.
2535  *
2536  * The modified attributes may be retained when <code>exec(2)</code> system
2537  * call fails.
2538  *
2539  * For example, hard resource limits are not restorable.
2540  *
2541  * Consider to create a child process using ::spawn or Kernel#system if this
2542  * is not acceptable.
2543  *
2544  * exec "echo *" # echoes list of files in current directory
2545  * # never get here
2546  *
2547  * exec "echo", "*" # echoes an asterisk
2548  * # never get here
2549  */
2550 
2551 VALUE
2552 rb_f_exec(int argc, const VALUE *argv)
2553 {
2554  VALUE execarg_obj, fail_str;
2555  struct rb_execarg *eargp;
2556 #define CHILD_ERRMSG_BUFLEN 80
2557  char errmsg[CHILD_ERRMSG_BUFLEN] = { '\0' };
2558 
2559  execarg_obj = rb_execarg_new(argc, argv, TRUE);
2560  eargp = rb_execarg_get(execarg_obj);
2561  rb_execarg_parent_start(execarg_obj);
2562  fail_str = eargp->use_shell ? eargp->invoke.sh.shell_script : eargp->invoke.cmd.command_name;
2563 
2564 #if defined(__APPLE__) || defined(__HAIKU__)
2565  rb_exec_without_timer_thread(eargp, errmsg, sizeof(errmsg));
2566 #else
2567  before_exec_async_signal_safe(); /* async-signal-safe */
2568  rb_exec_async_signal_safe(eargp, errmsg, sizeof(errmsg));
2569  preserving_errno(after_exec_async_signal_safe()); /* async-signal-safe */
2570 #endif
2571  RB_GC_GUARD(execarg_obj);
2572  if (errmsg[0])
2573  rb_sys_fail(errmsg);
2574  rb_sys_fail_str(fail_str);
2575  return Qnil; /* dummy */
2576 }
2577 
2578 #define ERRMSG(str) do { if (errmsg && 0 < errmsg_buflen) strlcpy(errmsg, (str), errmsg_buflen); } while (0)
2579 
2580 static int
2581 save_redirect_fd(int fd, struct rb_execarg *sargp, char *errmsg, size_t errmsg_buflen)
2582 {
2583  if (sargp) {
2584  VALUE newary;
2585  int save_fd = redirect_dup(fd);
2586  if (save_fd == -1) {
2587  if (errno == EBADF)
2588  return 0;
2589  ERRMSG("dup");
2590  return -1;
2591  }
2592  rb_update_max_fd(save_fd);
2593  newary = sargp->fd_dup2;
2594  if (newary == Qfalse) {
2595  newary = hide_obj(rb_ary_new());
2596  sargp->fd_dup2 = newary;
2597  }
2598  rb_ary_push(newary,
2599  hide_obj(rb_assoc_new(INT2FIX(fd), INT2FIX(save_fd))));
2600 
2601  newary = sargp->fd_close;
2602  if (newary == Qfalse) {
2603  newary = hide_obj(rb_ary_new());
2604  sargp->fd_close = newary;
2605  }
2606  rb_ary_push(newary, hide_obj(rb_assoc_new(INT2FIX(save_fd), Qnil)));
2607  }
2608 
2609  return 0;
2610 }
2611 
2612 static int
2613 intcmp(const void *a, const void *b)
2614 {
2615  return *(int*)a - *(int*)b;
2616 }
2617 
2618 static int
2619 intrcmp(const void *a, const void *b)
2620 {
2621  return *(int*)b - *(int*)a;
2622 }
2623 
2624 struct run_exec_dup2_fd_pair {
2625  int oldfd;
2626  int newfd;
2627  long older_index;
2628  long num_newer;
2629 };
2630 
2631 static long
2632 run_exec_dup2_tmpbuf_size(long n)
2633 {
2634  return sizeof(struct run_exec_dup2_fd_pair) * n;
2635 }
2636 
2637 /* This function should be async-signal-safe. Actually it is. */
2638 static int
2639 fd_clear_cloexec(int fd, char *errmsg, size_t errmsg_buflen)
2640 {
2641 #ifdef F_GETFD
2642  int ret;
2643  ret = fcntl(fd, F_GETFD); /* async-signal-safe */
2644  if (ret == -1) {
2645  ERRMSG("fcntl(F_GETFD)");
2646  return -1;
2647  }
2648  if (ret & FD_CLOEXEC) {
2649  ret &= ~FD_CLOEXEC;
2650  ret = fcntl(fd, F_SETFD, ret); /* async-signal-safe */
2651  if (ret == -1) {
2652  ERRMSG("fcntl(F_SETFD)");
2653  return -1;
2654  }
2655  }
2656 #endif
2657  return 0;
2658 }
2659 
2660 /* This function should be async-signal-safe when sargp is NULL. Hopefully it is. */
2661 static int
2662 run_exec_dup2(VALUE ary, VALUE tmpbuf, struct rb_execarg *sargp, char *errmsg, size_t errmsg_buflen)
2663 {
2664  long n, i;
2665  int ret;
2666  int extra_fd = -1;
2667  struct run_exec_dup2_fd_pair *pairs = 0;
2668 
2669  n = RARRAY_LEN(ary);
2670  pairs = (struct run_exec_dup2_fd_pair *)RSTRING_PTR(tmpbuf);
2671 
2672  /* initialize oldfd and newfd: O(n) */
2673  for (i = 0; i < n; i++) {
2674  VALUE elt = RARRAY_AREF(ary, i);
2675  pairs[i].oldfd = FIX2INT(RARRAY_AREF(elt, 1));
2676  pairs[i].newfd = FIX2INT(RARRAY_AREF(elt, 0)); /* unique */
2677  pairs[i].older_index = -1;
2678  }
2679 
2680  /* sort the table by oldfd: O(n log n) */
2681  if (!sargp)
2682  qsort(pairs, n, sizeof(struct run_exec_dup2_fd_pair), intcmp); /* hopefully async-signal-safe */
2683  else
2684  qsort(pairs, n, sizeof(struct run_exec_dup2_fd_pair), intrcmp);
2685 
2686  /* initialize older_index and num_newer: O(n log n) */
2687  for (i = 0; i < n; i++) {
2688  int newfd = pairs[i].newfd;
2689  struct run_exec_dup2_fd_pair key, *found;
2690  key.oldfd = newfd;
2691  found = bsearch(&key, pairs, n, sizeof(struct run_exec_dup2_fd_pair), intcmp); /* hopefully async-signal-safe */
2692  pairs[i].num_newer = 0;
2693  if (found) {
2694  while (pairs < found && (found-1)->oldfd == newfd)
2695  found--;
2696  while (found < pairs+n && found->oldfd == newfd) {
2697  pairs[i].num_newer++;
2698  found->older_index = i;
2699  found++;
2700  }
2701  }
2702  }
2703 
2704  /* non-cyclic redirection: O(n) */
2705  for (i = 0; i < n; i++) {
2706  long j = i;
2707  while (j != -1 && pairs[j].oldfd != -1 && pairs[j].num_newer == 0) {
2708  if (save_redirect_fd(pairs[j].newfd, sargp, errmsg, errmsg_buflen) < 0) /* async-signal-safe */
2709  goto fail;
2710  ret = redirect_dup2(pairs[j].oldfd, pairs[j].newfd); /* async-signal-safe */
2711  if (ret == -1) {
2712  ERRMSG("dup2");
2713  goto fail;
2714  }
2715  rb_update_max_fd(pairs[j].newfd); /* async-signal-safe but don't need to call it in a child process. */
2716  pairs[j].oldfd = -1;
2717  j = pairs[j].older_index;
2718  if (j != -1)
2719  pairs[j].num_newer--;
2720  }
2721  }
2722 
2723  /* cyclic redirection: O(n) */
2724  for (i = 0; i < n; i++) {
2725  long j;
2726  if (pairs[i].oldfd == -1)
2727  continue;
2728  if (pairs[i].oldfd == pairs[i].newfd) { /* self cycle */
2729  if (fd_clear_cloexec(pairs[i].oldfd, errmsg, errmsg_buflen) == -1) /* async-signal-safe */
2730  goto fail;
2731  pairs[i].oldfd = -1;
2732  continue;
2733  }
2734  if (extra_fd == -1) {
2735  extra_fd = redirect_dup(pairs[i].oldfd); /* async-signal-safe */
2736  if (extra_fd == -1) {
2737  ERRMSG("dup");
2738  goto fail;
2739  }
2740  rb_update_max_fd(extra_fd);
2741  }
2742  else {
2743  ret = redirect_dup2(pairs[i].oldfd, extra_fd); /* async-signal-safe */
2744  if (ret == -1) {
2745  ERRMSG("dup2");
2746  goto fail;
2747  }
2748  rb_update_max_fd(extra_fd);
2749  }
2750  pairs[i].oldfd = extra_fd;
2751  j = pairs[i].older_index;
2752  pairs[i].older_index = -1;
2753  while (j != -1) {
2754  ret = redirect_dup2(pairs[j].oldfd, pairs[j].newfd); /* async-signal-safe */
2755  if (ret == -1) {
2756  ERRMSG("dup2");
2757  goto fail;
2758  }
2759  rb_update_max_fd(ret);
2760  pairs[j].oldfd = -1;
2761  j = pairs[j].older_index;
2762  }
2763  }
2764  if (extra_fd != -1) {
2765  ret = redirect_close(extra_fd); /* async-signal-safe */
2766  if (ret == -1) {
2767  ERRMSG("close");
2768  goto fail;
2769  }
2770  }
2771 
2772  return 0;
2773 
2774  fail:
2775  return -1;
2776 }
2777 
2778 /* This function should be async-signal-safe. Actually it is. */
2779 static int
2780 run_exec_close(VALUE ary, char *errmsg, size_t errmsg_buflen)
2781 {
2782  long i;
2783  int ret;
2784 
2785  for (i = 0; i < RARRAY_LEN(ary); i++) {
2786  VALUE elt = RARRAY_AREF(ary, i);
2787  int fd = FIX2INT(RARRAY_AREF(elt, 0));
2788  ret = redirect_close(fd); /* async-signal-safe */
2789  if (ret == -1) {
2790  ERRMSG("close");
2791  return -1;
2792  }
2793  }
2794  return 0;
2795 }
2796 
2797 /* This function should be async-signal-safe when sargp is NULL. Actually it is. */
2798 static int
2799 run_exec_dup2_child(VALUE ary, struct rb_execarg *sargp, char *errmsg, size_t errmsg_buflen)
2800 {
2801  long i;
2802  int ret;
2803 
2804  for (i = 0; i < RARRAY_LEN(ary); i++) {
2805  VALUE elt = RARRAY_AREF(ary, i);
2806  int newfd = FIX2INT(RARRAY_AREF(elt, 0));
2807  int oldfd = FIX2INT(RARRAY_AREF(elt, 1));
2808 
2809  if (save_redirect_fd(newfd, sargp, errmsg, errmsg_buflen) < 0) /* async-signal-safe */
2810  return -1;
2811  ret = redirect_dup2(oldfd, newfd); /* async-signal-safe */
2812  if (ret == -1) {
2813  ERRMSG("dup2");
2814  return -1;
2815  }
2816  rb_update_max_fd(newfd);
2817  }
2818  return 0;
2819 }
2820 
2821 #ifdef HAVE_SETPGID
2822 /* This function should be async-signal-safe when sargp is NULL. Actually it is. */
2823 static int
2824 run_exec_pgroup(const struct rb_execarg *eargp, struct rb_execarg *sargp, char *errmsg, size_t errmsg_buflen)
2825 {
2826  /*
2827  * If FD_CLOEXEC is available, rb_fork_async_signal_safe waits the child's execve.
2828  * So setpgid is done in the child when rb_fork_async_signal_safe is returned in
2829  * the parent.
2830  * No race condition, even without setpgid from the parent.
2831  * (Is there an environment which has setpgid but no FD_CLOEXEC?)
2832  */
2833  int ret;
2834  rb_pid_t pgroup;
2835 
2836  pgroup = eargp->pgroup_pgid;
2837  if (pgroup == -1)
2838  return 0;
2839 
2840  if (sargp) {
2841  /* maybe meaningless with no fork environment... */
2842  sargp->pgroup_given = 1;
2843  sargp->pgroup_pgid = getpgrp();
2844  }
2845 
2846  if (pgroup == 0) {
2847  pgroup = getpid(); /* async-signal-safe */
2848  }
2849  ret = setpgid(getpid(), pgroup); /* async-signal-safe */
2850  if (ret == -1) ERRMSG("setpgid");
2851  return ret;
2852 }
2853 #endif
2854 
2855 #if defined(HAVE_SETRLIMIT) && defined(RLIM2NUM)
2856 /* This function should be async-signal-safe when sargp is NULL. Hopefully it is. */
2857 static int
2858 run_exec_rlimit(VALUE ary, struct rb_execarg *sargp, char *errmsg, size_t errmsg_buflen)
2859 {
2860  long i;
2861  for (i = 0; i < RARRAY_LEN(ary); i++) {
2862  VALUE elt = RARRAY_AREF(ary, i);
2863  int rtype = NUM2INT(RARRAY_AREF(elt, 0));
2864  struct rlimit rlim;
2865  if (sargp) {
2866  VALUE tmp, newary;
2867  if (getrlimit(rtype, &rlim) == -1) {
2868  ERRMSG("getrlimit");
2869  return -1;
2870  }
2871  tmp = hide_obj(rb_ary_new3(3, RARRAY_AREF(elt, 0),
2872  RLIM2NUM(rlim.rlim_cur),
2873  RLIM2NUM(rlim.rlim_max)));
2874  if (sargp->rlimit_limits == Qfalse)
2875  newary = sargp->rlimit_limits = hide_obj(rb_ary_new());
2876  else
2877  newary = sargp->rlimit_limits;
2878  rb_ary_push(newary, tmp);
2879  }
2880  rlim.rlim_cur = NUM2RLIM(RARRAY_AREF(elt, 1));
2881  rlim.rlim_max = NUM2RLIM(RARRAY_AREF(elt, 2));
2882  if (setrlimit(rtype, &rlim) == -1) { /* hopefully async-signal-safe */
2883  ERRMSG("setrlimit");
2884  return -1;
2885  }
2886  }
2887  return 0;
2888 }
2889 #endif
2890 
2891 #if !defined(HAVE_WORKING_FORK)
2892 static VALUE
2893 save_env_i(RB_BLOCK_CALL_FUNC_ARGLIST(i, ary))
2894 {
2895  rb_ary_push(ary, hide_obj(rb_ary_dup(argv[0])));
2896  return Qnil;
2897 }
2898 
2899 static void
2900 save_env(struct rb_execarg *sargp)
2901 {
2902  if (!sargp)
2903  return;
2904  if (sargp->env_modification == Qfalse) {
2905  VALUE env = rb_const_get(rb_cObject, id_ENV);
2906  if (RTEST(env)) {
2907  VALUE ary = hide_obj(rb_ary_new());
2908  rb_block_call(env, idEach, 0, 0, save_env_i,
2909  (VALUE)ary);
2910  sargp->env_modification = ary;
2911  }
2912  sargp->unsetenv_others_given = 1;
2913  sargp->unsetenv_others_do = 1;
2914  }
2915 }
2916 #endif
2917 
2918 /* This function should be async-signal-safe when sargp is NULL. Hopefully it is. */
2919 int
2920 rb_execarg_run_options(const struct rb_execarg *eargp, struct rb_execarg *sargp, char *errmsg, size_t errmsg_buflen)
2921 {
2922  VALUE obj;
2923 
2924  if (sargp) {
2925  /* assume that sargp is always NULL on fork-able environments */
2926  MEMZERO(sargp, struct rb_execarg, 1);
2927  sargp->redirect_fds = Qnil;
2928  }
2929 
2930 #ifdef HAVE_SETPGID
2931  if (eargp->pgroup_given) {
2932  if (run_exec_pgroup(eargp, sargp, errmsg, errmsg_buflen) == -1) /* async-signal-safe */
2933  return -1;
2934  }
2935 #endif
2936 
2937 #if defined(HAVE_SETRLIMIT) && defined(RLIM2NUM)
2938  obj = eargp->rlimit_limits;
2939  if (obj != Qfalse) {
2940  if (run_exec_rlimit(obj, sargp, errmsg, errmsg_buflen) == -1) /* hopefully async-signal-safe */
2941  return -1;
2942  }
2943 #endif
2944 
2945 #if !defined(HAVE_WORKING_FORK)
2946  if (eargp->unsetenv_others_given && eargp->unsetenv_others_do) {
2947  save_env(sargp);
2948  rb_env_clear();
2949  }
2950 
2951  obj = eargp->env_modification;
2952  if (obj != Qfalse) {
2953  long i;
2954  save_env(sargp);
2955  for (i = 0; i < RARRAY_LEN(obj); i++) {
2956  VALUE pair = RARRAY_AREF(obj, i);
2957  VALUE key = RARRAY_AREF(pair, 0);
2958  VALUE val = RARRAY_AREF(pair, 1);
2959  if (NIL_P(val))
2960  ruby_setenv(StringValueCStr(key), 0);
2961  else
2962  ruby_setenv(StringValueCStr(key), StringValueCStr(val));
2963  }
2964  }
2965 #endif
2966 
2967  if (eargp->umask_given) {
2968  mode_t mask = eargp->umask_mask;
2969  mode_t oldmask = umask(mask); /* never fail */ /* async-signal-safe */
2970  if (sargp) {
2971  sargp->umask_given = 1;
2972  sargp->umask_mask = oldmask;
2973  }
2974  }
2975 
2976  obj = eargp->fd_dup2;
2977  if (obj != Qfalse) {
2978  if (run_exec_dup2(obj, eargp->dup2_tmpbuf, sargp, errmsg, errmsg_buflen) == -1) /* hopefully async-signal-safe */
2979  return -1;
2980  }
2981
