2982  obj = eargp->fd_close;
2983  if (obj != Qfalse) {
2984  if (sargp)
2985  rb_warn("cannot close fd before spawn");
2986  else {
2987  if (run_exec_close(obj, errmsg, errmsg_buflen) == -1) /* async-signal-safe */
2988  return -1;
2989  }
2990  }
2991 
2992 #ifdef HAVE_WORKING_FORK
2993  if (!eargp->close_others_given || eargp->close_others_do) {
2994  rb_close_before_exec(3, eargp->close_others_maxhint, eargp->redirect_fds); /* async-signal-safe */
2995  }
2996 #endif
2997 
2998  obj = eargp->fd_dup2_child;
2999  if (obj != Qfalse) {
3000  if (run_exec_dup2_child(obj, sargp, errmsg, errmsg_buflen) == -1) /* async-signal-safe */
3001  return -1;
3002  }
3003 
3004  if (eargp->chdir_given) {
3005  if (sargp) {
3006  char *cwd = my_getcwd();
3007  sargp->chdir_given = 1;
3008  sargp->chdir_dir = hide_obj(rb_str_new2(cwd));
3009  xfree(cwd);
3010  }
3011  if (chdir(RSTRING_PTR(eargp->chdir_dir)) == -1) { /* async-signal-safe */
3012  ERRMSG("chdir");
3013  return -1;
3014  }
3015  }
3016 
3017 #ifdef HAVE_SETGID
3018  if (eargp->gid_given) {
3019  if (setgid(eargp->gid) < 0) {
3020  ERRMSG("setgid");
3021  return -1;
3022  }
3023  }
3024 #endif
3025 #ifdef HAVE_SETUID
3026  if (eargp->uid_given) {
3027  if (setuid(eargp->uid) < 0) {
3028  ERRMSG("setuid");
3029  return -1;
3030  }
3031  }
3032 #endif
3033 
3034  if (sargp) {
3035  VALUE ary = sargp->fd_dup2;
3036  if (ary != Qfalse) {
3037  size_t len = run_exec_dup2_tmpbuf_size(RARRAY_LEN(ary));
3038  VALUE tmpbuf = hide_obj(rb_str_new(0, len));
3039  rb_str_set_len(tmpbuf, len);
3040  sargp->dup2_tmpbuf = tmpbuf;
3041  }
3042  }
3043 
3044  return 0;
3045 }
3046 
3047 /* This function should be async-signal-safe. Hopefully it is. */
3048 int
3049 rb_exec_async_signal_safe(const struct rb_execarg *eargp, char *errmsg, size_t errmsg_buflen)
3050 {
3051 #if !defined(HAVE_WORKING_FORK)
3052  struct rb_execarg sarg, *const sargp = &sarg;
3053 #else
3054  struct rb_execarg *const sargp = NULL;
3055 #endif
3056 
3057  if (rb_execarg_run_options(eargp, sargp, errmsg, errmsg_buflen) < 0) { /* hopefully async-signal-safe */
3058  goto failure;
3059  }
3060 
3061  if (eargp->use_shell) {
3062  proc_exec_sh(RSTRING_PTR(eargp->invoke.sh.shell_script), eargp->envp_str); /* async-signal-safe */
3063  }
3064  else {
3065  char *abspath = NULL;
3066  if (!NIL_P(eargp->invoke.cmd.command_abspath))
3067  abspath = RSTRING_PTR(eargp->invoke.cmd.command_abspath);
3068  proc_exec_cmd(abspath, eargp->invoke.cmd.argv_str, eargp->envp_str); /* async-signal-safe */
3069  }
3070 #if !defined(HAVE_WORKING_FORK)
3071  preserving_errno(rb_execarg_run_options(sargp, NULL, errmsg, errmsg_buflen));
3072 #endif
3073 
3074 failure:
3075  return -1;
3076 }
3077 
3078 #if defined(__APPLE__) || defined(__HAIKU__)
3079 static int
3080 rb_exec_without_timer_thread(const struct rb_execarg *eargp, char *errmsg, size_t errmsg_buflen)
3081 {
3082  int ret;
3083  before_exec();
3084  ret = rb_exec_async_signal_safe(eargp, errmsg, errmsg_buflen); /* hopefully async-signal-safe */
3085  preserving_errno(after_exec()); /* not async-signal-safe because it calls rb_thread_start_timer_thread. */
3086  return ret;
3087 }
3088 #endif
3089 
3090 #ifdef HAVE_WORKING_FORK
3091 /* This function should be async-signal-safe. Hopefully it is. */
3092 static int
3093 rb_exec_atfork(void* arg, char *errmsg, size_t errmsg_buflen)
3094 {
3095  return rb_exec_async_signal_safe(arg, errmsg, errmsg_buflen); /* hopefully async-signal-safe */
3096 }
3097 #endif
3098 
3099 #ifdef HAVE_WORKING_FORK
3100 #if SIZEOF_INT == SIZEOF_LONG
3101 #define proc_syswait (VALUE (*)(VALUE))rb_syswait
3102 #else
3103 static VALUE
3104 proc_syswait(VALUE pid)
3105 {
3106  rb_syswait((int)pid);
3107  return Qnil;
3108 }
3109 #endif
3110 
3111 static int
3112 move_fds_to_avoid_crash(int *fdp, int n, VALUE fds)
3113 {
3114  int min = 0;
3115  int i;
3116  for (i = 0; i < n; i++) {
3117  int ret;
3118  while (RTEST(rb_hash_lookup(fds, INT2FIX(fdp[i])))) {
3119  if (min <= fdp[i])
3120  min = fdp[i]+1;
3121  while (RTEST(rb_hash_lookup(fds, INT2FIX(min))))
3122  min++;
3123  ret = rb_cloexec_fcntl_dupfd(fdp[i], min);
3124  if (ret == -1)
3125  return -1;
3126  rb_update_max_fd(ret);
3127  close(fdp[i]);
3128  fdp[i] = ret;
3129  }
3130  }
3131  return 0;
3132 }
3133 
3134 static int
3135 pipe_nocrash(int filedes[2], VALUE fds)
3136 {
3137  int ret;
3138  ret = rb_pipe(filedes);
3139  if (ret == -1)
3140  return -1;
3141  if (RTEST(fds)) {
3142  int save = errno;
3143  if (move_fds_to_avoid_crash(filedes, 2, fds) == -1) {
3144  close(filedes[0]);
3145  close(filedes[1]);
3146  return -1;
3147  }
3148  errno = save;
3149  }
3150  return ret;
3151 }
3152 
3153 #ifndef O_BINARY
3154 #define O_BINARY 0
3155 #endif
3156 
3157 static int
3158 handle_fork_error(int *status, int *ep, volatile int *try_gc_p)
3159 {
3160  int state = 0;
3161 
3162  switch (errno) {
3163  case ENOMEM:
3164  if ((*try_gc_p)-- > 0 && !rb_during_gc()) {
3165  rb_gc();
3166  return 0;
3167  }
3168  break;
3169  case EAGAIN:
3170 #if defined(EWOULDBLOCK) && EWOULDBLOCK != EAGAIN
3171  case EWOULDBLOCK:
3172 #endif
3173  if (!status && !ep) {
3174  rb_thread_sleep(1);
3175  return 0;
3176  }
3177  else {
3178  rb_protect((VALUE (*)())rb_thread_sleep, 1, &state);
3179  if (status) *status = state;
3180  if (!state) return 0;
3181  }
3182  break;
3183  }
3184  if (ep) {
3185  preserving_errno((close(ep[0]), close(ep[1])));
3186  }
3187  if (state && !status) rb_jump_tag(state);
3188  return -1;
3189 }
3190 
3191 #define prefork() ( \
3192  rb_io_flush(rb_stdout), \
3193  rb_io_flush(rb_stderr) \
3194  )
3195 
3196 /*
3197  * Forks child process, and returns the process ID in the parent
3198  * process.
3199  *
3200  * If +status+ is given, protects from any exceptions and sets the
3201  * jump status to it, and returns -1. If failed to fork new process
3202  * but no exceptions occurred, sets 0 to it. Otherwise, if forked
3203  * successfully, the value of +status+ is undetermined.
3204  *
3205  * In the child process, just returns 0 if +chfunc+ is +NULL+.
3206  * Otherwise +chfunc+ will be called with +charg+, and then the child
3207  * process exits with +EXIT_SUCCESS+ when it returned zero.
3208  *
3209  * In the case of the function is called and returns non-zero value,
3210  * the child process exits with non-+EXIT_SUCCESS+ value (normally
3211  * 127). And, on the platforms where +FD_CLOEXEC+ is available,
3212  * +errno+ is propagated to the parent process, and this function
3213  * returns -1 in the parent process. On the other platforms, just
3214  * returns pid.
3215  *
3216  * If fds is not Qnil, internal pipe for the errno propagation is
3217  * arranged to avoid conflicts of the hash keys in +fds+.
3218  *
3219  * +chfunc+ must not raise any exceptions.
3220  */
3221 
3222 static ssize_t
3223 write_retry(int fd, const void *buf, size_t len)
3224 {
3225  ssize_t w;
3226 
3227  do {
3228  w = write(fd, buf, len);
3229  } while (w < 0 && errno == EINTR);
3230 
3231  return w;
3232 }
3233 
3234 static ssize_t
3235 read_retry(int fd, void *buf, size_t len)
3236 {
3237  ssize_t r;
3238 
3239  do {
3240  r = read(fd, buf, len);
3241  } while (r < 0 && errno == EINTR);
3242 
3243  return r;
3244 }
3245 
3246 static void
3247 send_child_error(int fd, char *errmsg, size_t errmsg_buflen)
3248 {
3249  int err;
3250 
3251  err = errno;
3252  if (write_retry(fd, &err, sizeof(err)) < 0) err = errno;
3253  if (errmsg && 0 < errmsg_buflen) {
3254  errmsg[errmsg_buflen-1] = '\0';
3255  errmsg_buflen = strlen(errmsg);
3256  if (errmsg_buflen > 0 && write_retry(fd, errmsg, errmsg_buflen) < 0)
3257  err = errno;
3258  }
3259 }
3260 
3261 static int
3262 recv_child_error(int fd, int *errp, char *errmsg, size_t errmsg_buflen)
3263 {
3264  int err;
3265  ssize_t size;
3266  if ((size = read_retry(fd, &err, sizeof(err))) < 0) {
3267  err = errno;
3268  }
3269  *errp = err;
3270  if (size == sizeof(err) &&
3271  errmsg && 0 < errmsg_buflen) {
3272  ssize_t ret = read_retry(fd, errmsg, errmsg_buflen-1);
3273  if (0 <= ret) {
3274  errmsg[ret] = '\0';
3275  }
3276  }
3277  close(fd);
3278  return size != 0;
3279 }
3280 
3281 #ifdef HAVE_WORKING_VFORK
3282 #if !defined(HAVE_GETRESUID) && defined(HAVE_GETUIDX)
3283 /* AIX 7.1 */
3284 static int
3285 getresuid(rb_uid_t *ruid, rb_uid_t *euid, rb_uid_t *suid)
3286 {
3287  rb_uid_t ret;
3288 
3289  *ruid = getuid();
3290  *euid = geteuid();
3291  ret = getuidx(ID_SAVED);
3292  if (ret == (rb_uid_t)-1)
3293  return -1;
3294  *suid = ret;
3295  return 0;
3296 }
3297 #define HAVE_GETRESUID
3298 #endif
3299 
3300 #if !defined(HAVE_GETRESGID) && defined(HAVE_GETGIDX)
3301 /* AIX 7.1 */
3302 static int
3303 getresgid(rb_gid_t *rgid, rb_gid_t *egid, rb_gid_t *sgid)
3304 {
3305  rb_gid_t ret;
3306 
3307  *rgid = getgid();
3308  *egid = getegid();
3309  ret = getgidx(ID_SAVED);
3310  if (ret == (rb_gid_t)-1)
3311  return -1;
3312  *sgid = ret;
3313  return 0;
3314 }
3315 #define HAVE_GETRESGID
3316 #endif
3317 
3318 static int
3319 has_privilege(void)
3320 {
3321  /*
3322  * has_privilege() is used to choose vfork() or fork().
3323  *
3324  * If the process has privilege, the parent process or
3325  * the child process can change UID/GID.
3326  * If vfork() is used to create the child process and
3327  * the parent or child process change effective UID/GID,
3328  * different privileged processes shares memory.
3329  * It is a bad situation.
3330  * So, fork() should be used.
3331  */
3332 
3333  rb_uid_t ruid, euid;
3334  rb_gid_t rgid, egid;
3335 
3336 #if defined HAVE_ISSETUGID
3337  if (issetugid())
3338  return 1;
3339 #endif
3340 
3341 #ifdef HAVE_GETRESUID
3342  {
3343  int ret;
3344  rb_uid_t suid;
3345  ret = getresuid(&ruid, &euid, &suid);
3346  if (ret == -1)
3347  rb_sys_fail("getresuid(2)");
3348  if (euid != suid)
3349  return 1;
3350  }
3351 #else
3352  ruid = getuid();
3353  euid = geteuid();
3354 #endif
3355 
3356  if (euid == 0 || euid != ruid)
3357  return 1;
3358 
3359 #ifdef HAVE_GETRESGID
3360  {
3361  int ret;
3362  rb_gid_t sgid;
3363  ret = getresgid(&rgid, &egid, &sgid);
3364  if (ret == -1)
3365  rb_sys_fail("getresgid(2)");
3366  if (egid != sgid)
3367  return 1;
3368  }
3369 #else
3370  rgid = getgid();
3371  egid = getegid();
3372 #endif
3373 
3374  if (egid != rgid)
3375  return 1;
3376 
3377  return 0;
3378 }
3379 #endif
3380 
3381 struct child_handler_disabler_state
3382 {
3383  sigset_t sigmask;
3384  int cancelstate;
3385 };
3386 
3387 static void
3388 disable_child_handler_before_fork(struct child_handler_disabler_state *old)
3389 {
3390  int ret;
3391  sigset_t all;
3392 
3393 #ifdef HAVE_PTHREAD_SIGMASK
3394  ret = sigfillset(&all);
3395  if (ret == -1)
3396  rb_sys_fail("sigfillset");
3397 
3398  ret = pthread_sigmask(SIG_SETMASK, &all, &old->sigmask); /* not async-signal-safe */
3399  if (ret != 0) {
3400  errno = ret;
3401  rb_sys_fail("pthread_sigmask");
3402  }
3403 #else
3404 # pragma GCC warning "pthread_sigmask on fork is not available. potentially dangerous"
3405 #endif
3406 
3407 #ifdef PTHREAD_CANCEL_DISABLE
3408  ret = pthread_setcancelstate(PTHREAD_CANCEL_DISABLE, &old->cancelstate);
3409  if (ret != 0) {
3410  errno = ret;
3411  rb_sys_fail("pthread_setcancelstate");
3412  }
3413 #endif
3414 }
3415 
3416 static void
3417 disable_child_handler_fork_parent(struct child_handler_disabler_state *old)
3418 {
3419  int ret;
3420 
3421 #ifdef PTHREAD_CANCEL_DISABLE
3422  ret = pthread_setcancelstate(old->cancelstate, NULL);
3423  if (ret != 0) {
3424  errno = ret;
3425  rb_sys_fail("pthread_setcancelstate");
3426  }
3427 #endif
3428 
3429 #ifdef HAVE_PTHREAD_SIGMASK
3430  ret = pthread_sigmask(SIG_SETMASK, &old->sigmask, NULL); /* not async-signal-safe */
3431  if (ret != 0) {
3432  errno = ret;
3433  rb_sys_fail("pthread_sigmask");
3434  }
3435 #else
3436 # pragma GCC warning "pthread_sigmask on fork is not available. potentially dangerous"
3437 #endif
3438 }
3439 
3440 /* This function should be async-signal-safe. Actually it is. */
3441 static int
3442 disable_child_handler_fork_child(struct child_handler_disabler_state *old, char *errmsg, size_t errmsg_buflen)
3443 {
3444  int sig;
3445  int ret;
3446 #ifdef POSIX_SIGNAL
3447  struct sigaction act, oact;
3448 
3449  act.sa_handler = SIG_DFL;
3450  act.sa_flags = 0;
3451  ret = sigemptyset(&act.sa_mask); /* async-signal-safe */
3452  if (ret == -1) {
3453  ERRMSG("sigemptyset");
3454  return -1;
3455  }
3456 #else
3457  sig_t handler;
3458 #endif
3459 
3460  for (sig = 1; sig < NSIG; sig++) {
3461  int reset = 0;
3462 #ifdef SIGPIPE
3463  if (sig == SIGPIPE)
3464  reset = 1;
3465 #endif
3466  if (!reset) {
3467 #ifdef POSIX_SIGNAL
3468  ret = sigaction(sig, NULL, &oact); /* async-signal-safe */
3469  if (ret == -1 && errno == EINVAL) {
3470  continue; /* Ignore invalid signal number. */
3471  }
3472  if (ret == -1) {
3473  ERRMSG("sigaction to obtain old action");
3474  return -1;
3475  }
3476  reset = (oact.sa_flags & SA_SIGINFO) ||
3477  (oact.sa_handler != SIG_IGN && oact.sa_handler != SIG_DFL);
3478 #else
3479  handler = signal(sig, SIG_DFL);
3480  if (handler == SIG_ERR && errno == EINVAL) {
3481  continue; /* Ignore invalid signal number */
3482  }
3483  if (handler == SIG_ERR) {
3484  ERRMSG("signal to obtain old action");
3485  return -1;
3486  }
3487  reset = (handler != SIG_IGN && handler != SIG_DFL);
3488 #endif
3489  }
3490  if (reset) {
3491 #ifdef POSIX_SIGNAL
3492  ret = sigaction(sig, &act, NULL); /* async-signal-safe */
3493  if (ret == -1) {
3494  ERRMSG("sigaction to set default action");
3495  return -1;
3496  }
3497 #else
3498  handler = signal(sig, handler);
3499  if (handler == SIG_ERR) {
3500  ERRMSG("signal to set default action");
3501  return -1;
3502  }
3503 #endif
3504  }
3505  }
3506 
3507  ret = sigprocmask(SIG_SETMASK, &old->sigmask, NULL); /* async-signal-safe */
3508  if (ret != 0) {
3509  ERRMSG("sigprocmask");
3510  return -1;
3511  }
3512  return 0;
3513 }
3514 
3515 static rb_pid_t
3516 retry_fork_async_signal_safe(int *status, int *ep,
3517  int (*chfunc)(void*, char *, size_t), void *charg,
3518  char *errmsg, size_t errmsg_buflen)
3519 {
3520  rb_pid_t pid;
3521  volatile int try_gc = 1;
3522  struct child_handler_disabler_state old;
3523 
3524  while (1) {
3525  prefork();
3526  disable_child_handler_before_fork(&old);
3527 #ifdef HAVE_WORKING_VFORK
3528  if (!has_privilege())
3529  pid = vfork();
3530  else
3531  pid = fork();
3532 #else
3533  pid = fork();
3534 #endif
3535  if (pid == 0) {/* fork succeed, child process */
3536  int ret;
3537  close(ep[0]);
3538  ret = disable_child_handler_fork_child(&old, errmsg, errmsg_buflen); /* async-signal-safe */
3539  if (ret == 0) {
3540  ret = chfunc(charg, errmsg, errmsg_buflen);
3541  if (!ret) _exit(EXIT_SUCCESS);
3542  }
3543  send_child_error(ep[1], errmsg, errmsg_buflen);
3544 #if EXIT_SUCCESS == 127
3545  _exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
3546 #else
3547  _exit(127);
3548 #endif
3549  }
3550  preserving_errno(disable_child_handler_fork_parent(&old));
3551  if (0 < pid) /* fork succeed, parent process */
3552  return pid;
3553  /* fork failed */
3554  if (handle_fork_error(status, ep, &try_gc))
3555  return -1;
3556  }
3557 }
3558 
3559 rb_pid_t
3560 rb_fork_async_signal_safe(int *status, int (*chfunc)(void*, char *, size_t), void *charg, VALUE fds,
3561  char *errmsg, size_t errmsg_buflen)
3562 {
3563  rb_pid_t pid;
3564  int err;
3565  int ep[2];
3566  int error_occurred;
3567 
3568  if (status) *status = 0;
3569 
3570  if (pipe_nocrash(ep, fds)) return -1;
3571  pid = retry_fork_async_signal_safe(status, ep, chfunc, charg, errmsg, errmsg_buflen);
3572  if (pid < 0)
3573  return pid;
3574  close(ep[1]);
3575  error_occurred = recv_child_error(ep[0], &err, errmsg, errmsg_buflen);
3576  if (error_occurred) {
3577  if (status) {
3578  rb_protect(proc_syswait, (VALUE)pid, status);
3579  }
3580  else {
3581  rb_syswait(pid);
3582  }
3583  errno = err;
3584  return -1;
3585  }
3586  return pid;
3587 }
3588 
3589 static rb_pid_t
3590 retry_fork_ruby(int *status)
3591 {
3592  rb_pid_t pid;
3593  int try_gc = 1;
3594 
3595  while (1) {
3596  prefork();
3597  before_fork_ruby();
3598  pid = fork();
3599  if (pid == 0) /* fork succeed, child process */
3600  return pid;
3601  preserving_errno(after_fork_ruby());
3602  if (0 < pid) /* fork succeed, parent process */
3603  return pid;
3604  /* fork failed */
3605  if (handle_fork_error(status, NULL, &try_gc))
3606  return -1;
3607  }
3608 }
3609 
3610 rb_pid_t
3611 rb_fork_ruby(int *status)
3612 {
3613  rb_pid_t pid;
3614 
3615  if (status) *status = 0;
3616 
3617  pid = retry_fork_ruby(status);
3618  if (pid < 0)
3619  return pid;
3620  if (!pid) {
3621  after_fork_ruby();
3622  }
3623  return pid;
3624 }
3625 
3626 #endif
3627 
3628 #if defined(HAVE_WORKING_FORK) && !defined(CANNOT_FORK_WITH_PTHREAD)
3629 /*
3630  * call-seq:
3631  * Kernel.fork [{ block }] -> fixnum or nil
3632  * Process.fork [{ block }] -> fixnum or nil
3633  *
3634  * Creates a subprocess. If a block is specified, that block is run
3635  * in the subprocess, and the subprocess terminates with a status of
3636  * zero. Otherwise, the +fork+ call returns twice, once in
3637  * the parent, returning the process ID of the child, and once in
3638  * the child, returning _nil_. The child process can exit using
3639  * <code>Kernel.exit!</code> to avoid running any
3640  * <code>at_exit</code> functions. The parent process should
3641  * use <code>Process.wait</code> to collect the termination statuses
3642  * of its children or use <code>Process.detach</code> to register
3643  * disinterest in their status; otherwise, the operating system
3644  * may accumulate zombie processes.
3645  *
3646  * The thread calling fork is the only thread in the created child process.
3647  * fork doesn't copy other threads.
3648  *
3649  * If fork is not usable, Process.respond_to?(:fork) returns false.
3650  *
3651  * Note that fork(2) is not available on some platforms like Windows and NetBSD 4.
3652  * Therefore you should use spawn() instead of fork().
3653  */
3654 
3655 static VALUE
3656 rb_f_fork(VALUE obj)
3657 {
3658  rb_pid_t pid;
3659 
3660  rb_secure(2);
3661 
3662  switch (pid = rb_fork_ruby(NULL)) {
3663  case 0:
3664  rb_thread_atfork();
3665  if (rb_block_given_p()) {
3666  int status;
3667 
3668  rb_protect(rb_yield, Qundef, &status);
3669  ruby_stop(status);
3670  }
3671  return Qnil;
3672 
3673  case -1:
3674  rb_sys_fail("fork(2)");
3675  return Qnil;
3676 
3677  default:
3678  return PIDT2NUM(pid);
3679  }
3680 }
3681 #else
3682 #define rb_f_fork rb_f_notimplement
3683 #endif
3684 
3685 static int
3686 exit_status_code(VALUE status)
3687 {
3688  int istatus;
3689 
3690  switch (status) {
3691  case Qtrue:
3692  istatus = EXIT_SUCCESS;
3693  break;
3694  case Qfalse:
3695  istatus = EXIT_FAILURE;
3696  break;
3697  default:
3698  istatus = NUM2INT(status);
3699 #if EXIT_SUCCESS != 0
3700  if (istatus == 0)
3701  istatus = EXIT_SUCCESS;
3702 #endif
3703  break;
3704  }
3705  return istatus;
3706 }
3707 
3708 /*
3709  * call-seq:
3710  * Process.exit!(status=false)
3711  *
3712  * Exits the process immediately. No exit handlers are
3713  * run. <em>status</em> is returned to the underlying system as the
3714  * exit status.
3715  *
3716  * Process.exit!(true)
3717  */
3718 
3719 static VALUE
3720 rb_f_exit_bang(int argc, VALUE *argv, VALUE obj)
3721 {
3722  VALUE status;
3723  int istatus;
3724 
3725  if (argc > 0 && rb_scan_args(argc, argv, "01", &status) == 1) {
3726  istatus = exit_status_code(status);
3727  }
3728  else {
3729  istatus = EXIT_FAILURE;
3730  }
3731  _exit(istatus);
3732 
3733  UNREACHABLE;
3734 }
3735 
3736 void
3737 rb_exit(int status)
3738 {
3739  if (GET_THREAD()->tag) {
3740  VALUE args[2];
3741 
3742  args[0] = INT2NUM(status);
3743  args[1] = rb_str_new2("exit");
3744  rb_exc_raise(rb_class_new_instance(2, args, rb_eSystemExit));
3745  }
3746  ruby_stop(status);
3747 }
3748 
3749 
3750 /*
3751  * call-seq:
3752  * exit(status=true)
3753  * Kernel::exit(status=true)
3754  * Process::exit(status=true)
3755  *
3756  * Initiates the termination of the Ruby script by raising the
3757  * <code>SystemExit</code> exception. This exception may be caught. The
3758  * optional parameter is used to return a status code to the invoking
3759  * environment.
3760  * +true+ and +FALSE+ of _status_ means success and failure
3761  * respectively. The interpretation of other integer values are
3762  * system dependent.
3763  *
3764  * begin
3765  * exit
3766  * puts "never get here"
3767  * rescue SystemExit
3768  * puts "rescued a SystemExit exception"
3769  * end
3770  * puts "after begin block"
3771  *
3772  * <em>produces:</em>
3773  *
3774  * rescued a SystemExit exception
3775  * after begin block
3776  *
3777  * Just prior to termination, Ruby executes any <code>at_exit</code> functions
3778  * (see Kernel::at_exit) and runs any object finalizers (see
3779  * ObjectSpace::define_finalizer).
3780  *
3781  * at_exit { puts "at_exit function" }
3782  * ObjectSpace.define_finalizer("string", proc { puts "in finalizer" })
3783  * exit
3784  *
3785  * <em>produces:</em>
3786  *
3787  * at_exit function
3788  * in finalizer
3789  */
3790 
3791 VALUE
3792 rb_f_exit(int argc, const VALUE *argv)
3793 {
3794  VALUE status;
3795  int istatus;
3796 
3797  if (argc > 0 && rb_scan_args(argc, argv, "01", &status) == 1) {
3798  istatus = exit_status_code(status);
3799  }
3800  else {
3801  istatus = EXIT_SUCCESS;
3802  }
3803  rb_exit(istatus);
3804 
3805  UNREACHABLE;
3806 }
3807 
3808 
3809 /*
3810  * call-seq:
3811  * abort
3812  * Kernel::abort([msg])
3813  * Process::abort([msg])
3814  *
3815  * Terminate execution immediately, effectively by calling
3816  * <code>Kernel.exit(false)</code>. If _msg_ is given, it is written
3817  * to STDERR prior to terminating.
3818  */
3819 
3820 VALUE
3821 rb_f_abort(int argc, const VALUE *argv)
3822 {
3823  rb_check_arity(argc, 0, 1);
3824  if (argc == 0) {
3825  if (!NIL_P(GET_THREAD()->errinfo)) {
3826  ruby_error_print();
3827  }
3828  rb_exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
3829  }
3830  else {
3831  VALUE args[2];
3832 
3833  args[1] = args[0] = argv[0];
3834  StringValue(args[0]);
3835  rb_io_puts(1, args, rb_stderr);
3836  args[0] = INT2NUM(EXIT_FAILURE);
3837  rb_exc_raise(rb_class_new_instance(2, args, rb_eSystemExit));
3838  }
3839 
3840  UNREACHABLE;
3841 }
3842 
3843 void
3844 rb_syswait(rb_pid_t pid)
3845 {
3846  int status;
3847 
3848  rb_waitpid(pid, &status, 0);
3849 }
3850 
3851 static rb_pid_t
3852 rb_spawn_process(struct rb_execarg *eargp, char *errmsg, size_t errmsg_buflen)
3853 {
3854  rb_pid_t pid;
3855 #if !defined HAVE_WORKING_FORK || USE_SPAWNV
3856  VALUE prog;
3857  struct rb_execarg sarg;
3858 #endif
3859 
3860 #if defined HAVE_WORKING_FORK && !USE_SPAWNV
3861  pid = rb_fork_async_signal_safe(NULL, rb_exec_atfork, eargp, eargp->redirect_fds, errmsg, errmsg_buflen);
3862 #else
3863  prog = eargp->use_shell ? eargp->invoke.sh.shell_script : eargp->invoke.cmd.command_name;
3864 
3865  if (rb_execarg_run_options(eargp, &sarg, errmsg, errmsg_buflen) < 0) {
3866  return -1;
3867  }
3868 
3869  if (prog && !eargp->use_shell) {
3870  char **argv = ARGVSTR2ARGV(eargp->invoke.cmd.argv_str);
3871  argv[0] = RSTRING_PTR(prog);
3872  }
3873 # if defined HAVE_SPAWNV
3874  if (eargp->use_shell) {
3875  pid = proc_spawn_sh(RSTRING_PTR(prog));
3876  }
3877  else {
3878  char **argv = ARGVSTR2ARGV(eargp->invoke.cmd.argv_str);
3879  pid = proc_spawn_cmd(argv, prog, eargp);
3880  }
3881  if (pid == -1)
3882  rb_last_status_set(0x7f << 8, 0);
3883 # else
3884  if (!eargp->use_shell) {
3885  char **argv = ARGVSTR2ARGV(eargp->invoke.cmd.argv_str);
3886  int argc = ARGVSTR2ARGC(eargp->invoke.cmd.argv_str);
3887  prog = rb_ary_join(rb_ary_new4(argc, argv), rb_str_new2(" "));
3888  }
3889  status = system(StringValuePtr(prog));
3890  rb_last_status_set((status & 0xff) << 8, 0);
3891  pid = 1; /* dummy */
3892 # endif
3893 
3894  rb_execarg_run_options(&sarg, NULL, errmsg, errmsg_buflen);
3895 #endif
3896  return pid;
3897 }
3898 
3899 struct spawn_args {
3900  VALUE execarg;
3901  struct {
3902  char *ptr;
3903  size_t buflen;
3904  } errmsg;
3905 };
3906 
3907 static VALUE
3908 do_spawn_process(VALUE arg)
3909 {
3910  struct spawn_args *argp = (struct spawn_args *)arg;
3911  rb_execarg_parent_start1(argp->execarg);
3912  return (VALUE)rb_spawn_process(DATA_PTR(argp->execarg),
3913  argp->errmsg.ptr, argp->errmsg.buflen);
3914 }
3915 
3916 static rb_pid_t
3917 rb_execarg_spawn(VALUE execarg_obj, char *errmsg, size_t errmsg_buflen)
3918 {
3919  struct spawn_args args;
3920 
3921  args.execarg = execarg_obj;
3922  args.errmsg.ptr = errmsg;
3923  args.errmsg.buflen = errmsg_buflen;
3924  return (rb_pid_t)rb_ensure(do_spawn_process, (VALUE)&args,
3925  execarg_parent_end, execarg_obj);
3926 }
3927 
3928 static rb_pid_t
3929 rb_spawn_internal(int argc, const VALUE *argv, char *errmsg, size_t errmsg_buflen)
3930 {
3931  VALUE execarg_obj;
3932 
3933  execarg_obj = rb_execarg_new(argc, argv, TRUE);
3934  return rb_execarg_spawn(execarg_obj, errmsg, errmsg_buflen);
3935 }
3936 
3937 rb_pid_t
3938 rb_spawn_err(int argc, const VALUE *argv, char *errmsg, size_t errmsg_buflen)
3939 {
3940  return rb_spawn_internal(argc, argv, errmsg, errmsg_buflen);
3941 }
3942 
3943 rb_pid_t
3944 rb_spawn(int argc, const VALUE *argv)
3945 {
3946  return rb_spawn_internal(argc, argv, NULL, 0);
3947 }
3948 
3949 /*
3950  * call-seq:
3951  * system([env,] command... [,options]) -> true, false or nil
3952  *
3953  * Executes _command..._ in a subshell.
3954  * _command..._ is one of following forms.
3955  *
3956  * commandline : command line string which is passed to the standard shell
3957  * cmdname, arg1, ... : command name and one or more arguments (no shell)
3958  * [cmdname, argv0], arg1, ... : command name, argv[0] and zero or more arguments (no shell)
3959  *
3960  * system returns +true+ if the command gives zero exit status,
3961  * +false+ for non zero exit status.
3962  * Returns +nil+ if command execution fails.
3963  * An error status is available in <code>$?</code>.
3964  * The arguments are processed in the same way as
3965  * for <code>Kernel.spawn</code>.
3966  *
3967  * The hash arguments, env and options, are same as
3968  * <code>exec</code> and <code>spawn</code>.
3969  * See <code>Kernel.spawn</code> for details.
3970  *
3971  * system("echo *")
3972  * system("echo", "*")
3973  *
3974  * <em>produces:</em>
3975  *
3976  * config.h main.rb
3977  * *
3978  *
3979  * See <code>Kernel.exec</code> for the standard shell.
3980  */
3981 
3982 static VALUE
3983 rb_f_system(int argc, VALUE *argv)
3984 {
3985  rb_pid_t pid;
3986  int status;
3987 
3988 #if defined(SIGCLD) && !defined(SIGCHLD)
3989 # define SIGCHLD SIGCLD
3990 #endif
3991 
3992 #ifdef SIGCHLD
3993  RETSIGTYPE (*chfunc)(int);
3994 
3995  rb_last_status_clear();
3996  chfunc = signal(SIGCHLD, SIG_DFL);
3997 #endif
3998  pid = rb_spawn_internal(argc, argv, NULL, 0);
3999 #if defined(HAVE_WORKING_FORK) || defined(HAVE_SPAWNV)
4000  if (pid > 0) {
4001  int ret, status;
4002  ret = rb_waitpid(pid, &status, 0);
4003  if (ret == (rb_pid_t)-1)
4004  rb_sys_fail("Another thread waited the process started by system().");
4005  }
4006 #endif
4007 #ifdef SIGCHLD
4008  signal(SIGCHLD, chfunc);
4009 #endif
4010  if (pid < 0) {
4011  return Qnil;
4012  }
4013  status = PST2INT(rb_last_status_get());
4014  if (status == EXIT_SUCCESS) return Qtrue;
4015  return Qfalse;
4016 }
4017 
4018 /*
4019  * call-seq:
4020  * spawn([env,] command... [,options]) -> pid
4021  * Process.spawn([env,] command... [,options]) -> pid
4022  *
4023  * spawn executes specified command and return its pid.
4024  *
4025  * pid = spawn("tar xf ruby-2.0.0-p195.tar.bz2")
4026  * Process.wait pid
4027  *
4028  * pid = spawn(RbConfig.ruby, "-eputs'Hello, world!'")
4029  * Process.wait pid
4030  *
4031  * This method is similar to Kernel#system but it doesn't wait for the command
4032  * to finish.
4033  *
4034  * The parent process should
4035  * use <code>Process.wait</code> to collect
4036  * the termination status of its child or
4037  * use <code>Process.detach</code> to register
4038  * disinterest in their status;
4039  * otherwise, the operating system may accumulate zombie processes.
4040  *
4041  * spawn has bunch of options to specify process attributes:
4042  *
4043  * env: hash
4044  * name => val : set the environment variable
4045  * name => nil : unset the environment variable
4046  *
4047  * the keys must be strings.
4048  * command...:
4049  * commandline : command line string which is passed to the standard shell
4050  * cmdname, arg1, ... : command name and one or more arguments (This form does not use the shell. See below for caveats.)
4051  * [cmdname, argv0], arg1, ... : command name, argv[0] and zero or more arguments (no shell)
4052  * options: hash
4053  * clearing environment variables:
4054  * :unsetenv_others => true : clear environment variables except specified by env
4055  * :unsetenv_others => false : don't clear (default)
4056  * process group:
4057  * :pgroup => true or 0 : make a new process group
4058  * :pgroup => pgid : join to specified process group
4059  * :pgroup => nil : don't change the process group (default)
4060  * create new process group: Windows only
4061  * :new_pgroup => true : the new process is the root process of a new process group
4062  * :new_pgroup => false : don't create a new process group (default)
4063  * resource limit: resourcename is core, cpu, data, etc. See Process.setrlimit.
4064  * :rlimit_resourcename => limit
4065  * :rlimit_resourcename => [cur_limit, max_limit]
4066  * umask:
4067  * :umask => int
4068  * redirection:
4069  * key:
4070  * FD : single file descriptor in child process
4071  * [FD, FD, ...] : multiple file descriptor in child process
4072  * value:
4073  * FD : redirect to the file descriptor in parent process
4074  * string : redirect to file with open(string, "r" or "w")
4075  * [string] : redirect to file with open(string, File::RDONLY)
4076  * [string, open_mode] : redirect to file with open(string, open_mode, 0644)
4077  * [string, open_mode, perm] : redirect to file with open(string, open_mode, perm)
4078  * [:child, FD] : redirect to the redirected file descriptor
4079  * :close : close the file descriptor in child process
4080  * FD is one of follows
4081  * :in : the file descriptor 0 which is the standard input
4082  * :out : the file descriptor 1 which is the standard output
4083  * :err : the file descriptor 2 which is the standard error
4084  * integer : the file descriptor of specified the integer
4085  * io : the file descriptor specified as io.fileno
4086  * file descriptor inheritance: close non-redirected non-standard fds (3, 4, 5, ...) or not
4087  * :close_others => true : don't inherit
4088  * current directory:
4089  * :chdir => str
4090  *
4091  * The 'cmdname, arg1, ...' form does not use the shell. However,
4092  * on different OSes, different things are provided as built-in
4093  * commands. An example of this is 'echo', which is a built-in
4094  * on Windows, but is a normal program on Linux and Mac OS X.
4095  * This means that `Process.spawn 'echo', '%Path%'` will display
4096  * the contents of the `%Path%` environment variable on Windows,
4097  * but `Process.spawn 'echo', '$PATH'` prints the literal '$PATH'.
4098  *
4099  * If a hash is given as +env+, the environment is
4100  * updated by +env+ before <code>exec(2)</code> in the child process.
4101  * If a pair in +env+ has nil as the value, the variable is deleted.
4102  *
4103  * # set FOO as BAR and unset BAZ.
4104  * pid = spawn({"FOO"=>"BAR", "BAZ"=>nil}, command)
4105  *
4106  * If a hash is given as +options+,
4107  * it specifies
4108  * process group,
4109  * create new process group,
4110  * resource limit,
4111  * current directory,
4112  * umask and
4113  * redirects for the child process.
4114  * Also, it can be specified to clear environment variables.
4115  *
4116  * The <code>:unsetenv_others</code> key in +options+ specifies
4117  * to clear environment variables, other than specified by +env+.
4118  *
4119  * pid = spawn(command, :unsetenv_others=>true) # no environment variable
4120  * pid = spawn({"FOO"=>"BAR"}, command, :unsetenv_others=>true) # FOO only
4121  *
4122  * The <code>:pgroup</code> key in +options+ specifies a process group.
4123  * The corresponding value should be true, zero or positive integer.
4124  * true and zero means the process should be a process leader of a new
4125  * process group.
4126  * Other values specifies a process group to be belongs.
4127  *
4128  * pid = spawn(command, :pgroup=>true) # process leader
4129  * pid = spawn(command, :pgroup=>10) # belongs to the process group 10
4130  *
4131  * The <code>:new_pgroup</code> key in +options+ specifies to pass
4132  * +CREATE_NEW_PROCESS_GROUP+ flag to <code>CreateProcessW()</code> that is
4133  * Windows API. This option is only for Windows.
4134  * true means the new process is the root process of the new process group.
4135  * The new process has CTRL+C disabled. This flag is necessary for
4136  * <code>Process.kill(:SIGINT, pid)</code> on the subprocess.
4137  * :new_pgroup is false by default.
4138  *
4139  * pid = spawn(command, :new_pgroup=>true) # new process group
4140  * pid = spawn(command, :new_pgroup=>false) # same process group
4141  *
4142  * The <code>:rlimit_</code><em>foo</em> key specifies a resource limit.
4143  * <em>foo</em> should be one of resource types such as <code>core</code>.
4144  * The corresponding value should be an integer or an array which have one or
4145  * two integers: same as cur_limit and max_limit arguments for
4146  * Process.setrlimit.
4147  *
4148  * cur, max = Process.getrlimit(:CORE)
4149  * pid = spawn(command, :rlimit_core=>[0,max]) # disable core temporary.
4150  * pid = spawn(command, :rlimit_core=>max) # enable core dump
4151  * pid = spawn(command, :rlimit_core=>0) # never dump core.
4152  *
4153  * The <code>:umask</code> key in +options+ specifies the umask.
4154  *
4155  * pid = spawn(command, :umask=>077)
4156  *
4157  * The :in, :out, :err, a fixnum, an IO and an array key specifies a redirection.
4158  * The redirection maps a file descriptor in the child process.
4159  *
4160  * For example, stderr can be merged into stdout as follows:
4161  *
4162  * pid = spawn(command, :err=>:out)
4163  * pid = spawn(command, 2=>1)
4164  * pid = spawn(command, STDERR=>:out)
4165  * pid = spawn(command, STDERR=>STDOUT)
4166  *
4167  * The hash keys specifies a file descriptor
4168  * in the child process started by <code>spawn</code>.
4169  * :err, 2 and STDERR specifies the standard error stream (stderr).
4170  *
4171  * The hash values specifies a file descriptor
4172  * in the parent process which invokes <code>spawn</code>.
4173  * :out, 1 and STDOUT specifies the standard output stream (stdout).
4174  *
4175  * In the above example,
4176  * the standard output in the child process is not specified.
4177  * So it is inherited from the parent process.
4178  *
4179  * The standard input stream (stdin) can be specified by :in, 0 and STDIN.
4180  *
4181  * A filename can be specified as a hash value.
4182  *
4183  * pid = spawn(command, :in=>"/dev/null") # read mode
4184  * pid = spawn(command, :out=>"/dev/null") # write mode
4185  * pid = spawn(command, :err=>"log") # write mode
4186  * pid = spawn(command, [:out, :err]=>"/dev/null") # write mode
4187  * pid = spawn(command, 3=>"/dev/null") # read mode
4188  *
4189  * For stdout and stderr (and combination of them),
4190  * it is opened in write mode.
4191  * Otherwise read mode is used.
4192  *
4193  * For specifying flags and permission of file creation explicitly,
4194  * an array is used instead.
4195  *
4196  * pid = spawn(command, :in=>["file"]) # read mode is assumed
4197  * pid = spawn(command, :in=>["file", "r"])
4198  * pid = spawn(command, :out=>["log", "w"]) # 0644 assumed
4199  * pid = spawn(command, :out=>["log", "w", 0600])
4200  * pid = spawn(command, :out=>["log", File::WRONLY|File::EXCL|File::CREAT, 0600])
4201  *
4202  * The array specifies a filename, flags and permission.
4203  * The flags can be a string or an integer.
4204  * If the flags is omitted or nil, File::RDONLY is assumed.
4205  * The permission should be an integer.
4206  * If the permission is omitted or nil, 0644 is assumed.
4207  *
4208  * If an array of IOs and integers are specified as a hash key,
4209  * all the elements are redirected.
4210  *
4211  * # stdout and stderr is redirected to log file.
4212  * # The file "log" is opened just once.
4213  * pid = spawn(command, [:out, :err]=>["log", "w"])
4214  *
4215  * Another way to merge multiple file descriptors is [:child, fd].
4216  * \[:child, fd] means the file descriptor in the child process.
4217  * This is different from fd.
4218  * For example, :err=>:out means redirecting child stderr to parent stdout.
4219  * But :err=>[:child, :out] means redirecting child stderr to child stdout.
4220  * They differ if stdout is redirected in the child process as follows.
4221  *
4222  * # stdout and stderr is redirected to log file.
4223  * # The file "log" is opened just once.
4224  * pid = spawn(command, :out=>["log", "w"], :err=>[:child, :out])
4225  *
4226  * \[:child, :out] can be used to merge stderr into stdout in IO.popen.
4227  * In this case, IO.popen redirects stdout to a pipe in the child process
4228  * and [:child, :out] refers the redirected stdout.
4229  *
4230  * io = IO.popen(["sh", "-c", "echo out; echo err >&2", :err=>[:child, :out]])
4231  * p io.read #=> "out\nerr\n"
4232  *
4233  * The <code>:chdir</code> key in +options+ specifies the current directory.
4234  *
4235  * pid = spawn(command, :chdir=>"/var/tmp")
4236  *
4237  * spawn closes all non-standard unspecified descriptors by default.
4238  * The "standard" descriptors are 0, 1 and 2.
4239  * This behavior is specified by :close_others option.
4240  * :close_others doesn't affect the standard descriptors which are
4241  * closed only if :close is specified explicitly.
4242  *
4243  * pid = spawn(command, :close_others=>true) # close 3,4,5,... (default)
4244  * pid = spawn(command, :close_others=>false) # don't close 3,4,5,...
4245  *
4246  * :close_others is true by default for spawn and IO.popen.
4247  *
4248  * Note that fds which close-on-exec flag is already set are closed
4249  * regardless of :close_others option.
4250  *
4251  * So IO.pipe and spawn can be used as IO.popen.
4252  *
4253  * # similar to r = IO.popen(command)
4254  * r, w = IO.pipe
4255  * pid = spawn(command, :out=>w) # r, w is closed in the child process.
4256  * w.close
4257  *
4258  * :close is specified as a hash value to close a fd individually.
4259  *
4260  * f = open(foo)
4261  * system(command, f=>:close) # don't inherit f.
4262  *
4263  * If a file descriptor need to be inherited,
4264  * io=>io can be used.
4265  *
4266  * # valgrind has --log-fd option for log destination.
4267  * # log_w=>log_w indicates log_w.fileno inherits to child process.
4268  * log_r, log_w = IO.pipe
4269  * pid = spawn("valgrind", "--log-fd=#{log_w.fileno}", "echo", "a", log_w=>log_w)
4270  * log_w.close
4271  * p log_r.read
4272  *
4273  * It is also possible to exchange file descriptors.
4274  *
4275  * pid = spawn(command, :out=>:err, :err=>:out)
4276  *
4277  * The hash keys specify file descriptors in the child process.
4278  * The hash values specifies file descriptors in the parent process.
4279  * So the above specifies exchanging stdout and stderr.
4280  * Internally, +spawn+ uses an extra file descriptor to resolve such cyclic
4281  * file descriptor mapping.
4282  *
4283  * See <code>Kernel.exec</code> for the standard shell.
4284  */
4285 
4286 static VALUE
4287 rb_f_spawn(int argc, VALUE *argv)
4288 {
4289  rb_pid_t pid;
4290  char errmsg[CHILD_ERRMSG_BUFLEN] = { '\0' };
4291  VALUE execarg_obj, fail_str;
4292  struct rb_execarg *eargp;
4293 
4294  execarg_obj = rb_execarg_new(argc, argv, TRUE);
4295  eargp = rb_execarg_get(execarg_obj);
4296  fail_str = eargp->use_shell ? eargp->invoke.sh.shell_script : eargp->invoke.cmd.command_name;
4297 
4298  pid = rb_execarg_spawn(execarg_obj, errmsg, sizeof(errmsg));
4299 
4300  if (pid == -1) {
4301  const char *prog = errmsg;
4302  if (!prog[0]) {
4303  rb_sys_fail_str(fail_str);
4304  }
4305  rb_sys_fail(prog);
4306  }
4307 #if defined(HAVE_WORKING_FORK) || defined(HAVE_SPAWNV)
4308  return PIDT2NUM(pid);
4309 #else
4310  return Qnil;
4311 #endif
4312 }
4313 
4314 /*
4315  * call-seq:
4316  * sleep([duration]) -> fixnum
4317  *
4318  * Suspends the current thread for _duration_ seconds (which may be any number,
4319  * including a +Float+ with fractional seconds). Returns the actual number of
4320  * seconds slept (rounded), which may be less than that asked for if another
4321  * thread calls <code>Thread#run</code>. Called without an argument, sleep()
4322  * will sleep forever.
4323  *
4324  * Time.new #=> 2008-03-08 19:56:19 +0900
4325  * sleep 1.2 #=> 1
4326  * Time.new #=> 2008-03-08 19:56:20 +0900
4327  * sleep 1.9 #=> 2
4328  * Time.new #=> 2008-03-08 19:56:22 +0900
4329  */
4330 
4331 static VALUE
4332 rb_f_sleep(int argc, VALUE *argv)
4333 {
4334  time_t beg, end;
4335 
4336  beg = time(0);
4337  if (argc == 0) {
4338  rb_thread_sleep_forever();
4339  }
4340  else {
4341  rb_check_arity(argc, 0, 1);
4342  rb_thread_wait_for(rb_time_interval(argv[0]));
4343  }
4344 
4345  end = time(0) - beg;
4346 
4347  return INT2FIX(end);
4348 }
4349 
4350 
4351 #if (defined(HAVE_GETPGRP) && defined(GETPGRP_VOID)) || defined(HAVE_GETPGID)
4352 /*
4353  * call-seq:
4354  * Process.getpgrp -> integer
4355  *
4356  * Returns the process group ID for this process. Not available on
4357  * all platforms.
4358  *
4359  * Process.getpgid(0) #=> 25527
4360  * Process.getpgrp #=> 25527
4361  */
4362 
4363 static VALUE
4364 proc_getpgrp(void)
4365 {
4366  rb_pid_t pgrp;
4367 
4368  rb_secure(2);
4369 #if defined(HAVE_GETPGRP) && defined(GETPGRP_VOID)
4370  pgrp = getpgrp();
4371  if (pgrp < 0) rb_sys_fail(0);
4372  return PIDT2NUM(pgrp);
4373 #else /* defined(HAVE_GETPGID) */
4374  pgrp = getpgid(0);
4375  if (pgrp < 0) rb_sys_fail(0);
4376  return PIDT2NUM(pgrp);
4377 #endif
4378 }
4379 #else
4380 #define proc_getpgrp rb_f_notimplement
4381 #endif
4382 
4383 
4384 #if defined(HAVE_SETPGID) || (defined(HAVE_SETPGRP) && defined(SETPGRP_VOID))
4385 /*
4386  * call-seq:
4387  * Process.setpgrp -> 0
4388  *
4389  * Equivalent to <code>setpgid(0,0)</code>. Not available on all
4390  * platforms.
4391  */
4392 
4393 static VALUE
4394 proc_setpgrp(void)
4395 {
4396  rb_secure(2);
4397  /* check for posix setpgid() first; this matches the posix */
4398  /* getpgrp() above. It appears that configure will set SETPGRP_VOID */
4399  /* even though setpgrp(0,0) would be preferred. The posix call avoids */
4400  /* this confusion. */
4401 #ifdef HAVE_SETPGID
4402  if (setpgid(0,0) < 0) rb_sys_fail(0);
4403 #elif defined(HAVE_SETPGRP) && defined(SETPGRP_VOID)
4404  if (setpgrp() < 0) rb_sys_fail(0);
4405 #endif
4406  return INT2FIX(0);
4407 }
4408 #else
4409 #define proc_setpgrp rb_f_notimplement
4410 #endif
4411 
4412 
4413 #if defined(HAVE_GETPGID)
4414 /*
4415  * call-seq:
4416  * Process.getpgid(pid) -> integer
4417  *
4418  * Returns the process group ID for the given process id. Not
4419  * available on all platforms.
4420  *
4421  * Process.getpgid(Process.ppid()) #=> 25527
4422  */
4423 
4424 static VALUE
4425 proc_getpgid(VALUE obj, VALUE pid)
4426 {
4427  rb_pid_t i;
4428 
4429  rb_secure(2);
4430  i = getpgid(NUM2PIDT(pid));
4431  if (i < 0) rb_sys_fail(0);
4432  return PIDT2NUM(i);
4433 }
4434 #else
4435 #define proc_getpgid rb_f_notimplement
4436 #endif
4437 
4438 
4439 #ifdef HAVE_SETPGID
4440 /*
4441  * call-seq:
4442  * Process.setpgid(pid, integer) -> 0
4443  *
4444  * Sets the process group ID of _pid_ (0 indicates this
4445  * process) to <em>integer</em>. Not available on all platforms.
4446  */
4447 
4448 static VALUE
4449 proc_setpgid(VALUE obj, VALUE pid, VALUE pgrp)
4450 {
4451  rb_pid_t ipid, ipgrp;
4452 
4453  rb_secure(2);
4454  ipid = NUM2PIDT(pid);
4455  ipgrp = NUM2PIDT(pgrp);
4456 
4457  if (setpgid(ipid, ipgrp) < 0) rb_sys_fail(0);
4458  return INT2FIX(0);
4459 }
4460 #else
4461 #define proc_setpgid rb_f_notimplement
4462 #endif
4463 
4464 
4465 #ifdef HAVE_GETSID
4466 /*
4467  * call-seq:
4468  * Process.getsid() -> integer
4469  * Process.getsid(pid) -> integer
4470  *
4471  * Returns the session ID for for the given process id. If not give,
4472  * return current process sid. Not available on all platforms.
4473  *
4474  * Process.getsid() #=> 27422
4475  * Process.getsid(0) #=> 27422
4476  * Process.getsid(Process.pid()) #=> 27422
4477  */
4478 static VALUE
4479 proc_getsid(int argc, VALUE *argv)
4480 {
4481  rb_pid_t sid;
4482  VALUE pid;
4483 
4484  rb_secure(2);
4485  rb_scan_args(argc, argv, "01", &pid);
4486 
4487  if (NIL_P(pid))
4488  pid = INT2FIX(0);
4489 
4490  sid = getsid(NUM2PIDT(pid));
4491  if (sid < 0) rb_sys_fail(0);
4492  return PIDT2NUM(sid);
4493 }
4494 #else
4495 #define proc_getsid rb_f_notimplement
4496 #endif
4497 
4498 
4499 #if defined(HAVE_SETSID) || (defined(HAVE_SETPGRP) && defined(TIOCNOTTY))
4500 #if !defined(HAVE_SETSID)
4501 static rb_pid_t ruby_setsid(void);
4502 #define setsid() ruby_setsid()
4503 #endif
4504 /*
4505  * call-seq:
4506  * Process.setsid -> fixnum
4507  *
4508  * Establishes this process as a new session and process group
4509  * leader, with no controlling tty. Returns the session id. Not
4510  * available on all platforms.
4511  *
4512  * Process.setsid #=> 27422
4513  */
4514 
4515 static VALUE
4516 proc_setsid(void)
4517 {
4518  rb_pid_t pid;
4519 
4520  rb_secure(2);
4521  pid = setsid();
4522  if (pid < 0) rb_sys_fail(0);
4523  return PIDT2NUM(pid);
4524 }
4525 
4526 #if !defined(HAVE_SETSID)
4527 #define HAVE_SETSID 1
4528 static rb_pid_t
4529 ruby_setsid(void)
4530 {
4531  rb_pid_t pid;
4532  int ret;
4533 
4534  pid = getpid();
4535 #if defined(SETPGRP_VOID)
4536  ret = setpgrp();
4537  /* If `pid_t setpgrp(void)' is equivalent to setsid(),
4538  `ret' will be the same value as `pid', and following open() will fail.
4539  In Linux, `int setpgrp(void)' is equivalent to setpgid(0, 0). */
4540 #else
4541  ret = setpgrp(0, pid);
4542 #endif
4543  if (ret == -1) return -1;
4544 
4545  if ((fd = rb_cloexec_open("/dev/tty", O_RDWR, 0)) >= 0) {
4546  rb_update_max_fd(fd);
4547  ioctl(fd, TIOCNOTTY, NULL);
4548  close(fd);
4549  }
4550  return pid;
4551 }
4552 #endif
4553 #else
4554 #define proc_setsid rb_f_notimplement
4555 #endif
4556 
4557 
4558 #ifdef HAVE_GETPRIORITY
4559 /*
4560  * call-seq:
4561  * Process.getpriority(kind, integer) -> fixnum
4562  *
4563  * Gets the scheduling priority for specified process, process group,
4564  * or user. <em>kind</em> indicates the kind of entity to find: one
4565  * of <code>Process::PRIO_PGRP</code>,
4566  * <code>Process::PRIO_USER</code>, or
4567  * <code>Process::PRIO_PROCESS</code>. _integer_ is an id
4568  * indicating the particular process, process group, or user (an id
4569  * of 0 means _current_). Lower priorities are more favorable
4570  * for scheduling. Not available on all platforms.
4571  *
4572  * Process.getpriority(Process::PRIO_USER, 0) #=> 19
4573  * Process.getpriority(Process::PRIO_PROCESS, 0) #=> 19
4574  */
4575 
4576 static VALUE
4577 proc_getpriority(VALUE obj, VALUE which, VALUE who)
4578 {
4579  int prio, iwhich, iwho;
4580 
4581  rb_secure(2);
4582  iwhich = NUM2INT(which);
4583  iwho = NUM2INT(who);
4584 
4585  errno = 0;
4586  prio = getpriority(iwhich, iwho);
4587  if (errno) rb_sys_fail(0);
4588  return INT2FIX(prio);
4589 }
4590 #else
4591 #define proc_getpriority rb_f_notimplement
4592 #endif
4593 
4594 
4595 #ifdef HAVE_GETPRIORITY
4596 /*
4597  * call-seq:
4598  * Process.setpriority(kind, integer, priority) -> 0
4599  *
4600  * See <code>Process#getpriority</code>.
4601  *
4602  * Process.setpriority(Process::PRIO_USER, 0, 19) #=> 0
4603  * Process.setpriority(Process::PRIO_PROCESS, 0, 19) #=> 0
4604  * Process.getpriority(Process::PRIO_USER, 0) #=> 19
4605  * Process.getpriority(Process::PRIO_PROCESS, 0) #=> 19
4606  */
4607 
4608 static VALUE
4609 proc_setpriority(VALUE obj, VALUE which, VALUE who, VALUE prio)
4610 {
4611  int iwhich, iwho, iprio;
4612 
4613  rb_secure(2);
4614  iwhich = NUM2INT(which);
4615  iwho = NUM2INT(who);
4616  iprio = NUM2INT(prio);
4617 
4618  if (setpriority(iwhich, iwho, iprio) < 0)
4619  rb_sys_fail(0);
4620  return INT2FIX(0);
4621 }
4622 #else
4623 #define proc_setpriority rb_f_notimplement
4624 #endif
4625 
4626 #if defined(HAVE_SETRLIMIT) && defined(NUM2RLIM)
4627 static int
4628 rlimit_resource_name2int(const char *name, int casetype)
4629 {
4630  int resource;
4631  const char *p;
4632 #define RESCHECK(r) \
4633  do { \
4634  if (STRCASECMP(name, #r) == 0) { \
4635  resource = RLIMIT_##r; \
4636  goto found; \
4637  } \
4638  } while (0)
4639 
4640  switch (TOUPPER(*name)) {
4641  case 'A':
4642 #ifdef RLIMIT_AS
4643  RESCHECK(AS);
4644 #endif
4645  break;
4646 
4647  case 'C':
4648 #ifdef RLIMIT_CORE
4649  RESCHECK(CORE);
4650 #endif
4651 #ifdef RLIMIT_CPU
4652  RESCHECK(CPU);
4653 #endif
4654  break;
4655 
4656  case 'D':
4657 #ifdef RLIMIT_DATA
4658  RESCHECK(DATA);
4659 #endif
4660  break;
4661 
4662  case 'F':
4663 #ifdef RLIMIT_FSIZE
4664  RESCHECK(FSIZE);
4665 #endif
4666  break;
4667 
4668  case 'M':
4669 #ifdef RLIMIT_MEMLOCK
4670  RESCHECK(MEMLOCK);
4671 #endif
4672 #ifdef RLIMIT_MSGQUEUE
4673  RESCHECK(MSGQUEUE);
4674 #endif
4675  break;
4676 
4677  case 'N':
4678 #ifdef RLIMIT_NOFILE
4679  RESCHECK(NOFILE);
4680 #endif
4681 #ifdef RLIMIT_NPROC
4682  RESCHECK(NPROC);
4683 #endif
4684 #ifdef RLIMIT_NICE
4685  RESCHECK(NICE);
4686 #endif
4687  break;
4688 
4689  case 'R':
4690 #ifdef RLIMIT_RSS
4691  RESCHECK(RSS);
4692 #endif
4693 #ifdef RLIMIT_RTPRIO
4694  RESCHECK(RTPRIO);
4695 #endif
4696 #ifdef RLIMIT_RTTIME
4697  RESCHECK(RTTIME);
4698 #endif
4699  break;
4700 
4701  case 'S':
4702 #ifdef RLIMIT_STACK
4703  RESCHECK(STACK);
4704 #endif
4705 #ifdef RLIMIT_SBSIZE
4706  RESCHECK(SBSIZE);
4707 #endif
4708 #ifdef RLIMIT_SIGPENDING
4709  RESCHECK(SIGPENDING);
4710 #endif
4711  break;
4712  }
4713  return -1;
4714 
4715  found:
4716  switch (casetype) {
4717  case 0:
4718  for (p = name; *p; p++)
4719  if (!ISUPPER(*p))
4720  return -1;
4721  break;
4722 
4723  case 1:
4724  for (p = name; *p; p++)
4725  if (!ISLOWER(*p))
4726  return -1;
4727  break;
4728 
4729  default:
4730  rb_bug("unexpected casetype");
4731  }
4732  return resource;
4733 #undef RESCHECK
4734 }
4735 
4736 static int
4737 rlimit_type_by_hname(const char *name)
4738 {
4739  return rlimit_resource_name2int(name, 0);
4740 }
4741 
4742 static int
4743 rlimit_type_by_lname(const char *name)
4744 {
4745  return rlimit_resource_name2int(name, 1);
4746 }
4747 
4748 static int
4749 rlimit_resource_type(VALUE rtype)
4750 {
4751  const char *name;
4752  VALUE v;
4753  int r;
4754 
4755  switch (TYPE(rtype)) {
4756  case T_SYMBOL:
4757  v = rb_sym2str(rtype);
4758  name = RSTRING_PTR(v);
4759  break;
4760 
4761  default:
4762  v = rb_check_string_type(rtype);
4763  if (!NIL_P(v)) {
4764  rtype = v;
4765  case T_STRING:
4766  name = StringValueCStr(rtype);
4767  break;
4768  }
4769  /* fall through */
4770 
4771  case T_FIXNUM:
4772  case T_BIGNUM:
4773  return NUM2INT(rtype);
4774  }
4775 
4776  r = rlimit_type_by_hname(name);
4777  if (r != -1)
4778  return r;
4779 
4780  rb_raise(rb_eArgError, "invalid resource name: %"PRIsVALUE, rtype);
4781 
4782  UNREACHABLE;
4783 }
4784 
4785 static rlim_t
4786 rlimit_resource_value(VALUE rval)
4787 {
4788  const char *name;
4789  VALUE v;
4790 
4791  switch (TYPE(rval)) {
4792  case T_SYMBOL:
4793  v = rb_sym2str(rval);
4794  name = RSTRING_PTR(v);
4795  break;
4796 
4797  default:
4798  v = rb_check_string_type(rval);
4799  if (!NIL_P(v)) {
4800  rval = v;
4801  case T_STRING:
4802  name = StringValueCStr(rval);
4803  break;
4804  }
4805  /* fall through */
4806 
4807  case T_FIXNUM:
4808  case T_BIGNUM:
4809  return NUM2RLIM(rval);
4810  }
4811 
4812 #ifdef RLIM_INFINITY
4813  if (strcmp(name, "INFINITY") == 0) return RLIM_INFINITY;
4814 #endif
4815 #ifdef RLIM_SAVED_MAX
4816  if (strcmp(name, "SAVED_MAX") == 0) return RLIM_SAVED_MAX;
4817 #endif
4818 #ifdef RLIM_SAVED_CUR
4819  if (strcmp(name, "SAVED_CUR") == 0) return RLIM_SAVED_CUR;
4820 #endif
4821  rb_raise(rb_eArgError, "invalid resource value: %"PRIsVALUE, rval);
4822 
4823  UNREACHABLE;
4824 }
4825 #endif
4826 
4827 #if defined(HAVE_GETRLIMIT) && defined(RLIM2NUM)
4828 /*
4829  * call-seq:
4830  * Process.getrlimit(resource) -> [cur_limit, max_limit]
4831  *
4832  * Gets the resource limit of the process.
4833  * _cur_limit_ means current (soft) limit and
4834  * _max_limit_ means maximum (hard) limit.
4835  *
4836  * _resource_ indicates the kind of resource to limit.
4837  * It is specified as a symbol such as <code>:CORE</code>,
4838  * a string such as <code>"CORE"</code> or
4839  * a constant such as <code>Process::RLIMIT_CORE</code>.
4840  * See Process.setrlimit for details.
4841  *
4842  * _cur_limit_ and _max_limit_ may be <code>Process::RLIM_INFINITY</code>,
4843  * <code>Process::RLIM_SAVED_MAX</code> or
4844  * <code>Process::RLIM_SAVED_CUR</code>.
4845  * See Process.setrlimit and the system getrlimit(2) manual for details.
4846  */
4847 
4848 static VALUE
4849 proc_getrlimit(VALUE obj, VALUE resource)
4850 {
4851  struct rlimit rlim;
4852 
4853  rb_secure(2);
4854 
4855  if (getrlimit(rlimit_resource_type(resource), &rlim) < 0) {
4856  rb_sys_fail("getrlimit");
4857  }
4858  return rb_assoc_new(RLIM2NUM(rlim.rlim_cur), RLIM2NUM(rlim.rlim_max));
4859 }
4860 #else
4861 #define proc_getrlimit rb_f_notimplement
4862 #endif
4863 
4864 #if defined(HAVE_SETRLIMIT) && defined(NUM2RLIM)
4865 /*
4866  * call-seq:
4867  * Process.setrlimit(resource, cur_limit, max_limit) -> nil
4868  * Process.setrlimit(resource, cur_limit) -> nil
4869  *
4870  * Sets the resource limit of the process.
4871  * _cur_limit_ means current (soft) limit and
4872  * _max_limit_ means maximum (hard) limit.
4873  *
4874  * If _max_limit_ is not given, _cur_limit_ is used.
4875  *
4876  * _resource_ indicates the kind of resource to limit.
4877  * It should be a symbol such as <code>:CORE</code>,
4878  * a string such as <code>"CORE"</code> or
4879  * a constant such as <code>Process::RLIMIT_CORE</code>.
4880  * The available resources are OS dependent.
4881  * Ruby may support following resources.
4882  *
4883  * [AS] total available memory (bytes) (SUSv3, NetBSD, FreeBSD, OpenBSD but 4.4BSD-Lite)
4884  * [CORE] core size (bytes) (SUSv3)
4885  * [CPU] CPU time (seconds) (SUSv3)
4886  * [DATA] data segment (bytes) (SUSv3)
4887  * [FSIZE] file size (bytes) (SUSv3)
4888  * [MEMLOCK] total size for mlock(2) (bytes) (4.4BSD, GNU/Linux)
4889  * [MSGQUEUE] allocation for POSIX message queues (bytes) (GNU/Linux)
4890  * [NICE] ceiling on process's nice(2) value (number) (GNU/Linux)
4891  * [NOFILE] file descriptors (number) (SUSv3)
4892  * [NPROC] number of processes for the user (number) (4.4BSD, GNU/Linux)
4893  * [RSS] resident memory size (bytes) (4.2BSD, GNU/Linux)
4894  * [RTPRIO] ceiling on the process's real-time priority (number) (GNU/Linux)
4895  * [RTTIME] CPU time for real-time process (us) (GNU/Linux)
4896  * [SBSIZE] all socket buffers (bytes) (NetBSD, FreeBSD)
4897  * [SIGPENDING] number of queued signals allowed (signals) (GNU/Linux)
4898  * [STACK] stack size (bytes) (SUSv3)
4899  *
4900  * _cur_limit_ and _max_limit_ may be
4901  * <code>:INFINITY</code>, <code>"INFINITY"</code> or
4902  * <code>Process::RLIM_INFINITY</code>,
4903  * which means that the resource is not limited.
4904  * They may be <code>Process::RLIM_SAVED_MAX</code>,
4905  * <code>Process::RLIM_SAVED_CUR</code> and
4906  * corresponding symbols and strings too.
4907  * See system setrlimit(2) manual for details.
4908  *
4909  * The following example raises the soft limit of core size to
4910  * the hard limit to try to make core dump possible.
4911  *
4912  * Process.setrlimit(:CORE, Process.getrlimit(:CORE)[1])
4913  *
4914  */
4915 
4916 static VALUE
4917 proc_setrlimit(int argc, VALUE *argv, VALUE obj)
4918 {
4919  VALUE resource, rlim_cur, rlim_max;
4920  struct rlimit rlim;
4921 
4922  rb_secure(2);
4923 
4924  rb_scan_args(argc, argv, "21", &resource, &rlim_cur, &rlim_max);
4925  if (rlim_max == Qnil)
4926  rlim_max = rlim_cur;
4927 
4928  rlim.rlim_cur = rlimit_resource_value(rlim_cur);
4929  rlim.rlim_max = rlimit_resource_value(rlim_max);
4930 
4931  if (setrlimit(rlimit_resource_type(resource), &rlim) < 0) {
4932  rb_sys_fail("setrlimit");
4933  }
4934  return Qnil;
4935 }
4936 #else
4937 #define proc_setrlimit rb_f_notimplement
4938 #endif
4939 
4940 static int under_uid_switch = 0;
4941 static void
4942 check_uid_switch(void)
4943 {
4944  rb_secure(2);
4945  if (under_uid_switch) {
4946  rb_raise(rb_eRuntimeError, "can't handle UID while evaluating block given to Process::UID.switch method");
4947  }
4948 }
4949 
4950 static int under_gid_switch = 0;
4951 static void
4952 check_gid_switch(void)
4953 {
4954  rb_secure(2);
4955  if (under_gid_switch) {
4956  rb_raise(rb_eRuntimeError, "can't handle GID while evaluating block given to Process::UID.switch method");
4957  }
4958 }
4959 
4960 
4961 /*********************************************************************
4962  * Document-class: Process::Sys
4963  *
4964  * The <code>Process::Sys</code> module contains UID and GID
4965  * functions which provide direct bindings to the system calls of the
4966  * same names instead of the more-portable versions of the same
4967  * functionality found in the <code>Process</code>,
4968  * <code>Process::UID</code>, and <code>Process::GID</code> modules.
4969  */
4970 
4971 #if defined(HAVE_PWD_H)
4972 static rb_uid_t
4973 obj2uid(VALUE id
4974 # ifdef USE_GETPWNAM_R
4975  , VALUE *getpw_tmp
4976 # endif
4977  )
4978 {
4979  rb_uid_t uid;
4980  VALUE tmp;
4981 
4982  if (FIXNUM_P(id) || NIL_P(tmp = rb_check_string_type(id))) {
4983  uid = NUM2UIDT(id);
4984  }
4985  else {
4986  const char *usrname = StringValueCStr(id);
4987  struct passwd *pwptr;
4988 #ifdef USE_GETPWNAM_R
4989  struct passwd pwbuf;
4990  char *getpw_buf;
4991  long getpw_buf_len;
4992  if (!*getpw_tmp) {
4993  getpw_buf_len = GETPW_R_SIZE_INIT;
4994  if (getpw_buf_len < 0) getpw_buf_len = GETPW_R_SIZE_DEFAULT;
4995  getpw_buf = rb_alloc_tmp_buffer(getpw_tmp, getpw_buf_len);
4996  }
4997  else {
4998  getpw_buf = RSTRING_PTR(*getpw_tmp);
4999  getpw_buf_len = rb_str_capacity(*getpw_tmp);
5000  }
5001  errno = ERANGE;
5002  /* gepwnam_r() on MacOS X doesn't set errno if buffer size is insufficient */
5003  while (getpwnam_r(usrname, &pwbuf, getpw_buf, getpw_buf_len, &pwptr)) {
5004  if (errno != ERANGE || getpw_buf_len >= GETPW_R_SIZE_LIMIT) {
5005  rb_free_tmp_buffer(getpw_tmp);
5006  rb_sys_fail("getpwnam_r");
5007  }
5008  rb_str_modify_expand(*getpw_tmp, getpw_buf_len);
5009  getpw_buf = RSTRING_PTR(*getpw_tmp);
5010  getpw_buf_len = rb_str_capacity(*getpw_tmp);
5011  }
5012 #else
5013  pwptr = getpwnam(usrname);
5014 #endif
5015  if (!pwptr) {
5016 #ifndef USE_GETPWNAM_R
5017  endpwent();
5018 #endif
5019  rb_raise(rb_eArgError, "can't find user for %s", usrname);
5020  }
5021  uid = pwptr->pw_uid;
5022 #ifndef USE_GETPWNAM_R
5023  endpwent();
5024 #endif
5025  }
5026  return uid;
5027 }
5028 
5029 # ifdef p_uid_from_name
5030 /*
5031  * call-seq:
5032  * Process::UID.from_name(name) -> uid
5033  *
5034  * Get the user ID by the _name_.
5035  * If the user is not found, +ArgumentError+ will be raised.
5036  *
5037  * Process::UID.from_name("root") #=> 0
5038  * Process::UID.from_name("nosuchuser") #=> can't find user for nosuchuser (ArgumentError)
5039  */
5040 
5041 static VALUE
5042 p_uid_from_name(VALUE self, VALUE id)
5043 {
5044  return UIDT2NUM(OBJ2UID(id));
5045 }
5046 # endif
5047 #endif
5048 
5049 #if defined(HAVE_GRP_H)
5050 static rb_gid_t
5051 obj2gid(VALUE id
5052 # ifdef USE_GETGRNAM_R
5053  , VALUE *getgr_tmp
5054 # endif
5055  )
5056 {
5057  rb_gid_t gid;
5058  VALUE tmp;
5059 
5060  if (FIXNUM_P(id) || NIL_P(tmp = rb_check_string_type(id))) {
5061  gid = NUM2GIDT(id);
5062  }
5063  else {
5064  const char *grpname = StringValueCStr(id);
5065  struct group *grptr;
5066 #ifdef USE_GETGRNAM_R
5067  struct group grbuf;
5068  char *getgr_buf;
5069  long getgr_buf_len;
5070  if (!*getgr_tmp) {
5071  getgr_buf_len = GETGR_R_SIZE_INIT;
5072  if (getgr_buf_len < 0) getgr_buf_len = GETGR_R_SIZE_DEFAULT;
5073  getgr_buf = rb_alloc_tmp_buffer(getgr_tmp, getgr_buf_len);
5074  }
5075  else {
5076  getgr_buf = RSTRING_PTR(*getgr_tmp);
5077  getgr_buf_len = rb_str_capacity(*getgr_tmp);
5078  }
5079  errno = ERANGE;
5080  /* gegrnam_r() on MacOS X doesn't set errno if buffer size is insufficient */
5081  while (getgrnam_r(grpname, &grbuf, getgr_buf, getgr_buf_len, &grptr)) {
5082  if (errno != ERANGE || getgr_buf_len >= GETGR_R_SIZE_LIMIT) {
5083  rb_free_tmp_buffer(getgr_tmp);
5084  rb_sys_fail("getgrnam_r");
5085  }
5086  rb_str_modify_expand(*getgr_tmp, getgr_buf_len);
5087  getgr_buf = RSTRING_PTR(*getgr_tmp);
5088  getgr_buf_len = rb_str_capacity(*getgr_tmp);
5089  }
5090 #elif defined(HAVE_GETGRNAM)
5091  grptr = getgrnam(grpname);
5092 #else
5093  grptr = NULL;
5094 #endif
5095  if (!grptr) {
5096 #if !defined(USE_GETGRNAM_R) && defined(HAVE_ENDGRENT)
5097  endgrent();
5098 #endif
5099  rb_raise(rb_eArgError, "can't find group for %s", grpname);
5100  }
5101  gid = grptr->gr_gid;
5102 #if !defined(USE_GETGRNAM_R) && defined(HAVE_ENDGRENT)
5103  endgrent();
5104 #endif
5105  }
5106  return gid;
5107 }
5108 
5109 # ifdef p_gid_from_name
5110 /*
5111  * call-seq:
5112  * Process::GID.from_name(name) -> gid
5113  *
5114  * Get the group ID by the _name_.
5115  * If the group is not found, +ArgumentError+ will be raised.
5116  *
5117  * Process::GID.from_name("wheel") #=> 0
5118  * Process::GID.from_name("nosuchgroup") #=> can't find group for nosuchgroup (ArgumentError)
5119  */
5120 
5121 static VALUE
5122 p_gid_from_name(VALUE self, VALUE id)
5123 {
5124  return GIDT2NUM(OBJ2GID(id));
5125 }
5126 # endif
5127 #endif
5128 
5129 #if defined HAVE_SETUID
5130 /*
5131  * call-seq:
5132  * Process::Sys.setuid(user) -> nil
5133  *
5134  * Set the user ID of the current process to _user_. Not
5135  * available on all platforms.
5136  *
5137  */
5138 
5139 static VALUE
5140 p_sys_setuid(VALUE obj, VALUE id)
5141 {
5142  check_uid_switch();
5143  if (setuid(OBJ2UID(id)) != 0) rb_sys_fail(0);
5144  return Qnil;
5145 }
5146 #else
5147 #define p_sys_setuid rb_f_notimplement
5148 #endif
5149 
5150 
5151 #if defined HAVE_SETRUID
5152 /*
5153  * call-seq:
5154  * Process::Sys.setruid(user) -> nil
5155  *
5156  * Set the real user ID of the calling process to _user_.
5157  * Not available on all platforms.
5158  *
5159  */
5160 
5161 static VALUE
5162 p_sys_setruid(VALUE obj, VALUE id)
5163 {
5164  check_uid_switch();
5165  if (setruid(OBJ2UID(id)) != 0) rb_sys_fail(0);
5166  return Qnil;
5167 }
5168 #else
5169 #define p_sys_setruid rb_f_notimplement
5170 #endif
5171 
5172 
5173 #if defined HAVE_SETEUID
5174 /*
5175  * call-seq:
5176  * Process::Sys.seteuid(user) -> nil
5177  *
5178  * Set the effective user ID of the calling process to
5179  * _user_. Not available on all platforms.
5180  *
5181  */
5182 
5183 static VALUE
5184 p_sys_seteuid(VALUE obj, VALUE id)
5185 {
5186  check_uid_switch();
5187  if (seteuid(OBJ2UID(id)) != 0) rb_sys_fail(0);
5188  return Qnil;
5189 }
5190 #else
5191 #define p_sys_seteuid rb_f_notimplement
5192 #endif
5193 
5194 
5195 #if defined HAVE_SETREUID
5196 /*
5197  * call-seq:
5198  * Process::Sys.setreuid(rid, eid) -> nil
5199  *
5200  * Sets the (user) real and/or effective user IDs of the current
5201  * process to _rid_ and _eid_, respectively. A value of
5202  * <code>-1</code> for either means to leave that ID unchanged. Not
5203  * available on all platforms.
5204  *
5205  */
5206 
5207 static VALUE
5208 p_sys_setreuid(VALUE obj, VALUE rid, VALUE eid)
5209 {
5210  rb_uid_t ruid, euid;
5211  PREPARE_GETPWNAM;
5212  check_uid_switch();
5213  ruid = OBJ2UID1(rid);
5214  euid = OBJ2UID1(eid);
5215  FINISH_GETPWNAM;
5216  if (setreuid(ruid, euid) != 0) rb_sys_fail(0);
5217  return Qnil;
5218 }
5219 #else
5220 #define p_sys_setreuid rb_f_notimplement
5221 #endif
5222 
5223 
5224 #if defined HAVE_SETRESUID
5225 /*
5226  * call-seq:
5227  * Process::Sys.setresuid(rid, eid, sid) -> nil
5228  *
5229  * Sets the (user) real, effective, and saved user IDs of the
5230  * current process to _rid_, _eid_, and _sid_ respectively. A
5231  * value of <code>-1</code> for any value means to
5232  * leave that ID unchanged. Not available on all platforms.
5233  *
5234  */
5235 
5236 static VALUE
5237 p_sys_setresuid(VALUE obj, VALUE rid, VALUE eid, VALUE sid)
5238 {
5239  rb_uid_t ruid, euid, suid;
5240  PREPARE_GETPWNAM;
5241  check_uid_switch();
5242  ruid = OBJ2UID1(rid);
5243  euid = OBJ2UID1(eid);
5244  suid = OBJ2UID1(sid);
5245  FINISH_GETPWNAM;
5246  if (setresuid(ruid, euid, suid) != 0) rb_sys_fail(0);
5247  return Qnil;
5248 }
5249 #else
5250 #define p_sys_setresuid rb_f_notimplement
5251 #endif
5252 
5253 
5254 /*
5255  * call-seq:
5256  * Process.uid -> fixnum
5257  * Process::UID.rid -> fixnum
5258  * Process::Sys.getuid -> fixnum
5259  *
5260  * Returns the (real) user ID of this process.
5261  *
5262  * Process.uid #=> 501
5263  */
5264 
5265 static VALUE
5266 proc_getuid(VALUE obj)
5267 {
5268  rb_uid_t uid = getuid();
5269  return UIDT2NUM(uid);
5270 }
5271 
5272 
5273 #if defined(HAVE_SETRESUID) || defined(HAVE_SETREUID) || defined(HAVE_SETRUID) || defined(HAVE_SETUID)
5274 /*
5275  * call-seq:
5276  * Process.uid= user -> numeric
5277  *
5278  * Sets the (user) user ID for this process. Not available on all
5279  * platforms.
5280  */
5281 
5282 static VALUE
5283 proc_setuid(VALUE obj, VALUE id)
5284 {
5285  rb_uid_t uid;
5286 
5287  check_uid_switch();
5288 
5289  uid = OBJ2UID(id);
5290 #if defined(HAVE_SETRESUID)
5291  if (setresuid(uid, -1, -1) < 0) rb_sys_fail(0);
5292 #elif defined HAVE_SETREUID
5293  if (setreuid(uid, -1) < 0) rb_sys_fail(0);
5294 #elif defined HAVE_SETRUID
5295  if (setruid(uid) < 0) rb_sys_fail(0);
5296 #elif defined HAVE_SETUID
5297  {
5298  if (geteuid() == uid) {
5299  if (setuid(uid) < 0) rb_sys_fail(0);
5300  }
5301  else {
5302  rb_notimplement();
5303  }
5304  }
5305 #endif
5306  return id;
5307 }
5308 #else
5309 #define proc_setuid rb_f_notimplement
5310 #endif
5311 
5312 
5313 /********************************************************************
5314  *
5315  * Document-class: Process::UID
5316  *
5317  * The <code>Process::UID</code> module contains a collection of
5318  * module functions which can be used to portably get, set, and
5319  * switch the current process's real, effective, and saved user IDs.
5320  *
5321  */
5322 
5323 static rb_uid_t SAVED_USER_ID = -1;
5324 
5325 #ifdef BROKEN_SETREUID
5326 int
5327 setreuid(rb_uid_t ruid, rb_uid_t euid)
5328 {
5329  if (ruid != (rb_uid_t)-1 && ruid != getuid()) {
5330  if (euid == (rb_uid_t)-1) euid = geteuid();
5331  if (setuid(ruid) < 0) return -1;
5332  }
5333  if (euid != (rb_uid_t)-1 && euid != geteuid()) {
5334  if (seteuid(euid) < 0) return -1;
5335  }
5336  return 0;
5337 }
5338 #endif
5339 
5340 /*
5341  * call-seq:
5342  * Process::UID.change_privilege(user) -> fixnum
5343  *
5344  * Change the current process's real and effective user ID to that
5345  * specified by _user_. Returns the new user ID. Not
5346  * available on all platforms.
5347  *
5348  * [Process.uid, Process.euid] #=> [0, 0]
5349  * Process::UID.change_privilege(31) #=> 31
5350  * [Process.uid, Process.euid] #=> [31, 31]
5351  */
5352 
5353 static VALUE
5354 p_uid_change_privilege(VALUE obj, VALUE id)
5355 {
5356  rb_uid_t uid;
5357 
5358  check_uid_switch();
5359 
5360  uid = OBJ2UID(id);
5361 
5362  if (geteuid() == 0) { /* root-user */
5363 #if defined(HAVE_SETRESUID)
5364  if (setresuid(uid, uid, uid) < 0) rb_sys_fail(0);
5365  SAVED_USER_ID = uid;
5366 #elif defined(HAVE_SETUID)
5367  if (setuid(uid) < 0) rb_sys_fail(0);
5368  SAVED_USER_ID = uid;
5369 #elif defined(HAVE_SETREUID) && !defined(OBSOLETE_SETREUID)
5370  if (getuid() == uid) {
5371  if (SAVED_USER_ID == uid) {
5372  if (setreuid(-1, uid) < 0) rb_sys_fail(0);
5373  }
5374  else {
5375  if (uid == 0) { /* (r,e,s) == (root, root, x) */
5376  if (setreuid(-1, SAVED_USER_ID) < 0) rb_sys_fail(0);
5377  if (setreuid(SAVED_USER_ID, 0) < 0) rb_sys_fail(0);
5378  SAVED_USER_ID = 0; /* (r,e,s) == (x, root, root) */
5379  if (setreuid(uid, uid) < 0) rb_sys_fail(0);
5380  SAVED_USER_ID = uid;
5381  }
5382  else {
5383  if (setreuid(0, -1) < 0) rb_sys_fail(0);
5384  SAVED_USER_ID = 0;
5385  if (setreuid(uid, uid) < 0) rb_sys_fail(0);
5386  SAVED_USER_ID = uid;
5387  }
5388  }
5389  }
5390  else {
5391  if (setreuid(uid, uid) < 0) rb_sys_fail(0);
5392  SAVED_USER_ID = uid;
5393  }
5394 #elif defined(HAVE_SETRUID) && defined(HAVE_SETEUID)
5395  if (getuid() == uid) {
5396  if (SAVED_USER_ID == uid) {
5397  if (seteuid(uid) < 0) rb_sys_fail(0);
5398  }
5399  else {
5400  if (uid == 0) {
5401  if (setruid(SAVED_USER_ID) < 0) rb_sys_fail(0);
5402  SAVED_USER_ID = 0;
5403  if (setruid(0) < 0) rb_sys_fail(0);
5404  }
5405  else {
5406  if (setruid(0) < 0) rb_sys_fail(0);
5407  SAVED_USER_ID = 0;
5408  if (seteuid(uid) < 0) rb_sys_fail(0);
5409  if (setruid(uid) < 0) rb_sys_fail(0);
5410  SAVED_USER_ID = uid;
5411  }
5412  }
5413  }
5414  else {
5415  if (seteuid(uid) < 0) rb_sys_fail(0);
5416  if (setruid(uid) < 0) rb_sys_fail(0);
5417  SAVED_USER_ID = uid;
5418  }
5419 #else
5420  (void)uid;
5421  rb_notimplement();
5422 #endif
5423  }
5424  else { /* unprivileged user */
5425 #if defined(HAVE_SETRESUID)
5426  if (setresuid((getuid() == uid)? (rb_uid_t)-1: uid,
5427  (geteuid() == uid)? (rb_uid_t)-1: uid,
5428  (SAVED_USER_ID == uid)? (rb_uid_t)-1: uid) < 0) rb_sys_fail(0);
5429  SAVED_USER_ID = uid;
5430 #elif defined(HAVE_SETREUID) && !defined(OBSOLETE_SETREUID)
5431  if (SAVED_USER_ID == uid) {
5432  if (setreuid((getuid() == uid)? (rb_uid_t)-1: uid,
5433  (geteuid() == uid)? (rb_uid_t)-1: uid) < 0)
5434  rb_sys_fail(0);
5435  }
5436  else if (getuid() != uid) {
5437  if (setreuid(uid, (geteuid() == uid)? (rb_uid_t)-1: uid) < 0)
5438  rb_sys_fail(0);
5439  SAVED_USER_ID = uid;
5440  }
5441  else if (/* getuid() == uid && */ geteuid() != uid) {
5442  if (setreuid(geteuid(), uid) < 0) rb_sys_fail(0);
5443  SAVED_USER_ID = uid;
5444  if (setreuid(uid, -1) < 0) rb_sys_fail(0);
5445  }
5446  else { /* getuid() == uid && geteuid() == uid */
5447  if (setreuid(-1, SAVED_USER_ID) < 0) rb_sys_fail(0);
5448  if (setreuid(SAVED_USER_ID, uid) < 0) rb_sys_fail(0);
5449  SAVED_USER_ID = uid;
5450  if (setreuid(uid, -1) < 0) rb_sys_fail(0);
5451  }
5452 #elif defined(HAVE_SETRUID) && defined(HAVE_SETEUID)
5453  if (SAVED_USER_ID == uid) {
5454  if (geteuid() != uid && seteuid(uid) < 0) rb_sys_fail(0);
5455  if (getuid() != uid && setruid(uid) < 0) rb_sys_fail(0);
5456  }
5457  else if (/* SAVED_USER_ID != uid && */ geteuid() == uid) {
5458  if (getuid() != uid) {
5459  if (setruid(uid) < 0) rb_sys_fail(0);
5460  SAVED_USER_ID = uid;
5461  }
5462  else {
5463  if (setruid(SAVED_USER_ID) < 0) rb_sys_fail(0);
5464  SAVED_USER_ID = uid;
5465  if (setruid(uid) < 0) rb_sys_fail(0);
5466  }
5467  }
5468  else if (/* geteuid() != uid && */ getuid() == uid) {
5469  if (seteuid(uid) < 0) rb_sys_fail(0);
5470  if (setruid(SAVED_USER_ID) < 0) rb_sys_fail(0);
5471  SAVED_USER_ID = uid;
5472  if (setruid(uid) < 0) rb_sys_fail(0);
5473  }
5474  else {
5475  errno = EPERM;
5476  rb_sys_fail(0);
5477  }
5478 #elif defined HAVE_44BSD_SETUID
5479  if (getuid() == uid) {
5480  /* (r,e,s)==(uid,?,?) ==> (uid,uid,uid) */
5481  if (setuid(uid) < 0) rb_sys_fail(0);
5482  SAVED_USER_ID = uid;
5483  }
5484  else {
5485  errno = EPERM;
5486  rb_sys_fail(0);
5487  }
5488 #elif defined HAVE_SETEUID
5489  if (getuid() == uid && SAVED_USER_ID == uid) {
5490  if (seteuid(uid) < 0) rb_sys_fail(0);
5491  }
5492  else {
5493  errno = EPERM;
5494  rb_sys_fail(0);
5495  }
5496 #elif defined HAVE_SETUID
5497  if (getuid() == uid && SAVED_USER_ID == uid) {
5498  if (setuid(uid) < 0) rb_sys_fail(0);
5499  }
5500  else {
5501  errno = EPERM;
5502  rb_sys_fail(0);
5503  }
5504 #else
5505  rb_notimplement();
5506 #endif
5507  }
5508  return id;
5509 }
5510 
5511 
5512 
5513 #if defined HAVE_SETGID
5514 /*
5515  * call-seq:
5516  * Process::Sys.setgid(group) -> nil
5517  *
5518  * Set the group ID of the current process to _group_. Not
5519  * available on all platforms.
5520  *
5521  */
5522 
5523 static VALUE
5524 p_sys_setgid(VALUE obj, VALUE id)
5525 {
5526  check_gid_switch();
5527  if (setgid(OBJ2GID(id)) != 0) rb_sys_fail(0);
5528  return Qnil;
5529 }
5530 #else
5531 #define p_sys_setgid rb_f_notimplement
5532 #endif
5533 
5534 
5535 #if defined HAVE_SETRGID
5536 /*
5537  * call-seq:
5538  * Process::Sys.setrgid(group) -> nil
5539  *
5540  * Set the real group ID of the calling process to _group_.
5541  * Not available on all platforms.
5542  *
5543  */
5544 
5545 static VALUE
5546 p_sys_setrgid(VALUE obj, VALUE id)
5547 {
5548  check_gid_switch();
5549  if (setrgid(OBJ2GID(id)) != 0) rb_sys_fail(0);
5550  return Qnil;
5551 }
5552 #else
5553 #define p_sys_setrgid rb_f_notimplement
5554 #endif
5555 
5556 
5557 #if defined HAVE_SETEGID
5558 /*
5559  * call-seq:
5560  * Process::Sys.setegid(group) -> nil
5561  *
5562  * Set the effective group ID of the calling process to
5563  * _group_. Not available on all platforms.
5564  *
5565  */
5566 
5567 static VALUE
5568 p_sys_setegid(VALUE obj, VALUE id)
5569 {
5570  check_gid_switch();
5571  if (setegid(OBJ2GID(id)) != 0) rb_sys_fail(0);
5572  return Qnil;
5573 }
5574 #else
5575 #define p_sys_setegid rb_f_notimplement
5576 #endif
5577 
5578 
5579 #if defined HAVE_SETREGID
5580 /*
5581  * call-seq:
5582  * Process::Sys.setregid(rid, eid) -> nil
5583  *
5584  * Sets the (group) real and/or effective group IDs of the current
5585  * process to <em>rid</em> and <em>eid</em>, respectively. A value of
5586  * <code>-1</code> for either means to leave that ID unchanged. Not
5587  * available on all platforms.
5588  *
5589  */
5590 
5591 static VALUE
5592 p_sys_setregid(VALUE obj, VALUE rid, VALUE eid)
5593 {
5594  rb_gid_t rgid, egid;
5595  PREPARE_GETGRNAM;
5596  check_gid_switch();
5597  rgid = OBJ2GID(rid);
5598  egid = OBJ2GID(eid);
5599  FINISH_GETGRNAM;
5600  if (setregid(rgid, egid) != 0) rb_sys_fail(0);
5601  return Qnil;
5602 }
5603 #else
5604 #define p_sys_setregid rb_f_notimplement
5605 #endif
5606 
5607 #if defined HAVE_SETRESGID
5608 /*
5609  * call-seq:
5610  * Process::Sys.setresgid(rid, eid, sid) -> nil
5611  *
5612  * Sets the (group) real, effective, and saved user IDs of the
5613  * current process to <em>rid</em>, <em>eid</em>, and <em>sid</em>
5614  * respectively. A value of <code>-1</code> for any value means to
5615  * leave that ID unchanged. Not available on all platforms.
5616  *
5617  */
5618 
5619 static VALUE
5620 p_sys_setresgid(VALUE obj, VALUE rid, VALUE eid, VALUE sid)
5621 {
5622  rb_gid_t rgid, egid, sgid;
5623  PREPARE_GETGRNAM;
5624  check_gid_switch();
5625  rgid = OBJ2GID(rid);
5626  egid = OBJ2GID(eid);
5627  sgid = OBJ2GID(sid);
5628  FINISH_GETGRNAM;
5629  if (setresgid(rgid, egid, sgid) != 0) rb_sys_fail(0);
5630  return Qnil;
5631 }
5632 #else
5633 #define p_sys_setresgid rb_f_notimplement
5634 #endif
5635 
5636 
5637 #if defined HAVE_ISSETUGID
5638 /*
5639  * call-seq:
5640  * Process::Sys.issetugid -> true or false
5641  *
5642  * Returns +true+ if the process was created as a result
5643  * of an execve(2) system call which had either of the setuid or
5644  * setgid bits set (and extra privileges were given as a result) or
5645  * if it has changed any of its real, effective or saved user or
5646  * group IDs since it began execution.
5647  *
5648  */
5649 
5650 static VALUE
5651 p_sys_issetugid(VALUE obj)
5652 {
5653  rb_secure(2);
5654  if (issetugid()) {
5655  return Qtrue;
5656  }
5657  else {
5658  return Qfalse;
5659  }
5660 }
5661 #else
5662 #define p_sys_issetugid rb_f_notimplement
5663 #endif
5664 
5665 
5666 /*
5667  * call-seq:
5668  * Process.gid -> fixnum
5669  * Process::GID.rid -> fixnum
5670  * Process::Sys.getgid -> fixnum
5671  *
5672  * Returns the (real) group ID for this process.
5673  *
5674  * Process.gid #=> 500
5675  */
5676 
5677 static VALUE
5678 proc_getgid(VALUE obj)
5679 {
5680  rb_gid_t gid = getgid();
5681  return GIDT2NUM(gid);
5682 }
5683 
5684 
5685 #if defined(HAVE_SETRESGID) || defined(HAVE_SETREGID) || defined(HAVE_SETRGID) || defined(HAVE_SETGID)
5686 /*
5687  * call-seq:
5688  * Process.gid= fixnum -> fixnum
5689  *
5690  * Sets the group ID for this process.
5691  */
5692 
5693 static VALUE
5694 proc_setgid(VALUE obj, VALUE id)
5695 {
5696  rb_gid_t gid;
5697 
5698  check_gid_switch();
5699 
5700  gid = OBJ2GID(id);
5701 #if defined(HAVE_SETRESGID)
5702  if (setresgid(gid, -1, -1) < 0) rb_sys_fail(0);
5703 #elif defined HAVE_SETREGID
5704  if (setregid(gid, -1) < 0) rb_sys_fail(0);
5705 #elif defined HAVE_SETRGID
5706  if (setrgid(gid) < 0) rb_sys_fail(0);
5707 #elif defined HAVE_SETGID
5708  {
5709  if (getegid() == gid) {
5710  if (setgid(gid) < 0) rb_sys_fail(0);
5711  }
5712  else {
5713  rb_notimplement();
5714  }
5715  }
5716 #endif
5717  return GIDT2NUM(gid);
5718 }
5719 #else
5720 #define proc_setgid rb_f_notimplement
5721 #endif
5722 
5723 
5724 #if defined(_SC_NGROUPS_MAX) || defined(NGROUPS_MAX)
5725 /*
5726  * Maximum supplementary groups are platform dependent.
5727  * FWIW, 65536 is enough big for our supported OSs.
5728  *
5729  * OS Name max groups
5730  * -----------------------------------------------
5731  * Linux Kernel >= 2.6.3 65536
5732  * Linux Kernel < 2.6.3 32
5733  * IBM AIX 5.2 64
5734  * IBM AIX 5.3 ... 6.1 128
5735  * IBM AIX 7.1 128 (can be configured to be up to 2048)
5736  * OpenBSD, NetBSD 16
5737  * FreeBSD < 8.0 16
5738  * FreeBSD >=8.0 1023
5739  * Darwin (Mac OS X) 16
5740  * Sun Solaris 7,8,9,10 16
5741  * Sun Solaris 11 / OpenSolaris 1024
5742  * HP-UX 20
5743  * Windows 1015
5744  */
5745 static int _maxgroups = -1;
5746 static int
5747 get_sc_ngroups_max(void)
5748 {
5749 #ifdef _SC_NGROUPS_MAX
5750  return (int)sysconf(_SC_NGROUPS_MAX);
5751 #elif defined(NGROUPS_MAX)
5752  return (int)NGROUPS_MAX;
5753 #else
5754  return -1;
5755 #endif
5756 }
5757 static int
5758 maxgroups(void)
5759 {
5760  if (_maxgroups < 0) {
5761  _maxgroups = get_sc_ngroups_max();
5762  if (_maxgroups < 0)
5763  _maxgroups = RB_MAX_GROUPS;
5764  }
5765 
5766  return _maxgroups;
5767 }
5768 #endif
5769 
5770 
5771 
5772 #ifdef HAVE_GETGROUPS
5773 /*
5774  * call-seq:
5775  * Process.groups -> array
5776  *
5777  * Get an <code>Array</code> of the gids of groups in the
5778  * supplemental group access list for this process.
5779  *
5780  * Process.groups #=> [27, 6, 10, 11]
5781  *
5782  */
5783 
5784 static VALUE
5785 proc_getgroups(VALUE obj)
5786 {
5787  VALUE ary, tmp;
5788  int i, ngroups;
5789  rb_gid_t *groups;
5790 
5791  ngroups = getgroups(0, NULL);
5792  if (ngroups == -1)
5793  rb_sys_fail(0);
5794 
5795  groups = ALLOCV_N(rb_gid_t, tmp, ngroups);
5796 
5797  ngroups = getgroups(ngroups, groups);
5798  if (ngroups == -1)
5799  rb_sys_fail(0);
5800 
5801  ary = rb_ary_new();
5802  for (i = 0; i < ngroups; i++)
5803  rb_ary_push(ary, GIDT2NUM(groups[i]));
5804 
5805  ALLOCV_END(tmp);
