5806 
5807  return ary;
5808 }
5809 #else
5810 #define proc_getgroups rb_f_notimplement
5811 #endif
5812 
5813 
5814 #ifdef HAVE_SETGROUPS
5815 /*
5816  * call-seq:
5817  * Process.groups= array -> array
5818  *
5819  * Set the supplemental group access list to the given
5820  * <code>Array</code> of group IDs.
5821  *
5822  * Process.groups #=> [0, 1, 2, 3, 4, 6, 10, 11, 20, 26, 27]
5823  * Process.groups = [27, 6, 10, 11] #=> [27, 6, 10, 11]
5824  * Process.groups #=> [27, 6, 10, 11]
5825  *
5826  */
5827 
5828 static VALUE
5829 proc_setgroups(VALUE obj, VALUE ary)
5830 {
5831  int ngroups, i;
5832  rb_gid_t *groups;
5833  VALUE tmp;
5834  PREPARE_GETGRNAM;
5835 
5836  Check_Type(ary, T_ARRAY);
5837 
5838  ngroups = RARRAY_LENINT(ary);
5839  if (ngroups > maxgroups())
5840  rb_raise(rb_eArgError, "too many groups, %d max", maxgroups());
5841 
5842  groups = ALLOCV_N(rb_gid_t, tmp, ngroups);
5843 
5844  for (i = 0; i < ngroups; i++) {
5845  VALUE g = RARRAY_AREF(ary, i);
5846 
5847  groups[i] = OBJ2GID1(g);
5848  }
5849  FINISH_GETGRNAM;
5850 
5851  if (setgroups(ngroups, groups) == -1) /* ngroups <= maxgroups */
5852  rb_sys_fail(0);
5853 
5854  ALLOCV_END(tmp);
5855 
5856  return proc_getgroups(obj);
5857 }
5858 #else
5859 #define proc_setgroups rb_f_notimplement
5860 #endif
5861 
5862 
5863 #ifdef HAVE_INITGROUPS
5864 /*
5865  * call-seq:
5866  * Process.initgroups(username, gid) -> array
5867  *
5868  * Initializes the supplemental group access list by reading the
5869  * system group database and using all groups of which the given user
5870  * is a member. The group with the specified <em>gid</em> is also
5871  * added to the list. Returns the resulting <code>Array</code> of the
5872  * gids of all the groups in the supplementary group access list. Not
5873  * available on all platforms.
5874  *
5875  * Process.groups #=> [0, 1, 2, 3, 4, 6, 10, 11, 20, 26, 27]
5876  * Process.initgroups( "mgranger", 30 ) #=> [30, 6, 10, 11]
5877  * Process.groups #=> [30, 6, 10, 11]
5878  *
5879  */
5880 
5881 static VALUE
5882 proc_initgroups(VALUE obj, VALUE uname, VALUE base_grp)
5883 {
5884  if (initgroups(StringValuePtr(uname), OBJ2GID(base_grp)) != 0) {
5885  rb_sys_fail(0);
5886  }
5887  return proc_getgroups(obj);
5888 }
5889 #else
5890 #define proc_initgroups rb_f_notimplement
5891 #endif
5892 
5893 #if defined(_SC_NGROUPS_MAX) || defined(NGROUPS_MAX)
5894 /*
5895  * call-seq:
5896  * Process.maxgroups -> fixnum
5897  *
5898  * Returns the maximum number of gids allowed in the supplemental
5899  * group access list.
5900  *
5901  * Process.maxgroups #=> 32
5902  */
5903 
5904 static VALUE
5905 proc_getmaxgroups(VALUE obj)
5906 {
5907  return INT2FIX(maxgroups());
5908 }
5909 #else
5910 #define proc_getmaxgroups rb_f_notimplement
5911 #endif
5912 
5913 #ifdef HAVE_SETGROUPS
5914 /*
5915  * call-seq:
5916  * Process.maxgroups= fixnum -> fixnum
5917  *
5918  * Sets the maximum number of gids allowed in the supplemental group
5919  * access list.
5920  */
5921 
5922 static VALUE
5923 proc_setmaxgroups(VALUE obj, VALUE val)
5924 {
5925  int ngroups = FIX2INT(val);
5926  int ngroups_max = get_sc_ngroups_max();
5927 
5928  if (ngroups <= 0)
5929  rb_raise(rb_eArgError, "maxgroups %d shold be positive", ngroups);
5930 
5931  if (ngroups > RB_MAX_GROUPS)
5932  ngroups = RB_MAX_GROUPS;
5933 
5934  if (ngroups_max > 0 && ngroups > ngroups_max)
5935  ngroups = ngroups_max;
5936 
5937  _maxgroups = ngroups;
5938 
5939  return INT2FIX(_maxgroups);
5940 }
5941 #else
5942 #define proc_setmaxgroups rb_f_notimplement
5943 #endif
5944 
5945 #if defined(HAVE_DAEMON) || (defined(HAVE_WORKING_FORK) && defined(HAVE_SETSID))
5946 static int rb_daemon(int nochdir, int noclose);
5947 
5948 /*
5949  * call-seq:
5950  * Process.daemon() -> 0
5951  * Process.daemon(nochdir=nil,noclose=nil) -> 0
5952  *
5953  * Detach the process from controlling terminal and run in
5954  * the background as system daemon. Unless the argument
5955  * nochdir is true (i.e. non false), it changes the current
5956  * working directory to the root ("/"). Unless the argument
5957  * noclose is true, daemon() will redirect standard input,
5958  * standard output and standard error to /dev/null.
5959  * Return zero on success, or raise one of Errno::*.
5960  */
5961 
5962 static VALUE
5963 proc_daemon(int argc, VALUE *argv)
5964 {
5965  VALUE nochdir, noclose;
5966  int n;
5967 
5968  rb_secure(2);
5969  rb_scan_args(argc, argv, "02", &nochdir, &noclose);
5970 
5971  prefork();
5972  n = rb_daemon(RTEST(nochdir), RTEST(noclose));
5973  if (n < 0) rb_sys_fail("daemon");
5974  return INT2FIX(n);
5975 }
5976 
5977 static int
5978 rb_daemon(int nochdir, int noclose)
5979 {
5980  int err = 0;
5981 #ifdef HAVE_DAEMON
5982  before_fork_ruby();
5983  err = daemon(nochdir, noclose);
5984  after_fork_ruby();
5985  rb_thread_atfork();
5986 #else
5987  int n;
5988 
5989 #define fork_daemon() \
5990  switch (rb_fork_ruby(NULL)) { \
5991  case -1: return -1; \
5992  case 0: rb_thread_atfork(); break; \
5993  default: _exit(EXIT_SUCCESS); \
5994  }
5995 
5996  fork_daemon();
5997 
5998  if (setsid() < 0) return -1;
5999 
6000  /* must not be process-leader */
6001  fork_daemon();
6002 
6003  if (!nochdir)
6004  err = chdir("/");
6005 
6006  if (!noclose && (n = rb_cloexec_open("/dev/null", O_RDWR, 0)) != -1) {
6007  rb_update_max_fd(n);
6008  (void)dup2(n, 0);
6009  (void)dup2(n, 1);
6010  (void)dup2(n, 2);
6011  if (n > 2)
6012  (void)close (n);
6013  }
6014 #endif
6015  return err;
6016 }
6017 #else
6018 #define proc_daemon rb_f_notimplement
6019 #endif
6020 
6021 /********************************************************************
6022  *
6023  * Document-class: Process::GID
6024  *
6025  * The <code>Process::GID</code> module contains a collection of
6026  * module functions which can be used to portably get, set, and
6027  * switch the current process's real, effective, and saved group IDs.
6028  *
6029  */
6030 
6031 static rb_gid_t SAVED_GROUP_ID = -1;
6032 
6033 #ifdef BROKEN_SETREGID
6034 int
6035 setregid(rb_gid_t rgid, rb_gid_t egid)
6036 {
6037  if (rgid != (rb_gid_t)-1 && rgid != getgid()) {
6038  if (egid == (rb_gid_t)-1) egid = getegid();
6039  if (setgid(rgid) < 0) return -1;
6040  }
6041  if (egid != (rb_gid_t)-1 && egid != getegid()) {
6042  if (setegid(egid) < 0) return -1;
6043  }
6044  return 0;
6045 }
6046 #endif
6047 
6048 /*
6049  * call-seq:
6050  * Process::GID.change_privilege(group) -> fixnum
6051  *
6052  * Change the current process's real and effective group ID to that
6053  * specified by _group_. Returns the new group ID. Not
6054  * available on all platforms.
6055  *
6056  * [Process.gid, Process.egid] #=> [0, 0]
6057  * Process::GID.change_privilege(33) #=> 33
6058  * [Process.gid, Process.egid] #=> [33, 33]
6059  */
6060 
6061 static VALUE
6062 p_gid_change_privilege(VALUE obj, VALUE id)
6063 {
6064  rb_gid_t gid;
6065 
6066  check_gid_switch();
6067 
6068  gid = OBJ2GID(id);
6069 
6070  if (geteuid() == 0) { /* root-user */
6071 #if defined(HAVE_SETRESGID)
6072  if (setresgid(gid, gid, gid) < 0) rb_sys_fail(0);
6073  SAVED_GROUP_ID = gid;
6074 #elif defined HAVE_SETGID
6075  if (setgid(gid) < 0) rb_sys_fail(0);
6076  SAVED_GROUP_ID = gid;
6077 #elif defined(HAVE_SETREGID) && !defined(OBSOLETE_SETREGID)
6078  if (getgid() == gid) {
6079  if (SAVED_GROUP_ID == gid) {
6080  if (setregid(-1, gid) < 0) rb_sys_fail(0);
6081  }
6082  else {
6083  if (gid == 0) { /* (r,e,s) == (root, y, x) */
6084  if (setregid(-1, SAVED_GROUP_ID) < 0) rb_sys_fail(0);
6085  if (setregid(SAVED_GROUP_ID, 0) < 0) rb_sys_fail(0);
6086  SAVED_GROUP_ID = 0; /* (r,e,s) == (x, root, root) */
6087  if (setregid(gid, gid) < 0) rb_sys_fail(0);
6088  SAVED_GROUP_ID = gid;
6089  }
6090  else { /* (r,e,s) == (z, y, x) */
6091  if (setregid(0, 0) < 0) rb_sys_fail(0);
6092  SAVED_GROUP_ID = 0;
6093  if (setregid(gid, gid) < 0) rb_sys_fail(0);
6094  SAVED_GROUP_ID = gid;
6095  }
6096  }
6097  }
6098  else {
6099  if (setregid(gid, gid) < 0) rb_sys_fail(0);
6100  SAVED_GROUP_ID = gid;
6101  }
6102 #elif defined(HAVE_SETRGID) && defined (HAVE_SETEGID)
6103  if (getgid() == gid) {
6104  if (SAVED_GROUP_ID == gid) {
6105  if (setegid(gid) < 0) rb_sys_fail(0);
6106  }
6107  else {
6108  if (gid == 0) {
6109  if (setegid(gid) < 0) rb_sys_fail(0);
6110  if (setrgid(SAVED_GROUP_ID) < 0) rb_sys_fail(0);
6111  SAVED_GROUP_ID = 0;
6112  if (setrgid(0) < 0) rb_sys_fail(0);
6113  }
6114  else {
6115  if (setrgid(0) < 0) rb_sys_fail(0);
6116  SAVED_GROUP_ID = 0;
6117  if (setegid(gid) < 0) rb_sys_fail(0);
6118  if (setrgid(gid) < 0) rb_sys_fail(0);
6119  SAVED_GROUP_ID = gid;
6120  }
6121  }
6122  }
6123  else {
6124  if (setegid(gid) < 0) rb_sys_fail(0);
6125  if (setrgid(gid) < 0) rb_sys_fail(0);
6126  SAVED_GROUP_ID = gid;
6127  }
6128 #else
6129  rb_notimplement();
6130 #endif
6131  }
6132  else { /* unprivileged user */
6133 #if defined(HAVE_SETRESGID)
6134  if (setresgid((getgid() == gid)? (rb_gid_t)-1: gid,
6135  (getegid() == gid)? (rb_gid_t)-1: gid,
6136  (SAVED_GROUP_ID == gid)? (rb_gid_t)-1: gid) < 0) rb_sys_fail(0);
6137  SAVED_GROUP_ID = gid;
6138 #elif defined(HAVE_SETREGID) && !defined(OBSOLETE_SETREGID)
6139  if (SAVED_GROUP_ID == gid) {
6140  if (setregid((getgid() == gid)? (rb_uid_t)-1: gid,
6141  (getegid() == gid)? (rb_uid_t)-1: gid) < 0)
6142  rb_sys_fail(0);
6143  }
6144  else if (getgid() != gid) {
6145  if (setregid(gid, (getegid() == gid)? (rb_uid_t)-1: gid) < 0)
6146  rb_sys_fail(0);
6147  SAVED_GROUP_ID = gid;
6148  }
6149  else if (/* getgid() == gid && */ getegid() != gid) {
6150  if (setregid(getegid(), gid) < 0) rb_sys_fail(0);
6151  SAVED_GROUP_ID = gid;
6152  if (setregid(gid, -1) < 0) rb_sys_fail(0);
6153  }
6154  else { /* getgid() == gid && getegid() == gid */
6155  if (setregid(-1, SAVED_GROUP_ID) < 0) rb_sys_fail(0);
6156  if (setregid(SAVED_GROUP_ID, gid) < 0) rb_sys_fail(0);
6157  SAVED_GROUP_ID = gid;
6158  if (setregid(gid, -1) < 0) rb_sys_fail(0);
6159  }
6160 #elif defined(HAVE_SETRGID) && defined(HAVE_SETEGID)
6161  if (SAVED_GROUP_ID == gid) {
6162  if (getegid() != gid && setegid(gid) < 0) rb_sys_fail(0);
6163  if (getgid() != gid && setrgid(gid) < 0) rb_sys_fail(0);
6164  }
6165  else if (/* SAVED_GROUP_ID != gid && */ getegid() == gid) {
6166  if (getgid() != gid) {
6167  if (setrgid(gid) < 0) rb_sys_fail(0);
6168  SAVED_GROUP_ID = gid;
6169  }
6170  else {
6171  if (setrgid(SAVED_GROUP_ID) < 0) rb_sys_fail(0);
6172  SAVED_GROUP_ID = gid;
6173  if (setrgid(gid) < 0) rb_sys_fail(0);
6174  }
6175  }
6176  else if (/* getegid() != gid && */ getgid() == gid) {
6177  if (setegid(gid) < 0) rb_sys_fail(0);
6178  if (setrgid(SAVED_GROUP_ID) < 0) rb_sys_fail(0);
6179  SAVED_GROUP_ID = gid;
6180  if (setrgid(gid) < 0) rb_sys_fail(0);
6181  }
6182  else {
6183  errno = EPERM;
6184  rb_sys_fail(0);
6185  }
6186 #elif defined HAVE_44BSD_SETGID
6187  if (getgid() == gid) {
6188  /* (r,e,s)==(gid,?,?) ==> (gid,gid,gid) */
6189  if (setgid(gid) < 0) rb_sys_fail(0);
6190  SAVED_GROUP_ID = gid;
6191  }
6192  else {
6193  errno = EPERM;
6194  rb_sys_fail(0);
6195  }
6196 #elif defined HAVE_SETEGID
6197  if (getgid() == gid && SAVED_GROUP_ID == gid) {
6198  if (setegid(gid) < 0) rb_sys_fail(0);
6199  }
6200  else {
6201  errno = EPERM;
6202  rb_sys_fail(0);
6203  }
6204 #elif defined HAVE_SETGID
6205  if (getgid() == gid && SAVED_GROUP_ID == gid) {
6206  if (setgid(gid) < 0) rb_sys_fail(0);
6207  }
6208  else {
6209  errno = EPERM;
6210  rb_sys_fail(0);
6211  }
6212 #else
6213  (void)gid;
6214  rb_notimplement();
6215 #endif
6216  }
6217  return id;
6218 }
6219 
6220 
6221 /*
6222  * call-seq:
6223  * Process.euid -> fixnum
6224  * Process::UID.eid -> fixnum
6225  * Process::Sys.geteuid -> fixnum
6226  *
6227  * Returns the effective user ID for this process.
6228  *
6229  * Process.euid #=> 501
6230  */
6231 
6232 static VALUE
6233 proc_geteuid(VALUE obj)
6234 {
6235  rb_uid_t euid = geteuid();
6236  return UIDT2NUM(euid);
6237 }
6238 
6239 #if defined(HAVE_SETRESUID) || defined(HAVE_SETREUID) || defined(HAVE_SETEUID) || defined(HAVE_SETUID) || defined(_POSIX_SAVED_IDS)
6240 static void
6241 proc_seteuid(rb_uid_t uid)
6242 {
6243 #if defined(HAVE_SETRESUID)
6244  if (setresuid(-1, uid, -1) < 0) rb_sys_fail(0);
6245 #elif defined HAVE_SETREUID
6246  if (setreuid(-1, uid) < 0) rb_sys_fail(0);
6247 #elif defined HAVE_SETEUID
6248  if (seteuid(uid) < 0) rb_sys_fail(0);
6249 #elif defined HAVE_SETUID
6250  if (uid == getuid()) {
6251  if (setuid(uid) < 0) rb_sys_fail(0);
6252  }
6253  else {
6254  rb_notimplement();
6255  }
6256 #else
6257  rb_notimplement();
6258 #endif
6259 }
6260 #endif
6261 
6262 #if defined(HAVE_SETRESUID) || defined(HAVE_SETREUID) || defined(HAVE_SETEUID) || defined(HAVE_SETUID)
6263 /*
6264  * call-seq:
6265  * Process.euid= user
6266  *
6267  * Sets the effective user ID for this process. Not available on all
6268  * platforms.
6269  */
6270 
6271 static VALUE
6272 proc_seteuid_m(VALUE mod, VALUE euid)
6273 {
6274  check_uid_switch();
6275  proc_seteuid(OBJ2UID(euid));
6276  return euid;
6277 }
6278 #else
6279 #define proc_seteuid_m rb_f_notimplement
6280 #endif
6281 
6282 static rb_uid_t
6283 rb_seteuid_core(rb_uid_t euid)
6284 {
6285 #if defined(HAVE_SETRESUID) || (defined(HAVE_SETREUID) && !defined(OBSOLETE_SETREUID))
6286  rb_uid_t uid;
6287 #endif
6288 
6289  check_uid_switch();
6290 
6291 #if defined(HAVE_SETRESUID) || (defined(HAVE_SETREUID) && !defined(OBSOLETE_SETREUID))
6292  uid = getuid();
6293 #endif
6294 
6295 #if defined(HAVE_SETRESUID)
6296  if (uid != euid) {
6297  if (setresuid(-1,euid,euid) < 0) rb_sys_fail(0);
6298  SAVED_USER_ID = euid;
6299  }
6300  else {
6301  if (setresuid(-1,euid,-1) < 0) rb_sys_fail(0);
6302  }
6303 #elif defined(HAVE_SETREUID) && !defined(OBSOLETE_SETREUID)
6304  if (setreuid(-1, euid) < 0) rb_sys_fail(0);
6305  if (uid != euid) {
6306  if (setreuid(euid,uid) < 0) rb_sys_fail(0);
6307  if (setreuid(uid,euid) < 0) rb_sys_fail(0);
6308  SAVED_USER_ID = euid;
6309  }
6310 #elif defined HAVE_SETEUID
6311  if (seteuid(euid) < 0) rb_sys_fail(0);
6312 #elif defined HAVE_SETUID
6313  if (geteuid() == 0) rb_sys_fail(0);
6314  if (setuid(euid) < 0) rb_sys_fail(0);
6315 #else
6316  rb_notimplement();
6317 #endif
6318  return euid;
6319 }
6320 
6321 
6322 /*
6323  * call-seq:
6324  * Process::UID.grant_privilege(user) -> fixnum
6325  * Process::UID.eid= user -> fixnum
6326  *
6327  * Set the effective user ID, and if possible, the saved user ID of
6328  * the process to the given _user_. Returns the new
6329  * effective user ID. Not available on all platforms.
6330  *
6331  * [Process.uid, Process.euid] #=> [0, 0]
6332  * Process::UID.grant_privilege(31) #=> 31
6333  * [Process.uid, Process.euid] #=> [0, 31]
6334  */
6335 
6336 static VALUE
6337 p_uid_grant_privilege(VALUE obj, VALUE id)
6338 {
6339  rb_seteuid_core(OBJ2UID(id));
6340  return id;
6341 }
6342 
6343 
6344 /*
6345  * call-seq:
6346  * Process.egid -> fixnum
6347  * Process::GID.eid -> fixnum
6348  * Process::Sys.geteid -> fixnum
6349  *
6350  * Returns the effective group ID for this process. Not available on
6351  * all platforms.
6352  *
6353  * Process.egid #=> 500
6354  */
6355 
6356 static VALUE
6357 proc_getegid(VALUE obj)
6358 {
6359  rb_gid_t egid = getegid();
6360 
6361  return GIDT2NUM(egid);
6362 }
6363 
6364 #if defined(HAVE_SETRESGID) || defined(HAVE_SETREGID) || defined(HAVE_SETEGID) || defined(HAVE_SETGID) || defined(_POSIX_SAVED_IDS)
6365 /*
6366  * call-seq:
6367  * Process.egid = fixnum -> fixnum
6368  *
6369  * Sets the effective group ID for this process. Not available on all
6370  * platforms.
6371  */
6372 
6373 static VALUE
6374 proc_setegid(VALUE obj, VALUE egid)
6375 {
6376 #if defined(HAVE_SETRESGID) || defined(HAVE_SETREGID) || defined(HAVE_SETEGID) || defined(HAVE_SETGID)
6377  rb_gid_t gid;
6378 #endif
6379 
6380  check_gid_switch();
6381 
6382 #if defined(HAVE_SETRESGID) || defined(HAVE_SETREGID) || defined(HAVE_SETEGID) || defined(HAVE_SETGID)
6383  gid = OBJ2GID(egid);
6384 #endif
6385 
6386 #if defined(HAVE_SETRESGID)
6387  if (setresgid(-1, gid, -1) < 0) rb_sys_fail(0);
6388 #elif defined HAVE_SETREGID
6389  if (setregid(-1, gid) < 0) rb_sys_fail(0);
6390 #elif defined HAVE_SETEGID
6391  if (setegid(gid) < 0) rb_sys_fail(0);
6392 #elif defined HAVE_SETGID
6393  if (gid == getgid()) {
6394  if (setgid(gid) < 0) rb_sys_fail(0);
6395  }
6396  else {
6397  rb_notimplement();
6398  }
6399 #else
6400  rb_notimplement();
6401 #endif
6402  return egid;
6403 }
6404 #endif
6405 
6406 #if defined(HAVE_SETRESGID) || defined(HAVE_SETREGID) || defined(HAVE_SETEGID) || defined(HAVE_SETGID)
6407 #define proc_setegid_m proc_setegid
6408 #else
6409 #define proc_setegid_m rb_f_notimplement
6410 #endif
6411 
6412 static rb_gid_t
6413 rb_setegid_core(rb_gid_t egid)
6414 {
6415 #if defined(HAVE_SETRESGID) || (defined(HAVE_SETREGID) && !defined(OBSOLETE_SETREGID))
6416  rb_gid_t gid;
6417 #endif
6418 
6419  check_gid_switch();
6420 
6421 #if defined(HAVE_SETRESGID) || (defined(HAVE_SETREGID) && !defined(OBSOLETE_SETREGID))
6422  gid = getgid();
6423 #endif
6424 
6425 #if defined(HAVE_SETRESGID)
6426  if (gid != egid) {
6427  if (setresgid(-1,egid,egid) < 0) rb_sys_fail(0);
6428  SAVED_GROUP_ID = egid;
6429  }
6430  else {
6431  if (setresgid(-1,egid,-1) < 0) rb_sys_fail(0);
6432  }
6433 #elif defined(HAVE_SETREGID) && !defined(OBSOLETE_SETREGID)
6434  if (setregid(-1, egid) < 0) rb_sys_fail(0);
6435  if (gid != egid) {
6436  if (setregid(egid,gid) < 0) rb_sys_fail(0);
6437  if (setregid(gid,egid) < 0) rb_sys_fail(0);
6438  SAVED_GROUP_ID = egid;
6439  }
6440 #elif defined HAVE_SETEGID
6441  if (setegid(egid) < 0) rb_sys_fail(0);
6442 #elif defined HAVE_SETGID
6443  if (geteuid() == 0 /* root user */) rb_sys_fail(0);
6444  if (setgid(egid) < 0) rb_sys_fail(0);
6445 #else
6446  rb_notimplement();
6447 #endif
6448  return egid;
6449 }
6450 
6451 
6452 /*
6453  * call-seq:
6454  * Process::GID.grant_privilege(group) -> fixnum
6455  * Process::GID.eid = group -> fixnum
6456  *
6457  * Set the effective group ID, and if possible, the saved group ID of
6458  * the process to the given _group_. Returns the new
6459  * effective group ID. Not available on all platforms.
6460  *
6461  * [Process.gid, Process.egid] #=> [0, 0]
6462  * Process::GID.grant_privilege(31) #=> 33
6463  * [Process.gid, Process.egid] #=> [0, 33]
6464  */
6465 
6466 static VALUE
6467 p_gid_grant_privilege(VALUE obj, VALUE id)
6468 {
6469  rb_setegid_core(OBJ2GID(id));
6470  return id;
6471 }
6472 
6473 
6474 /*
6475  * call-seq:
6476  * Process::UID.re_exchangeable? -> true or false
6477  *
6478  * Returns +true+ if the real and effective user IDs of a
6479  * process may be exchanged on the current platform.
6480  *
6481  */
6482 
6483 static VALUE
6484 p_uid_exchangeable(void)
6485 {
6486 #if defined(HAVE_SETRESUID)
6487  return Qtrue;
6488 #elif defined(HAVE_SETREUID) && !defined(OBSOLETE_SETREUID)
6489  return Qtrue;
6490 #else
6491  return Qfalse;
6492 #endif
6493 }
6494 
6495 
6496 /*
6497  * call-seq:
6498  * Process::UID.re_exchange -> fixnum
6499  *
6500  * Exchange real and effective user IDs and return the new effective
6501  * user ID. Not available on all platforms.
6502  *
6503  * [Process.uid, Process.euid] #=> [0, 31]
6504  * Process::UID.re_exchange #=> 0
6505  * [Process.uid, Process.euid] #=> [31, 0]
6506  */
6507 
6508 static VALUE
6509 p_uid_exchange(VALUE obj)
6510 {
6511  rb_uid_t uid;
6512 #if defined(HAVE_SETRESUID) || (defined(HAVE_SETREUID) && !defined(OBSOLETE_SETREUID))
6513  rb_uid_t euid;
6514 #endif
6515 
6516  check_uid_switch();
6517 
6518  uid = getuid();
6519 #if defined(HAVE_SETRESUID) || (defined(HAVE_SETREUID) && !defined(OBSOLETE_SETREUID))
6520  euid = geteuid();
6521 #endif
6522 
6523 #if defined(HAVE_SETRESUID)
6524  if (setresuid(euid, uid, uid) < 0) rb_sys_fail(0);
6525  SAVED_USER_ID = uid;
6526 #elif defined(HAVE_SETREUID) && !defined(OBSOLETE_SETREUID)
6527  if (setreuid(euid,uid) < 0) rb_sys_fail(0);
6528  SAVED_USER_ID = uid;
6529 #else
6530  rb_notimplement();
6531 #endif
6532  return UIDT2NUM(uid);
6533 }
6534 
6535 
6536 /*
6537  * call-seq:
6538  * Process::GID.re_exchangeable? -> true or false
6539  *
6540  * Returns +true+ if the real and effective group IDs of a
6541  * process may be exchanged on the current platform.
6542  *
6543  */
6544 
6545 static VALUE
6546 p_gid_exchangeable(void)
6547 {
6548 #if defined(HAVE_SETRESGID)
6549  return Qtrue;
6550 #elif defined(HAVE_SETREGID) && !defined(OBSOLETE_SETREGID)
6551  return Qtrue;
6552 #else
6553  return Qfalse;
6554 #endif
6555 }
6556 
6557 
6558 /*
6559  * call-seq:
6560  * Process::GID.re_exchange -> fixnum
6561  *
6562  * Exchange real and effective group IDs and return the new effective
6563  * group ID. Not available on all platforms.
6564  *
6565  * [Process.gid, Process.egid] #=> [0, 33]
6566  * Process::GID.re_exchange #=> 0
6567  * [Process.gid, Process.egid] #=> [33, 0]
6568  */
6569 
6570 static VALUE
6571 p_gid_exchange(VALUE obj)
6572 {
6573  rb_gid_t gid;
6574 #if defined(HAVE_SETRESGID) || (defined(HAVE_SETREGID) && !defined(OBSOLETE_SETREGID))
6575  rb_gid_t egid;
6576 #endif
6577 
6578  check_gid_switch();
6579 
6580  gid = getgid();
6581 #if defined(HAVE_SETRESGID) || (defined(HAVE_SETREGID) && !defined(OBSOLETE_SETREGID))
6582  egid = getegid();
6583 #endif
6584 
6585 #if defined(HAVE_SETRESGID)
6586  if (setresgid(egid, gid, gid) < 0) rb_sys_fail(0);
6587  SAVED_GROUP_ID = gid;
6588 #elif defined(HAVE_SETREGID) && !defined(OBSOLETE_SETREGID)
6589  if (setregid(egid,gid) < 0) rb_sys_fail(0);
6590  SAVED_GROUP_ID = gid;
6591 #else
6592  rb_notimplement();
6593 #endif
6594  return GIDT2NUM(gid);
6595 }
6596 
6597 /* [MG] :FIXME: Is this correct? I'm not sure how to phrase this. */
6598 
6599 /*
6600  * call-seq:
6601  * Process::UID.sid_available? -> true or false
6602  *
6603  * Returns +true+ if the current platform has saved user
6604  * ID functionality.
6605  *
6606  */
6607 
6608 static VALUE
6609 p_uid_have_saved_id(void)
6610 {
6611 #if defined(HAVE_SETRESUID) || defined(HAVE_SETEUID) || defined(_POSIX_SAVED_IDS)
6612  return Qtrue;
6613 #else
6614  return Qfalse;
6615 #endif
6616 }
6617 
6618 
6619 #if defined(HAVE_SETRESUID) || defined(HAVE_SETEUID) || defined(_POSIX_SAVED_IDS)
6620 static VALUE
6621 p_uid_sw_ensure(rb_uid_t id)
6622 {
6623  under_uid_switch = 0;
6624  id = rb_seteuid_core(id);
6625  return UIDT2NUM(id);
6626 }
6627 
6628 
6629 /*
6630  * call-seq:
6631  * Process::UID.switch -> fixnum
6632  * Process::UID.switch {|| block} -> object
6633  *
6634  * Switch the effective and real user IDs of the current process. If
6635  * a <em>block</em> is given, the user IDs will be switched back
6636  * after the block is executed. Returns the new effective user ID if
6637  * called without a block, and the return value of the block if one
6638  * is given.
6639  *
6640  */
6641 
6642 static VALUE
6643 p_uid_switch(VALUE obj)
6644 {
6645  rb_uid_t uid, euid;
6646 
6647  check_uid_switch();
6648 
6649  uid = getuid();
6650  euid = geteuid();
6651 
6652  if (uid != euid) {
6653  proc_seteuid(uid);
6654  if (rb_block_given_p()) {
6655  under_uid_switch = 1;
6656  return rb_ensure(rb_yield, Qnil, p_uid_sw_ensure, SAVED_USER_ID);
6657  }
6658  else {
6659  return UIDT2NUM(euid);
6660  }
6661  }
6662  else if (euid != SAVED_USER_ID) {
6663  proc_seteuid(SAVED_USER_ID);
6664  if (rb_block_given_p()) {
6665  under_uid_switch = 1;
6666  return rb_ensure(rb_yield, Qnil, p_uid_sw_ensure, euid);
6667  }
6668  else {
6669  return UIDT2NUM(uid);
6670  }
6671  }
6672  else {
6673  errno = EPERM;
6674  rb_sys_fail(0);
6675  }
6676 
6677  UNREACHABLE;
6678 }
6679 #else
6680 static VALUE
6681 p_uid_sw_ensure(VALUE obj)
6682 {
6683  under_uid_switch = 0;
6684  return p_uid_exchange(obj);
6685 }
6686 
6687 static VALUE
6688 p_uid_switch(VALUE obj)
6689 {
6690  rb_uid_t uid, euid;
6691 
6692  check_uid_switch();
6693 
6694  uid = getuid();
6695  euid = geteuid();
6696 
6697  if (uid == euid) {
6698  errno = EPERM;
6699  rb_sys_fail(0);
6700  }
6701  p_uid_exchange(obj);
6702  if (rb_block_given_p()) {
6703  under_uid_switch = 1;
6704  return rb_ensure(rb_yield, Qnil, p_uid_sw_ensure, obj);
6705  }
6706  else {
6707  return UIDT2NUM(euid);
6708  }
6709 }
6710 #endif
6711 
6712 
6713 /* [MG] :FIXME: Is this correct? I'm not sure how to phrase this. */
6714 
6715 /*
6716  * call-seq:
6717  * Process::GID.sid_available? -> true or false
6718  *
6719  * Returns +true+ if the current platform has saved group
6720  * ID functionality.
6721  *
6722  */
6723 
6724 static VALUE
6725 p_gid_have_saved_id(void)
6726 {
6727 #if defined(HAVE_SETRESGID) || defined(HAVE_SETEGID) || defined(_POSIX_SAVED_IDS)
6728  return Qtrue;
6729 #else
6730  return Qfalse;
6731 #endif
6732 }
6733 
6734 #if defined(HAVE_SETRESGID) || defined(HAVE_SETEGID) || defined(_POSIX_SAVED_IDS)
6735 static VALUE
6736 p_gid_sw_ensure(rb_gid_t id)
6737 {
6738  under_gid_switch = 0;
6739  id = rb_setegid_core(id);
6740  return GIDT2NUM(id);
6741 }
6742 
6743 
6744 /*
6745  * call-seq:
6746  * Process::GID.switch -> fixnum
6747  * Process::GID.switch {|| block} -> object
6748  *
6749  * Switch the effective and real group IDs of the current process. If
6750  * a <em>block</em> is given, the group IDs will be switched back
6751  * after the block is executed. Returns the new effective group ID if
6752  * called without a block, and the return value of the block if one
6753  * is given.
6754  *
6755  */
6756 
6757 static VALUE
6758 p_gid_switch(VALUE obj)
6759 {
6760  rb_gid_t gid, egid;
6761 
6762  check_gid_switch();
6763 
6764  gid = getgid();
6765  egid = getegid();
6766 
6767  if (gid != egid) {
6768  proc_setegid(obj, GIDT2NUM(gid));
6769  if (rb_block_given_p()) {
6770  under_gid_switch = 1;
6771  return rb_ensure(rb_yield, Qnil, p_gid_sw_ensure, SAVED_GROUP_ID);
6772  }
6773  else {
6774  return GIDT2NUM(egid);
6775  }
6776  }
6777  else if (egid != SAVED_GROUP_ID) {
6778  proc_setegid(obj, GIDT2NUM(SAVED_GROUP_ID));
6779  if (rb_block_given_p()) {
6780  under_gid_switch = 1;
6781  return rb_ensure(rb_yield, Qnil, p_gid_sw_ensure, egid);
6782  }
6783  else {
6784  return GIDT2NUM(gid);
6785  }
6786  }
6787  else {
6788  errno = EPERM;
6789  rb_sys_fail(0);
6790  }
6791 
6792  UNREACHABLE;
6793 }
6794 #else
6795 static VALUE
6796 p_gid_sw_ensure(VALUE obj)
6797 {
6798  under_gid_switch = 0;
6799  return p_gid_exchange(obj);
6800 }
6801 
6802 static VALUE
6803 p_gid_switch(VALUE obj)
6804 {
6805  rb_gid_t gid, egid;
6806 
6807  check_gid_switch();
6808 
6809  gid = getgid();
6810  egid = getegid();
6811 
6812  if (gid == egid) {
6813  errno = EPERM;
6814  rb_sys_fail(0);
6815  }
6816  p_gid_exchange(obj);
6817  if (rb_block_given_p()) {
6818  under_gid_switch = 1;
6819  return rb_ensure(rb_yield, Qnil, p_gid_sw_ensure, obj);
6820  }
6821  else {
6822  return GIDT2NUM(egid);
6823  }
6824 }
6825 #endif
6826 
6827 
6828 #if defined(HAVE_TIMES)
6829 static long
6830 get_clk_tck(void)
6831 {
6832  long hertz =
6833 #ifdef HAVE__SC_CLK_TCK
6834  (double)sysconf(_SC_CLK_TCK);
6835 #else
6836 #ifndef HZ
6837 # ifdef CLK_TCK
6838 # define HZ CLK_TCK
6839 # else
6840 # define HZ 60
6841 # endif
6842 #endif /* HZ */
6843  HZ;
6844 #endif
6845  return hertz;
6846 }
6847 
6848 /*
6849  * call-seq:
6850  * Process.times -> aProcessTms
6851  *
6852  * Returns a <code>Tms</code> structure (see <code>Process::Tms</code>)
6853  * that contains user and system CPU times for this process,
6854  * and also for children processes.
6855  *
6856  * t = Process.times
6857  * [ t.utime, t.stime, t.cutime, t.cstime ] #=> [0.0, 0.02, 0.00, 0.00]
6858  */
6859 
6860 VALUE
6861 rb_proc_times(VALUE obj)
6862 {
6863  const double hertz = get_clk_tck();
6864  struct tms buf;
6865  VALUE utime, stime, cutime, cstime, ret;
6866 
6867  times(&buf);
6868  utime = DBL2NUM(buf.tms_utime / hertz);
6869  stime = DBL2NUM(buf.tms_stime / hertz);
6870  cutime = DBL2NUM(buf.tms_cutime / hertz);
6871  cstime = DBL2NUM(buf.tms_cstime / hertz);
6872  ret = rb_struct_new(rb_cProcessTms, utime, stime, cutime, cstime);
6873  RB_GC_GUARD(utime);
6874  RB_GC_GUARD(stime);
6875  RB_GC_GUARD(cutime);
6876  RB_GC_GUARD(cstime);
6877  return ret;
6878 }
6879 #else
6880 #define rb_proc_times rb_f_notimplement
6881 #endif
6882 
6883 #ifdef HAVE_LONG_LONG
6884 typedef LONG_LONG timetick_int_t;
6885 #define TIMETICK_INT_MIN LLONG_MIN
6886 #define TIMETICK_INT_MAX LLONG_MAX
6887 #define TIMETICK_INT2NUM(v) LL2NUM(v)
6888 #else
6889 typedef long timetick_int_t;
6890 #define TIMETICK_INT_MIN LONG_MIN
6891 #define TIMETICK_INT_MAX LONG_MAX
6892 #define TIMETICK_INT2NUM(v) LONG2NUM(v)
6893 #endif
6894 
6895 static timetick_int_t
6896 gcd_timetick_int(timetick_int_t a, timetick_int_t b)
6897 {
6898  timetick_int_t t;
6899 
6900  if (a < b) {
6901  t = a;
6902  a = b;
6903  b = t;
6904  }
6905 
6906  while (1) {
6907  t = a % b;
6908  if (t == 0)
6909  return b;
6910  a = b;
6911  b = t;
6912  }
6913 }
6914 
6915 static void
6916 reduce_fraction(timetick_int_t *np, timetick_int_t *dp)
6917 {
6918  timetick_int_t gcd = gcd_timetick_int(*np, *dp);
6919  if (gcd != 1) {
6920  *np /= gcd;
6921  *dp /= gcd;
6922  }
6923 }
6924 
6925 static void
6926 reduce_factors(timetick_int_t *numerators, int num_numerators,
6927  timetick_int_t *denominators, int num_denominators)
6928 {
6929  int i, j;
6930  for (i = 0; i < num_numerators; i++) {
6931  if (numerators[i] == 1)
6932  continue;
6933  for (j = 0; j < num_denominators; j++) {
6934  if (denominators[j] == 1)
6935  continue;
6936  reduce_fraction(&numerators[i], &denominators[j]);
6937  }
6938  }
6939 }
6940 
6941 struct timetick {
6942  timetick_int_t giga_count;
6943  int32_t count; /* 0 .. 999999999 */
6944 };
6945 
6946 static VALUE
6947 timetick2dblnum(struct timetick *ttp,
6948  timetick_int_t *numerators, int num_numerators,
6949  timetick_int_t *denominators, int num_denominators)
6950 {
6951  double d;
6952  int i;
6953 
6954  reduce_factors(numerators, num_numerators,
6955  denominators, num_denominators);
6956 
6957  d = ttp->giga_count * 1e9 + ttp->count;
6958 
6959  for (i = 0; i < num_numerators; i++)
6960  d *= numerators[i];
6961  for (i = 0; i < num_denominators; i++)
6962  d /= denominators[i];
6963 
6964  return DBL2NUM(d);
6965 }
6966 
6967 static VALUE
6968 timetick2dblnum_reciprocal(struct timetick *ttp,
6969  timetick_int_t *numerators, int num_numerators,
6970  timetick_int_t *denominators, int num_denominators)
6971 {
6972  double d;
6973  int i;
6974 
6975  reduce_factors(numerators, num_numerators,
6976  denominators, num_denominators);
6977 
6978  d = 1.0;
6979  for (i = 0; i < num_denominators; i++)
6980  d *= denominators[i];
6981  for (i = 0; i < num_numerators; i++)
6982  d /= numerators[i];
6983  d /= ttp->giga_count * 1e9 + ttp->count;
6984 
6985  return DBL2NUM(d);
6986 }
6987 
6988 #define NDIV(x,y) (-(-((x)+1)/(y))-1)
6989 #define DIV(n,d) ((n)<0 ? NDIV((n),(d)) : (n)/(d))
6990 
6991 static VALUE
6992 timetick2integer(struct timetick *ttp,
6993  timetick_int_t *numerators, int num_numerators,
6994  timetick_int_t *denominators, int num_denominators)
6995 {
6996  VALUE v;
6997  int i;
6998 
6999  reduce_factors(numerators, num_numerators,
7000  denominators, num_denominators);
7001 
7002  if (!MUL_OVERFLOW_SIGNED_INTEGER_P(1000000000, ttp->giga_count,
7003  TIMETICK_INT_MIN, TIMETICK_INT_MAX-ttp->count)) {
7004  timetick_int_t t = ttp->giga_count * 1000000000 + ttp->count;
7005  for (i = 0; i < num_numerators; i++) {
7006  timetick_int_t factor = numerators[i];
7007  if (MUL_OVERFLOW_SIGNED_INTEGER_P(factor, t,
7008  TIMETICK_INT_MIN, TIMETICK_INT_MAX))
7009  goto generic;
7010  t *= factor;
7011  }
7012  for (i = 0; i < num_denominators; i++) {
7013  t = DIV(t, denominators[i]);
7014  }
7015  return TIMETICK_INT2NUM(t);
7016  }
7017 
7018  generic:
7019  v = TIMETICK_INT2NUM(ttp->giga_count);
7020  v = rb_funcall(v, '*', 1, LONG2FIX(1000000000));
7021  v = rb_funcall(v, '+', 1, LONG2FIX(ttp->count));
7022  for (i = 0; i < num_numerators; i++) {
7023  timetick_int_t factor = numerators[i];
7024  if (factor == 1)
7025  continue;
7026  v = rb_funcall(v, '*', 1, TIMETICK_INT2NUM(factor));
7027  }
7028  for (i = 0; i < num_denominators; i++) {
7029  v = rb_funcall(v, '/', 1, TIMETICK_INT2NUM(denominators[i])); /* Ruby's '/' is div. */
7030  }
7031  return v;
7032 }
7033 
7034 static VALUE
7035 make_clock_result(struct timetick *ttp,
7036  timetick_int_t *numerators, int num_numerators,
7037  timetick_int_t *denominators, int num_denominators,
7038  VALUE unit)
7039 {
7040  if (unit == ID2SYM(id_nanosecond)) {
7041  numerators[num_numerators++] = 1000000000;
7042  return timetick2integer(ttp, numerators, num_numerators, denominators, num_denominators);
7043  }
7044  else if (unit == ID2SYM(id_microsecond)) {
7045  numerators[num_numerators++] = 1000000;
7046  return timetick2integer(ttp, numerators, num_numerators, denominators, num_denominators);
7047  }
7048  else if (unit == ID2SYM(id_millisecond)) {
7049  numerators[num_numerators++] = 1000;
7050  return timetick2integer(ttp, numerators, num_numerators, denominators, num_denominators);
7051  }
7052  else if (unit == ID2SYM(id_second)) {
7053  return timetick2integer(ttp, numerators, num_numerators, denominators, num_denominators);
7054  }
7055  else if (unit == ID2SYM(id_float_microsecond)) {
7056  numerators[num_numerators++] = 1000000;
7057  return timetick2dblnum(ttp, numerators, num_numerators, denominators, num_denominators);
7058  }
7059  else if (unit == ID2SYM(id_float_millisecond)) {
7060  numerators[num_numerators++] = 1000;
7061  return timetick2dblnum(ttp, numerators, num_numerators, denominators, num_denominators);
7062  }
7063  else if (NIL_P(unit) || unit == ID2SYM(id_float_second)) {
7064  return timetick2dblnum(ttp, numerators, num_numerators, denominators, num_denominators);
7065  }
7066  else
7067  rb_raise(rb_eArgError, "unexpected unit: %"PRIsVALUE, unit);
7068 }
7069 
7070 #ifdef __APPLE__
7071 static mach_timebase_info_data_t *
7072 get_mach_timebase_info(void)
7073 {
7074  static mach_timebase_info_data_t sTimebaseInfo;
7075 
7076  if ( sTimebaseInfo.denom == 0 ) {
7077  (void) mach_timebase_info(&sTimebaseInfo);
7078  }
7079 
7080  return &sTimebaseInfo;
7081 }
7082 #endif
7083 
7084 /*
7085  * call-seq:
7086  * Process.clock_gettime(clock_id [, unit]) -> number
7087  *
7088  * Returns a time returned by POSIX clock_gettime() function.
7089  *
7090  * p Process.clock_gettime(Process::CLOCK_MONOTONIC)
7091  * #=> 896053.968060096
7092  *
7093  * +clock_id+ specifies a kind of clock.
7094  * It is specifed as a constant which begins with <code>Process::CLOCK_</code>
7095  * such as Process::CLOCK_REALTIME and Process::CLOCK_MONOTONIC.
7096  *
7097  * The supported constants depends on OS and version.
7098  * Ruby provides following types of +clock_id+ if available.
7099  *
7100  * [CLOCK_REALTIME] SUSv2 to 4, Linux 2.5.63, FreeBSD 3.0, NetBSD 2.0, OpenBSD 2.1
7101  * [CLOCK_MONOTONIC] SUSv3 to 4, Linux 2.5.63, FreeBSD 3.0, NetBSD 2.0, OpenBSD 3.4
7102  * [CLOCK_PROCESS_CPUTIME_ID] SUSv3 to 4, Linux 2.5.63, OpenBSD 5.4
7103  * [CLOCK_THREAD_CPUTIME_ID] SUSv3 to 4, Linux 2.5.63, FreeBSD 7.1, OpenBSD 5.4
7104  * [CLOCK_VIRTUAL] FreeBSD 3.0, OpenBSD 2.1
7105  * [CLOCK_PROF] FreeBSD 3.0, OpenBSD 2.1
7106  * [CLOCK_REALTIME_FAST] FreeBSD 8.1
7107  * [CLOCK_REALTIME_PRECISE] FreeBSD 8.1
7108  * [CLOCK_REALTIME_COARSE] Linux 2.6.32
7109  * [CLOCK_REALTIME_ALARM] Linux 3.0
7110  * [CLOCK_MONOTONIC_FAST] FreeBSD 8.1
7111  * [CLOCK_MONOTONIC_PRECISE] FreeBSD 8.1
7112  * [CLOCK_MONOTONIC_COARSE] Linux 2.6.32
7113  * [CLOCK_MONOTONIC_RAW] Linux 2.6.28
7114  * [CLOCK_BOOTTIME] Linux 2.6.39
7115  * [CLOCK_BOOTTIME_ALARM] Linux 3.0
7116  * [CLOCK_UPTIME] FreeBSD 7.0, OpenBSD 5.5
7117  * [CLOCK_UPTIME_FAST] FreeBSD 8.1
7118  * [CLOCK_UPTIME_PRECISE] FreeBSD 8.1
7119  * [CLOCK_SECOND] FreeBSD 8.1
7120  *
7121  * Note that SUS stands for Single Unix Specification.
7122  * SUS contains POSIX and clock_gettime is defined in the POSIX part.
7123  * SUS defines CLOCK_REALTIME mandatory but
7124  * CLOCK_MONOTONIC, CLOCK_PROCESS_CPUTIME_ID and CLOCK_THREAD_CPUTIME_ID are optional.
7125  *
7126  * Also, several symbols are accepted as +clock_id+.
7127  * There are emulations for clock_gettime().
7128  *
7129  * For example, Process::CLOCK_REALTIME is defined as
7130  * +:GETTIMEOFDAY_BASED_CLOCK_REALTIME+ when clock_gettime() is not available.
7131  *
7132  * Emulations for +CLOCK_REALTIME+:
7133  * [:GETTIMEOFDAY_BASED_CLOCK_REALTIME]
7134  * Use gettimeofday() defined by SUS.
7135  * (SUSv4 obsoleted it, though.)
7136  * The resolution is 1 microsecond.
7137  * [:TIME_BASED_CLOCK_REALTIME]
7138  * Use time() defined by ISO C.
7139  * The resolution is 1 second.
7140  *
7141  * Emulations for +CLOCK_MONOTONIC+:
7142  * [:MACH_ABSOLUTE_TIME_BASED_CLOCK_MONOTONIC]
7143  * Use mach_absolute_time(), available on Darwin.
7144  * The resolution is CPU dependent.
7145  * [:TIMES_BASED_CLOCK_MONOTONIC]
7146  * Use the result value of times() defined by POSIX.
7147  * POSIX defines it as "times() shall return the elapsed real time, in clock ticks, since an arbitrary point in the past (for example, system start-up time)".
7148  * For example, GNU/Linux returns a value based on jiffies and it is monotonic.
7149  * However, 4.4BSD uses gettimeofday() and it is not monotonic.
7150  * (FreeBSD uses clock_gettime(CLOCK_MONOTONIC) instead, though.)
7151  * The resolution is the clock tick.
7152  * "getconf CLK_TCK" command shows the clock ticks per second.
7153  * (The clock ticks per second is defined by HZ macro in older systems.)
7154  * If it is 100 and clock_t is 32 bits integer type, the resolution is 10 millisecond and
7155  * cannot represent over 497 days.
7156  *
7157  * Emulations for +CLOCK_PROCESS_CPUTIME_ID+:
7158  * [:GETRUSAGE_BASED_CLOCK_PROCESS_CPUTIME_ID]
7159  * Use getrusage() defined by SUS.
7160  * getrusage() is used with RUSAGE_SELF to obtain the time only for
7161  * the calling process (excluding the time for child processes).
7162  * The result is addition of user time (ru_utime) and system time (ru_stime).
7163  * The resolution is 1 microsecond.
7164  * [:TIMES_BASED_CLOCK_PROCESS_CPUTIME_ID]
7165  * Use times() defined by POSIX.
7166  * The result is addition of user time (tms_utime) and system time (tms_stime).
7167  * tms_cutime and tms_cstime are ignored to exclude the time for child processes.
7168  * The resolution is the clock tick.
7169  * "getconf CLK_TCK" command shows the clock ticks per second.
7170  * (The clock ticks per second is defined by HZ macro in older systems.)
7171  * If it is 100, the resolution is 10 millisecond.
7172  * [:CLOCK_BASED_CLOCK_PROCESS_CPUTIME_ID]
7173  * Use clock() defined by ISO C.
7174  * The resolution is 1/CLOCKS_PER_SEC.
7175  * CLOCKS_PER_SEC is the C-level macro defined by time.h.
7176  * SUS defines CLOCKS_PER_SEC is 1000000.
7177  * Non-Unix systems may define it a different value, though.
7178  * If CLOCKS_PER_SEC is 1000000 as SUS, the resolution is 1 microsecond.
7179  * If CLOCKS_PER_SEC is 1000000 and clock_t is 32 bits integer type, it cannot represent over 72 minutes.
7180  *
7181  * If the given +clock_id+ is not supported, Errno::EINVAL is raised.
7182  *
7183  * +unit+ specifies a type of the return value.
7184  *
7185  * [:float_second] number of seconds as a float (default)
7186  * [:float_millisecond] number of milliseconds as a float
7187  * [:float_microsecond] number of microseconds as a float
7188  * [:second] number of seconds as an integer
7189  * [:millisecond] number of milliseconds as an integer
7190  * [:microsecond] number of microseconds as an integer
7191  * [:nanosecond] number of nanoseconds as an integer
7192  *
7193  * The underlying function, clock_gettime(), returns a number of nanoseconds.
7194  * Float object (IEEE 754 double) is not enough to represent
7195  * the return value for CLOCK_REALTIME.
7196  * If the exact nanoseconds value is required, use +:nanoseconds+ as the +unit+.
7197  *
7198  * The origin (zero) of the returned value varies.
7199  * For example, system start up time, process start up time, the Epoch, etc.
7200  *
7201  * The origin in CLOCK_REALTIME is defined as the Epoch
7202  * (1970-01-01 00:00:00 UTC).
7203  * But some systems count leap seconds and others doesn't.
7204  * So the result can be interpreted differently across systems.
7205  * Time.now is recommended over CLOCK_REALTIME.
7206  */
7207 VALUE
7208 rb_clock_gettime(int argc, VALUE *argv)
7209 {
7210  VALUE clk_id, unit;
7211  int ret;
7212 
7213  struct timetick tt;
7214  timetick_int_t numerators[2];
7215  timetick_int_t denominators[2];
7216  int num_numerators = 0;
7217  int num_denominators = 0;
7218 
7219  rb_scan_args(argc, argv, "11", &clk_id, &unit);
7220 
7221  if (SYMBOL_P(clk_id)) {
7222  /*
7223  * Non-clock_gettime clocks are provided by symbol clk_id.
7224  *
7225  * gettimeofday is always available on platforms supported by Ruby.
7226  * GETTIMEOFDAY_BASED_CLOCK_REALTIME is used for
7227  * CLOCK_REALTIME if clock_gettime is not available.
7228  */
7229 #define RUBY_GETTIMEOFDAY_BASED_CLOCK_REALTIME ID2SYM(id_GETTIMEOFDAY_BASED_CLOCK_REALTIME)
7230  if (clk_id == RUBY_GETTIMEOFDAY_BASED_CLOCK_REALTIME) {
7231  struct timeval tv;
7232  ret = gettimeofday(&tv, 0);
7233  if (ret != 0)
7234  rb_sys_fail("gettimeofday");
7235  tt.giga_count = tv.tv_sec;
7236  tt.count = (int32_t)tv.tv_usec * 1000;
7237  denominators[num_denominators++] = 1000000000;
7238  goto success;
7239  }
7240 
7241 #define RUBY_TIME_BASED_CLOCK_REALTIME ID2SYM(id_TIME_BASED_CLOCK_REALTIME)
7242  if (clk_id == RUBY_TIME_BASED_CLOCK_REALTIME) {
7243  time_t t;
7244  t = time(NULL);
7245  if (t == (time_t)-1)
7246  rb_sys_fail("time");
7247  tt.giga_count = t;
7248  tt.count = 0;
7249  denominators[num_denominators++] = 1000000000;
7250  goto success;
7251  }
7252 
7253 #ifdef HAVE_TIMES
7254 #define RUBY_TIMES_BASED_CLOCK_MONOTONIC \
7255  ID2SYM(id_TIMES_BASED_CLOCK_MONOTONIC)
7256  if (clk_id == RUBY_TIMES_BASED_CLOCK_MONOTONIC) {
7257  struct tms buf;
7258  clock_t c;
7259  unsigned_clock_t uc;
7260  c = times(&buf);
7261  if (c == (clock_t)-1)
7262  rb_sys_fail("times");
7263  uc = (unsigned_clock_t)c;
7264  tt.count = (int32_t)(uc % 1000000000);
7265  tt.giga_count = (uc / 1000000000);
7266  denominators[num_denominators++] = get_clk_tck();
7267  goto success;
7268  }
7269 #endif
7270 
7271 #ifdef RUSAGE_SELF
7272 #define RUBY_GETRUSAGE_BASED_CLOCK_PROCESS_CPUTIME_ID \
7273  ID2SYM(id_GETRUSAGE_BASED_CLOCK_PROCESS_CPUTIME_ID)
7274  if (clk_id == RUBY_GETRUSAGE_BASED_CLOCK_PROCESS_CPUTIME_ID) {
7275  struct rusage usage;
7276  int32_t usec;
7277  ret = getrusage(RUSAGE_SELF, &usage);
7278  if (ret != 0)
7279  rb_sys_fail("getrusage");
7280  tt.giga_count = usage.ru_utime.tv_sec + usage.ru_stime.tv_sec;
7281  usec = (int32_t)(usage.ru_utime.tv_usec + usage.ru_stime.tv_usec);
7282  if (1000000 <= usec) {
7283  tt.giga_count++;
7284  usec -= 1000000;
7285  }
7286  tt.count = usec * 1000;
7287  denominators[num_denominators++] = 1000000000;
7288  goto success;
7289  }
7290 #endif
7291 
7292 #ifdef HAVE_TIMES
7293 #define RUBY_TIMES_BASED_CLOCK_PROCESS_CPUTIME_ID \
7294  ID2SYM(id_TIMES_BASED_CLOCK_PROCESS_CPUTIME_ID)
7295  if (clk_id == RUBY_TIMES_BASED_CLOCK_PROCESS_CPUTIME_ID) {
7296  struct tms buf;
7297  unsigned_clock_t utime, stime;
7298  if (times(&buf) == (clock_t)-1)
7299  rb_sys_fail("times");
7300  utime = (unsigned_clock_t)buf.tms_utime;
7301  stime = (unsigned_clock_t)buf.tms_stime;
7302  tt.count = (int32_t)((utime % 1000000000) + (stime % 1000000000));
7303  tt.giga_count = (utime / 1000000000) + (stime / 1000000000);
7304  if (1000000000 <= tt.count) {
7305  tt.count -= 1000000000;
7306  tt.giga_count++;
7307  }
7308  denominators[num_denominators++] = get_clk_tck();
7309  goto success;
7310  }
7311 #endif
7312 
7313 #define RUBY_CLOCK_BASED_CLOCK_PROCESS_CPUTIME_ID \
7314  ID2SYM(id_CLOCK_BASED_CLOCK_PROCESS_CPUTIME_ID)
7315  if (clk_id == RUBY_CLOCK_BASED_CLOCK_PROCESS_CPUTIME_ID) {
7316  clock_t c;
7317  unsigned_clock_t uc;
7318  errno = 0;
7319  c = clock();
7320  if (c == (clock_t)-1)
7321  rb_sys_fail("clock");
7322  uc = (unsigned_clock_t)c;
7323  tt.count = (int32_t)(uc % 1000000000);
7324  tt.giga_count = uc / 1000000000;
7325  denominators[num_denominators++] = CLOCKS_PER_SEC;
7326  goto success;
7327  }
7328 
7329 #ifdef __APPLE__
7330 #define RUBY_MACH_ABSOLUTE_TIME_BASED_CLOCK_MONOTONIC ID2SYM(id_MACH_ABSOLUTE_TIME_BASED_CLOCK_MONOTONIC)
7331  if (clk_id == RUBY_MACH_ABSOLUTE_TIME_BASED_CLOCK_MONOTONIC) {
7332  mach_timebase_info_data_t *info = get_mach_timebase_info();
7333  uint64_t t = mach_absolute_time();
7334  tt.count = (int32_t)(t % 1000000000);
7335  tt.giga_count = t / 1000000000;
7336  numerators[num_numerators++] = info->numer;
7337  denominators[num_denominators++] = info->denom;
7338  denominators[num_denominators++] = 1000000000;
7339  goto success;
7340  }
7341 #endif
7342  }
7343  else {
7344 #if defined(HAVE_CLOCK_GETTIME)
7345  struct timespec ts;
7346  clockid_t c;
7347  c = NUM2CLOCKID(clk_id);
7348  ret = clock_gettime(c, &ts);
7349  if (ret == -1)
7350  rb_sys_fail("clock_gettime");
7351  tt.count = (int32_t)ts.tv_nsec;
7352  tt.giga_count = ts.tv_sec;
7353  denominators[num_denominators++] = 1000000000;
7354  goto success;
7355 #endif
7356  }
7357  /* EINVAL emulates clock_gettime behavior when clock_id is invalid. */
7358  errno = EINVAL;
7359  rb_sys_fail(0);
7360 
7361  success:
7362  return make_clock_result(&tt, numerators, num_numerators, denominators, num_denominators, unit);
7363 }
7364 
7365 /*
7366  * call-seq:
7367  * Process.clock_getres(clock_id [, unit]) -> number
7368  *
7369  * Returns the time resolution returned by POSIX clock_getres() function.
7370  *
7371  * +clock_id+ specifies a kind of clock.
7372  * See the document of +Process.clock_gettime+ for details.
7373  *
7374  * +clock_id+ can be a symbol as +Process.clock_gettime+.
7375  * However the result may not be accurate.
7376  * For example, +Process.clock_getres(:GETTIMEOFDAY_BASED_CLOCK_REALTIME)+
7377  * returns 1.0e-06 which means 1 microsecond, but actual resolution can be more coarse.
7378  *
7379  * If the given +clock_id+ is not supported, Errno::EINVAL is raised.
7380  *
7381  * +unit+ specifies a type of the return value.
7382  * +Process.clock_getres+ accepts +unit+ as +Process.clock_gettime+.
7383  * The default value, +:float_second+, is also same as
7384  * +Process.clock_gettime+.
7385  *
7386  * +Process.clock_getres+ also accepts +:hertz+ as +unit+.
7387  * +:hertz+ means a the reciprocal of +:float_second+.
7388  *
7389  * +:hertz+ can be used to obtain the exact value of
7390  * the clock ticks per second for times() function and
7391  * CLOCKS_PER_SEC for clock() function.
7392  *
7393  * +Process.clock_getres(:TIMES_BASED_CLOCK_PROCESS_CPUTIME_ID, :hertz)+
7394  * returns the clock ticks per second.
7395  *
7396  * +Process.clock_getres(:CLOCK_BASED_CLOCK_PROCESS_CPUTIME_ID, :hertz)+
7397  * returns CLOCKS_PER_SEC.
7398  *
7399  * p Process.clock_getres(Process::CLOCK_MONOTONIC)
7400  * #=> 1.0e-09
7401  *
7402  */
7403 VALUE
7404 rb_clock_getres(int argc, VALUE *argv)
7405 {
7406  VALUE clk_id, unit;
7407 
7408  struct timetick tt;
7409  timetick_int_t numerators[2];
7410  timetick_int_t denominators[2];
7411  int num_numerators = 0;
7412  int num_denominators = 0;
7413 
7414  rb_scan_args(argc, argv, "11", &clk_id, &unit);
7415 
7416  if (SYMBOL_P(clk_id)) {
7417 #ifdef RUBY_GETTIMEOFDAY_BASED_CLOCK_REALTIME
7418  if (clk_id == RUBY_GETTIMEOFDAY_BASED_CLOCK_REALTIME) {
7419  tt.giga_count = 0;
7420  tt.count = 1000;
7421  denominators[num_denominators++] = 1000000000;
7422  goto success;
7423  }
7424 #endif
7425 
7426 #ifdef RUBY_TIME_BASED_CLOCK_REALTIME
7427  if (clk_id == RUBY_TIME_BASED_CLOCK_REALTIME) {
7428  tt.giga_count = 1;
7429  tt.count = 0;
7430  denominators[num_denominators++] = 1000000000;
7431  goto success;
7432  }
7433 #endif
7434 
7435 #ifdef RUBY_TIMES_BASED_CLOCK_MONOTONIC
7436  if (clk_id == RUBY_TIMES_BASED_CLOCK_MONOTONIC) {
7437  tt.count = 1;
7438  tt.giga_count = 0;
7439  denominators[num_denominators++] = get_clk_tck();
7440  goto success;
7441  }
7442 #endif
7443 
7444 #ifdef RUBY_GETRUSAGE_BASED_CLOCK_PROCESS_CPUTIME_ID
7445  if (clk_id == RUBY_GETRUSAGE_BASED_CLOCK_PROCESS_CPUTIME_ID) {
7446  tt.giga_count = 0;
7447  tt.count = 1000;
7448  denominators[num_denominators++] = 1000000000;
7449  goto success;
7450  }
7451 #endif
7452 
7453 #ifdef RUBY_TIMES_BASED_CLOCK_PROCESS_CPUTIME_ID
7454  if (clk_id == RUBY_TIMES_BASED_CLOCK_PROCESS_CPUTIME_ID) {
7455  tt.count = 1;
7456  tt.giga_count = 0;
7457  denominators[num_denominators++] = get_clk_tck();
7458  goto success;
7459  }
7460 #endif
7461 
7462 #ifdef RUBY_CLOCK_BASED_CLOCK_PROCESS_CPUTIME_ID
7463  if (clk_id == RUBY_CLOCK_BASED_CLOCK_PROCESS_CPUTIME_ID) {
7464  tt.count = 1;
7465  tt.giga_count = 0;
7466  denominators[num_denominators++] = CLOCKS_PER_SEC;
7467  goto success;
7468  }
7469 #endif
7470 
7471 #ifdef RUBY_MACH_ABSOLUTE_TIME_BASED_CLOCK_MONOTONIC
7472  if (clk_id == RUBY_MACH_ABSOLUTE_TIME_BASED_CLOCK_MONOTONIC) {
7473  mach_timebase_info_data_t *info = get_mach_timebase_info();
7474  tt.count = 1;
7475  tt.giga_count = 0;
7476  numerators[num_numerators++] = info->numer;
7477  denominators[num_denominators++] = info->denom;
7478  denominators[num_denominators++] = 1000000000;
7479  goto success;
7480  }
7481 #endif
7482  }
7483  else {
7484 #if defined(HAVE_CLOCK_GETRES)
7485  struct timespec ts;
7486  clockid_t c = NUM2CLOCKID(clk_id);
7487  int ret = clock_getres(c, &ts);
7488  if (ret == -1)
7489  rb_sys_fail("clock_getres");
7490  tt.count = (int32_t)ts.tv_nsec;
7491  tt.giga_count = ts.tv_sec;
7492  denominators[num_denominators++] = 1000000000;
7493  goto success;
7494 #endif
7495  }
7496  /* EINVAL emulates clock_getres behavior when clock_id is invalid. */
7497  errno = EINVAL;
7498  rb_sys_fail(0);
7499 
7500  success:
7501  if (unit == ID2SYM(id_hertz)) {
7502  return timetick2dblnum_reciprocal(&tt, numerators, num_numerators, denominators, num_denominators);
7503  }
7504  else {
7505  return make_clock_result(&tt, numerators, num_numerators, denominators, num_denominators, unit);
7506  }
7507 }
7508 
7509 VALUE rb_mProcess;
7510 VALUE rb_mProcUID;
7511 VALUE rb_mProcGID;
7512 VALUE rb_mProcID_Syscall;
7513 
7514 
7515 /*
7516  * The <code>Process</code> module is a collection of methods used to
7517  * manipulate processes.
7518  */
7519 
7520 void
7521 InitVM_process(void)
7522 {
7523 #undef rb_intern
7524 #define rb_intern(str) rb_intern_const(str)
7525  rb_define_virtual_variable("$?", rb_last_status_get, 0);
7526  rb_define_virtual_variable("$$", get_pid, 0);
7527  rb_define_global_function("exec", rb_f_exec, -1);
7528  rb_define_global_function("fork", rb_f_fork, 0);
7529  rb_define_global_function("exit!", rb_f_exit_bang, -1);
7530  rb_define_global_function("system", rb_f_system, -1);
7531  rb_define_global_function("spawn", rb_f_spawn, -1);
7532  rb_define_global_function("sleep", rb_f_sleep, -1);
7533  rb_define_global_function("exit", rb_f_exit, -1);
7534  rb_define_global_function("abort", rb_f_abort, -1);
7535 
7536  rb_mProcess = rb_define_module("Process");
7537 
7538 #ifdef WNOHANG
7539  /* see Process.wait */
7540  rb_define_const(rb_mProcess, "WNOHANG", INT2FIX(WNOHANG));
7541 #else
7542  /* see Process.wait */
7543  rb_define_const(rb_mProcess, "WNOHANG", INT2FIX(0));
7544 #endif
7545 #ifdef WUNTRACED
7546  /* see Process.wait */
7547  rb_define_const(rb_mProcess, "WUNTRACED", INT2FIX(WUNTRACED));
7548 #else
7549  /* see Process.wait */
7550  rb_define_const(rb_mProcess, "WUNTRACED", INT2FIX(0));
7551 #endif
7552 
7553  rb_define_singleton_method(rb_mProcess, "exec", rb_f_exec, -1);
7554  rb_define_singleton_method(rb_mProcess, "fork", rb_f_fork, 0);
7555  rb_define_singleton_method(rb_mProcess, "spawn", rb_f_spawn, -1);
7556  rb_define_singleton_method(rb_mProcess, "exit!", rb_f_exit_bang, -1);
7557  rb_define_singleton_method(rb_mProcess, "exit", rb_f_exit, -1);
7558  rb_define_singleton_method(rb_mProcess, "abort", rb_f_abort, -1);
7559 
7560  rb_define_module_function(rb_mProcess, "kill", rb_f_kill, -1); /* in signal.c */
7561  rb_define_module_function(rb_mProcess, "wait", proc_wait, -1);
7562  rb_define_module_function(rb_mProcess, "wait2", proc_wait2, -1);
7563  rb_define_module_function(rb_mProcess, "waitpid", proc_wait, -1);
7564  rb_define_module_function(rb_mProcess, "waitpid2", proc_wait2, -1);
7565  rb_define_module_function(rb_mProcess, "waitall", proc_waitall, 0);
7566  rb_define_module_function(rb_mProcess, "detach", proc_detach, 1);
7567

7569  rb_undef_alloc_func(rb_cWaiter);
7570  rb_undef_method(CLASS_OF(rb_cWaiter), "new");
7571  rb_define_method(rb_cWaiter, "pid", detach_process_pid, 0);

7609  /* see Process.setpriority */

7617  rb_define_module_function(rb_mProcess, "getrlimit", proc_getrlimit, 1);
7618  rb_define_module_function(rb_mProcess, "setrlimit", proc_setrlimit, -1);
7619 #if defined(RLIM2NUM) && defined(RLIM_INFINITY)
7620  {
7621  VALUE inf = RLIM2NUM(RLIM_INFINITY);
7622 #ifdef RLIM_SAVED_MAX
7623  {
7624  VALUE v = RLIM_INFINITY == RLIM_SAVED_MAX ? inf : RLIM2NUM(RLIM_SAVED_MAX);
7625  /* see Process.setrlimit */
7626  rb_define_const(rb_mProcess, "RLIM_SAVED_MAX", v);
7627  }
7628 #endif
7629  /* see Process.setrlimit */
7630  rb_define_const(rb_mProcess, "RLIM_INFINITY", inf);
7631 #ifdef RLIM_SAVED_CUR
7632  {
7633  VALUE v = RLIM_INFINITY == RLIM_SAVED_CUR ? inf : RLIM2NUM(RLIM_SAVED_CUR);
7634  /* see Process.setrlimit */
7635  rb_define_const(rb_mProcess, "RLIM_SAVED_CUR", v);
7636  }
7637 #endif
7638  }
7639 #ifdef RLIMIT_AS
7640  /* Maximum size of the process's virtual memory (address space) in bytes.
7641  *
7642  * see the system getrlimit(2) manual for details.
7643  */
7644  rb_define_const(rb_mProcess, "RLIMIT_AS", INT2FIX(RLIMIT_AS));
7645 #endif
7646 #ifdef RLIMIT_CORE
7647  /* Maximum size of the core file.
7648  *
7649  * see the system getrlimit(2) manual for details.
7650  */
7651  rb_define_const(rb_mProcess, "RLIMIT_CORE", INT2FIX(RLIMIT_CORE));
7652 #endif
7653 #ifdef RLIMIT_CPU
7654  /* CPU time limit in seconds.
7655  *
7656  * see the system getrlimit(2) manual for details.
7657  */
7658  rb_define_const(rb_mProcess, "RLIMIT_CPU", INT2FIX(RLIMIT_CPU));
7659 #endif
7660 #ifdef RLIMIT_DATA
7661  /* Maximum size of the process's data segment.
7662  *
7663  * see the system getrlimit(2) manual for details.
7664  */
7665  rb_define_const(rb_mProcess, "RLIMIT_DATA", INT2FIX(RLIMIT_DATA));
7666 #endif
7667 #ifdef RLIMIT_FSIZE
7668  /* Maximum size of files that the process may create.
7669  *
7670  * see the system getrlimit(2) manual for details.
7671  */
7672  rb_define_const(rb_mProcess, "RLIMIT_FSIZE", INT2FIX(RLIMIT_FSIZE));
7673 #endif
7674 #ifdef RLIMIT_MEMLOCK
7675  /* Maximum number of bytes of memory that may be locked into RAM.
7676  *
7677  * see the system getrlimit(2) manual for details.
7678  */
7679  rb_define_const(rb_mProcess, "RLIMIT_MEMLOCK", INT2FIX(RLIMIT_MEMLOCK));
7680 #endif
7681 #ifdef RLIMIT_MSGQUEUE
7682  /* Specifies the limit on the number of bytes that can be allocated
7683  * for POSIX message queues for the real user ID of the calling process.
7684  *
7685  * see the system getrlimit(2) manual for details.
7686  */
7687  rb_define_const(rb_mProcess, "RLIMIT_MSGQUEUE", INT2FIX(RLIMIT_MSGQUEUE));
7688 #endif
7689 #ifdef RLIMIT_NICE
7690  /* Specifies a ceiling to which the process's nice value can be raised.
7691  *
7692  * see the system getrlimit(2) manual for details.
7693  */
7694  rb_define_const(rb_mProcess, "RLIMIT_NICE", INT2FIX(RLIMIT_NICE));
7695 #endif
7696 #ifdef RLIMIT_NOFILE
7697  /* Specifies a value one greater than the maximum file descriptor
7698  * number that can be opened by this process.
7699  *
7700  * see the system getrlimit(2) manual for details.
7701  */
7702  rb_define_const(rb_mProcess, "RLIMIT_NOFILE", INT2FIX(RLIMIT_NOFILE));
7703 #endif
7704 #ifdef RLIMIT_NPROC
7705  /* The maximum number of processes that can be created for the
7706  * real user ID of the calling process.
7707  *
7708  * see the system getrlimit(2) manual for details.
7709  */
7710  rb_define_const(rb_mProcess, "RLIMIT_NPROC", INT2FIX(RLIMIT_NPROC));
7711 #endif
7712 #ifdef RLIMIT_RSS
7713  /* Specifies the limit (in pages) of the process's resident set.
7714  *
7715  * see the system getrlimit(2) manual for details.
7716  */
7717  rb_define_const(rb_mProcess, "RLIMIT_RSS", INT2FIX(RLIMIT_RSS));
7718 #endif
7719 #ifdef RLIMIT_RTPRIO
7720  /* Specifies a ceiling on the real-time priority that may be set for this process.
7721  *
7722  * see the system getrlimit(2) manual for details.
7723  */
7724  rb_define_const(rb_mProcess, "RLIMIT_RTPRIO", INT2FIX(RLIMIT_RTPRIO));
7725 #endif
7726 #ifdef RLIMIT_RTTIME
7727  /* Specifies limit on CPU time this process scheduled under a real-time
7728  * scheduling policy can consume.
7729  *
7730  * see the system getrlimit(2) manual for details.
7731  */
7732  rb_define_const(rb_mProcess, "RLIMIT_RTTIME", INT2FIX(RLIMIT_RTTIME));
7733 #endif
7734 #ifdef RLIMIT_SBSIZE
7735  /* Maximum size of the socket buffer.
7736  */
7737  rb_define_const(rb_mProcess, "RLIMIT_SBSIZE", INT2FIX(RLIMIT_SBSIZE));
7738 #endif
7739 #ifdef RLIMIT_SIGPENDING
7740  /* Specifies a limit on the number of signals that may be queued for
7741  * the real user ID of the calling process.
7742  *
7743  * see the system getrlimit(2) manual for details.
7744  */
7745  rb_define_const(rb_mProcess, "RLIMIT_SIGPENDING", INT2FIX(RLIMIT_SIGPENDING));
7746 #endif
7747 #ifdef RLIMIT_STACK
7748  /* Maximum size of the stack, in bytes.
7749  *
7750  * see the system getrlimit(2) manual for details.
7751  */
7752  rb_define_const(rb_mProcess, "RLIMIT_STACK", INT2FIX(RLIMIT_STACK));
7753 #endif
7754 #endif

7903 void
7904 Init_process(void)
7905 {
7906  id_in = rb_intern("in");
7907  id_out = rb_intern("out");
7908  id_err = rb_intern("err");
7909  id_pid = rb_intern("pid");
7910  id_uid = rb_intern("uid");
7911  id_gid = rb_intern("gid");
7912  id_close = rb_intern("close");
7913  id_child = rb_intern("child");
7914 #ifdef HAVE_SETPGID
7915  id_pgroup = rb_intern("pgroup");
7916 #endif
7917 #ifdef _WIN32
7918  id_new_pgroup = rb_intern("new_pgroup");
7919 #endif
7920  id_unsetenv_others = rb_intern("unsetenv_others");
7921  id_chdir = rb_intern("chdir");
7922  id_umask = rb_intern("umask");
7923  id_close_others = rb_intern("close_others");
7924  id_ENV = rb_intern("ENV");
7925  id_nanosecond = rb_intern("nanosecond");
7926  id_microsecond = rb_intern("microsecond");
7927  id_millisecond = rb_intern("millisecond");
7928  id_second = rb_intern("second");
7929  id_float_microsecond = rb_intern("float_microsecond");
7930  id_float_millisecond = rb_intern("float_millisecond");
7931  id_float_second = rb_intern("float_second");
7932  id_GETTIMEOFDAY_BASED_CLOCK_REALTIME = rb_intern("GETTIMEOFDAY_BASED_CLOCK_REALTIME");
7933  id_TIME_BASED_CLOCK_REALTIME = rb_intern("TIME_BASED_CLOCK_REALTIME");
7934 #ifdef HAVE_TIMES
7935  id_TIMES_BASED_CLOCK_MONOTONIC = rb_intern("TIMES_BASED_CLOCK_MONOTONIC");
7936  id_TIMES_BASED_CLOCK_PROCESS_CPUTIME_ID = rb_intern("TIMES_BASED_CLOCK_PROCESS_CPUTIME_ID");
7937 #endif
7938 #ifdef RUSAGE_SELF
7939  id_GETRUSAGE_BASED_CLOCK_PROCESS_CPUTIME_ID = rb_intern("GETRUSAGE_BASED_CLOCK_PROCESS_CPUTIME_ID");
7940 #endif
7941  id_CLOCK_BASED_CLOCK_PROCESS_CPUTIME_ID = rb_intern("CLOCK_BASED_CLOCK_PROCESS_CPUTIME_ID");
7942 #ifdef __APPLE__
7943  id_MACH_ABSOLUTE_TIME_BASED_CLOCK_MONOTONIC = rb_intern("MACH_ABSOLUTE_TIME_BASED_CLOCK_MONOTONIC");
7944 #endif
7945  id_hertz = rb_intern("hertz");
7946 
7947  InitVM(process);
7948 }
